translation:
adj. 渴望的; 热切的，热情洋溢的; 热心的; 急切

分布：热切的(53%)，渴望的(47%)


→来自词根ac, 尖，刺，词源同acid, acumen.
a.(for)渴望的,热切的The eagle is eager to anger the tiger in danger.鹰渴望激怒处在危险中的老虎.



US [-gɚ] adjective  IMPROVER  ■wanting very much to do or have something, especially something interesting or enjoyable （尤指对于有趣的或者愉快的事情）热切的，渴望的
•the children's eager faces孩子们那一脸渴望的神情

•[+ to infinitive] She sounded very eager to meet you.听得出来她非常渴望见到你。

•They crowded round the spokesperson, eager for any news.他们把发言人围了个水泄不通，渴望能得到点消息。





anxious, keen, eager

这组词都有“急切的，渴望的”的意思，其区别是：
anxious: 强调因忧虑、关注或害怕而产生的急切心情。
keen: 强调因兴趣强烈或欲望而急于做某事。
eager: 侧重于急于成功的迫切心情。


adj. 渴望的；热切的；热心的
 - hungry, desired, anxious, sick, keen
examples: (1) He is eager for you to meet his friends.(2) Eager fans mobbed the popular singer.(3) The boys listened to my story with eager attention.(4) He was eager to see her.(5) The company is eager to expand into new markets.
(1) 他热切希望你见见他的朋友。(2) 热切的歌迷们团团围住住这位流行歌手(3) 男孩们以热切的心情非常注意地倾听我的故事。(4) 他渴望见到她。(5) 那家公司急欲开辟新的市场。

translation:
n. 鹰; 鹰状标志; [高]比标准杆少两杆的分数
v. [高]低于标准杆数两杆

时态：eagled, eagling, eagles
分布：鹰(100%)


→来自拉丁词aquila, 鹰，见aquiline.
n.鹰The eagle is eager to anger the tiger in danger.鹰渴望激怒处在危险中的老虎.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a large strong bird with a curved beak which eats meat and can see very well 鹰



n. 鹰；鹰状标饰
 - hawk
examples: (1) The eagle held a mouse in its claws.(2) The eagle dived down on the rabbit.(3) The eagle poised in mid-air ready to swoop on its prey.
(1) 鹰用爪抓住了老鼠。(2) 那只鹰向兔子猛扑下来。(3) 那鹰在半空中盘旋准备扑向猎物。

translation:
adj. 早的; 早期的; 早日的; （果实等）早熟的
adv. 早; 在初期; 先前; 提早

级别：earlier, earliest
分布：早(100%)


→来自ayer, 早晨，词源同ere, erstwhile. -ly, 形容词后缀。
a.早的,早期的,及早的ad.早,在初期He was in his early fifties.他的岁数是五十出头.



US ['ɝ:-] (earlier, earliest)adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■near the beginning of a period of time, or before the usual, expected or planned time 早期的，初期的；在早期，在初期；提早（的），提前（的）
•If you finish early you can go home.如果能提前完成你就可以回家。

•If you arrived earlier, you'd have more time.如果早一点到，你就会有更多的时间。

•I like being a little early for interviews.每次去参加面试，我都喜欢提早一会儿到。

•They scored two goals early (on) in the game.他们在开赛不久就进了两个球。

•I hate having to get up early (in the morning).我讨厌（早晨）不得不早起。

•I'm going to have an early night (= go to sleep before my usual time).我要早点睡。

•She was a poet living in the early fifteenth century.她是一位生活在15世纪初期的诗人。

•He learned to read at the early age of three.他早在三岁时就学会认字了。

•It 's rather early  to be sowing carrot seeds, isn't it?现在种胡萝卜还太早，不是吗？

•Mercedes were pioneers during the early days/years of car manufacture.宾士是早期汽车制造业的先驱品牌。

•My earliest (= first) memory is of being shown around our new house.我最初的记忆是被带着看我们的新家。

•These are some of my early (= first) attempts at sculpture.这些是我最初尝试雕塑创作时的一些习作。

•Here's a dish I prepared earlier (= I made a short time ago).这是我刚做好不久的一道菜。
 Compare late  Early flowers and vegetables are ones that are ready before ordinary ones. 早开的花卉、早熟的蔬菜等at the earliest ■used after a date or time to show that something will not happen before then 至早，最早
•I'm very busy, so I won't be with you till 4 o'clock at the earliest.我太忙了，最早也得到四点才能跟你在一起。

UK ['ɜ:.li] US ['ɝ:-] (earlier, earliest)adjective  drive / send sb to an early grave ■to cause someone to die young 使（某人）太早去世
•Sometimes I think these children are going to drive me to an early grave!有时候我真觉得，不等我老死这些孩子就把我给折磨死了！

UK ['ɜ:.li] US ['ɝ:-] (earlier, earliest)adjective The early bird catches the worm. saying ■said to advise someone that they will win an advantage if they do something immediately or before anyone else does it 捷足先登；早起的鸟儿有虫吃
UK ['ɜ:.li] US ['ɝ:-] (earlier, earliest)adjective  Early to bed and early to rise (makes a man healthy , wealthy and wise). saying ■This means that someone who gets enough sleep and starts work early in the day will have a successful life. 早睡早起，健康如意。
UK ['ɜ:.li] US ['ɝ:-] (earlier, earliest)adjective It's early days. UK ■said when you think it is too soon to make a judgment about the likely result of something because a lot might still happen or change 言之过早；为时尚早
•Our progress has been fairly slow so far, but it's early days.到目前为止我们的进度很缓慢，但来日方长，现在还不能说以后会怎么样。




adj. 早期的；早熟的
 - precocious, inchoate
adv. 提早；在初期
 - before one's time
examples: (1) They figured on your arriving early.(2) The apple trees are fruiting early this year.(3) Could you come back home early this evening?(4) John will doubtless come early as he always does.(5) It's too early for getting up.(6) This Greek dish is of a very early date.(7) Please make every endeavor to be early.(8) His genius as a painter flowered very early.(9) He got skinning in his blood at a very early age.
(1) 他们预料你会早到。(2) 今年苹果树很早结果。(3) 今天晚上你能早回家吗？(4) 约翰无疑会像平时一样很早就来。(5) 现在起床还太早。(6) 这个希腊盘子是很早时期的制品。(7) 请尽量早点儿。(8) 他的绘画天赋很早就发挥出来。(9) 他很早就迷上了，滑雪运动。

translation:
vt. & vi. 赚得; 获得; 赢得; 博得
vt. 赚，赚得; 获得; 挣得; 使得到

时态：earned, earning, earns
分布：获得(53%)，赢得(27%)，赚得(20%)


→来自es-en, 劳动，收获，通常指农奴，佃农劳动所得，词源同esne, 奴仆。字母r,n音变。
v.赚得,挣得,获得I learn that learned earnest men earn much by learning.我得知有学问而认真的人靠学问挣很多钱.



US [ɝ:n] verb intransitive or transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to receive money as payment for work that you do 赚（钱）；挣得；赚得
•I earn $30 000 a year.我一年赚三万美元。

•How much do you earn, if you don't mind me asking?如果你不介意的话，能告诉我你赚多少钱吗？

•You can't expect to earn a living (= be paid enough money to live on) from your painting.你不能指望靠画画来维持生计。

•[+ two objects] Coffee exports earn (= give) Brazil many millions of pounds a year./Brazil earns many millions of pounds a year from coffee exports.咖啡出口每年给巴西带来的收入达数百万英镑。／巴西藉由出口咖啡每年收入达数百万英镑。
■to get something that you deserve 应获得；搏得；赢得
•It's been a tough six months and I feel I've earned a few weeks off.这半年可真是够辛苦的，我觉得我也该休息几周了。
⇒ See also well-earned




acquire, obtain, get, secure, win, earn, gain

这组词都有“获得、取得、得到”的意思，其区别是：
acquire: 强调通过不断的、持续的努力而获得某物，也指日积月累地渐渐地获得。书面语用词。
obtain: 较正式用词，着重通过巨大努力、要求而得到所需或盼望已久的东西。
get: 普通用词，使用广泛，可指以任何方式得到某物，也不一定要经过努力。
secure: 强调要通过努力或竞争，或需要付出代价才能获得所渴望的东西。
win: 主要指通过努力、斗争、比赛等而获得胜利。
earn: 侧重指依靠自己的劳动或因付出代价与有功而获得。
gain: 侧重指经过努力或有意识行动而取得某种成就或获得某种利益或好处。



attain, acquire, obtain, secure, achieve, earn, gain

这组词都有“获得，取得”的意思，其区别是：
attain: v.指经过不懈的努力获得未曾预料到的结果；也可指达到某一目标。
 • The salesperson attained his sales goal for the month.   这名销售员完成了当月的销售目标。
acquire: v.多指经过努力逐步获得才能、知识、习惯等，也可用于对财物等的获得，该词强调"一经获得就会长期持有"的含义。
 • It is through learning that the individual acquires many habitual ways of reacting to situations.   正是通过学习，个人才得以获得应付各种情况的习惯做法。
obtain: v.获得，买到，用于正式语体中。
 • He obtained the property with a bank loan.   他通过向银行贷款买下了那份房产。
secure: v.得到；把……拿到手，含有肯定占有难以得到的东西之意；使安全，保卫；作形容词比较常见，意为"安全的"。
 • A million signatures have been secured.   已征集到了100万人的签名。
 • He secured the office before leaving it for the night.   他晚上离开前锁好了办公室的门窗。
achieve: v.得到，获得，多指成就、目标、幸福的取得。
 • The movie star achieved success and wealth.   这个影星取得了成功和财富。
earn: v.挣得，赢得，指因工作等而得到报酬或待遇。
 • How much do you earn a week?   你一星期挣多少钱？
gain: v.指通过较大努力获得某种利益或好处；亦可指军事上的武力夺取等。
 • An investor gains by buying stocks that go up in value.   投资者通过所买股票价格上涨而得利润。


vt. 赚，赚得；获得，挣得；使得到；博得
 - acquire, buy, find, make, score
examples: (1) He has earned a lot of money in this month.(2) He works hard, but he does not earn much money.(3) How does she earn her living?(4) His skill in negotiating earned him a reputation as a shrewd tactician.(5) It has taken years to earn their trust.(6) She exerted herself all year to earn good marks.
(1) 这个月他已经赚了好多钱了。(2) 他工作很努力，但钱赚得不多。(3) 她靠什么谋生？(4) 他的谈判技巧使他赢得了精明战略家的名声。(5) 花了好多年才赢得他们的信任。(6) 她整年努力以期获得好分数。

translation:
adj. 热心的; 诚挚的，真挚的; 重要的
n. 热心; 认真; 定钱，保证金; 诚挚

分布：认真(61%)，认真的(14%)，诚挚(8%)，定金(7%)，保证(5%)，真诚的(4%)，预示(1%)


→来自er, 行动，开始。其本义为严肃，认真的开始，行动，原词义见in earnest. 后引申词义热忱的。
a.热心的,诚挚的n.热心;真挚;定金;认真I learn that learned earnest men earn much by learning.我得知有学问而认真的人靠学问挣很多钱.
【记】earn money要earnest【反】flippant（adj 轻率的；没礼貌的）；facetious（adj 幽默滑稽的）



US ['ɝ:-] adjective ■serious or determined, especially too serious and unable to find your own actions funny 认真的；有决心的；郑重其事的；诚挚的
•He was a very earnest young man.他是个非常认真的年轻人。
in deadly earnest ■completely serious 郑重其事；一本正经；严肃认真
•These fanatics are in deadly earnest when they say they want to destroy all forms of government.这些狂热分子声称要摧毁所有政府的形式时，他们可不是说着玩，而是完全当真的。
in earnest ■When something begins in earnest, it has already started but is now being done in a serious and complete way 正确地；真正地；完全地
•The election campaign has begun in earnest.竞选宣传活动正式开始了。
be in earnest ■to be speaking honestly 是认真的；是诚挚的
•I thought he was joking - I didn't realize he was in earnest.我还以为他在开玩笑——没想到他是认真的。





solemn, sober, earnest, grave, severe, serious

这组词都有“严肃的”的意思，其区别是：
solemn: 指人表情或场景气氛严肃，侧重威严名印象深刻。
sober: 侧重因控制或抑制自己的感情而表现出的庄重。
earnest: 指严肃，认真，含诚恳和热情意味。
grave: 侧重严肃和尊严，需要认真思考，含令人担忧意味。
severe: 指面孔的严肃，法律的严厉，伤病的严重。着重严厉性，无丝毫温情。
serious: 指具有关键、严肃或严重意义的事情。


adj. 认真的，热心的；重要的
 - crucial, important, serious, considerable, material
n. 认真； [贸易] 定金；诚挚
 - sincerity, staidness
examples: adj.认真的；真诚的n.定金；预示；保证n.认真；诚挚

(1) I'm sure he was earnest when he said he would come.(2) I strive to live each day with earnest gratitude.(3) Earnest was legally unnecessary.(4) The money was given in earnest to finalize the contract.(5) The current economic slump is an earnest of the major recession to come.(6) You will have to pay"earnest money" to guarantee your participation till the end of the tender.(7) She spoke half in sport, half in earnest.(8) At last he has settled to his work in earnest.(9) I could tell she spoke in earnest.
(1) 我相信他说他会来是认真的。(2) 我努力使生活的每一天都充满真诚的感激。(3) 法律上并不要求必须有定金。(4) 这笔钱是作为敲定合同的定金。(5) 当前的经济滑坡预示着一次大的衰退即将来临。(6) 为保证您自始至终参加投标，您应该缴纳保证金。(7) 她半开玩笑半认真地说。(8) 最后他安心认真地干起他的工作来。(9) 我看得出她是郑重其事地说的。

translation:
n. 地球; 陆地; 泥土; 兽穴
vt. 把（电线）接地; 盖（土）; 追赶入洞穴
vi. 躲进地洞

时态：earthed, earthing, earths
分布：地球(91%)，泥土(8%)，世间(1%)


→来自er, 土地，地面，词源同ore.
n.地球;陆地;泥土,土壤;尘世,人间Early I searched through the earth for earthware so as to research in earthquake.早先我在泥土中搜寻陶器以研究地震.



US [ɝ:θ] noun PLANET  行星   ESSENTIAL  [S or U] (usually Earth) ■the planet third in order of distance from the Sun, between Venus and Mars ; the world on which we live 地球；世界
•The Earth takes approximately 365 1 4 days to go round the Sun.地球围绕太阳运转一周大约需要365又1/4天

•The Circus has been described as the greatest show on Earth (= in the world).这个马戏团被誉为是全世界最棒的。

UK [ɜ:θ] US [ɝ:θ] noun SUBSTANCE  物质   IMPROVER  uncountable ■the usually brown, heavy and loose substance of which a large part of the surface of the ground is made, and in which plants can grow; the land surface of the Earth rather than the sky or sea 泥土，土壤；陆地，地面
•The ploughed earth looked rich and dark and fertile.耕过的土地看起来黑油油的，非常肥沃。

UK [ɜ:θ] US [ɝ:θ] noun WIRE  电线  countable usually singular UK (US ground) ■a wire that makes a connection between a piece of electrical equipment and the ground, so the user is protected from feeling an electric shock if the equipment develops a fault 地线
UK [ɜ:θ] US [ɝ:θ] noun HOLE  洞  countable ■a hole in the ground where an animal such as a fox lives （狐狸等动物的）洞穴
UK [ɜ:θ] US [ɝ:θ] noun come back down to Earth (also bring sb back down to Earth) ■to start dealing with life and problems again after you have had a very exciting time, or to make someone do this （使）从幻想中清醒过来；（使）回到现实中来；（使）开始脚踏实地处理问题
•The realization of how little work I'd done for the exams brought me abruptly back down to Earth.意识到要考试了，可是我还没怎么复习呢，我一下子被拉回到了现实中来。

UK [ɜ:θ] US [ɝ:θ] noun cost/charge, etc. the Earth ■to cost/charge, etc. a lot of money 花费／收取一大笔钱等
•They charge the Earth just for a cup of coffee.一杯咖啡他们就能要个天价。

UK [ɜ:θ] US [ɝ:θ] noun the Earth moved informal ■If someone says the Earth moved, they are joking about how good a sexual experience was. （戏谓性事快感）床都塌了，天摇地动
UK [ɜ:θ] US [ɝ:θ] noun how/what/why, etc. on Earth informal ■used when you are extremely surprised, confused or angry about something （表示对某事吃惊、不解或气愤）到底或究竟如何／甚么／为甚么等
•How on Earth did this happen?这到底是怎么发生的？

•Why on Earth didn't you tell me before?你究竟为甚么以前没有告诉我？

UK [ɜ:θ] US [ɝ:θ] noun like nothing (else) on Earth ■very strange, unusual or unpleasant 极其古怪；极不寻常；非常糟糕
•With his make-up and strange clothes, he looked like nothing on Earth.他化了妆，穿了一身稀奇古怪的衣服，看上去像个外星人。

UK [ɜ:θ] US [ɝ:θ] verb transitive usually passive UK (US ground) ■to put an earth (= wire) between a piece of electrical equipment and the ground 把（电线）接地
•You could get a nasty shock from that water heater if it isn't earthed properly.如果电热水器接地不良的话，可能会发生很严重的触电事故。





earth, globe, world

这组词都有“地球”的意思，其区别是：
earth: 指表面有陆地和水，人类所居住行星的名字。有时与“天”相对，泛指“地”。
globe: 指我们生活的地球，但强调其实体和圆形。
world: 通常相当于earth与globe，现多用指地球，地球上的世界，社会和人。



clay, mud, dust, ground, land, earth, dirt, soil

这组词都有“土地，土，泥”的意思，其区别是：
clay: 特指潮湿时发粘，而火烤后变坚硬的泥土。
mud: 指湿土，尤指雨后稀泥、污泥。
dust: 特指土壤干燥后，飞扬于空中的细微泥土。
ground: 通常指大地的表面，也可指土壤、泥土或场地。
land: 含义笼统。指与河流、海洋相对的陆地，也指可耕种的土地。
earth: 多指地表带有水分的泥土，较具体。
dirt: 指地表的干松泥土。
soil: 特指适宜栽种农作物或生长各种植物的泥土。


n. [天] 地球；陆地；泥土；尘世； [电] 地线
 - land, clay, dirt
examples: (1) The moon goes round the earth.(2) What percentage of the earth is covered by oceans?(3) He dived his hand into the earth.(4) The machine cast up a big heap of earth.(5) The earth is as full of brutality as the sea is full of motion.(6) There is no paradise on the earth equal to the union of love and innocence.
(1) 月亮绕着地球转。(2) 地球上百分之多少被海水覆盖着？(3) 他将手插入泥土中。(4) 机器卷起了一大堆泥土。(5) 世间满是残忍，正如海洋满是波动一般。(6) 世间无与伦比的幸福就是既有爱情又爱得纯洁无瑕。

translation:
n. 地震; 大变动; 动乱

分布：地震(100%)


→earth, 地球。-quake, 震动。
n.地震Early I searched through the earth for earthware so as to research in earthquake.早先我在泥土中搜寻陶器以研究地震.



US ['ɝ:θ-] noun countable ■a sudden violent movement of the Earth's surface, sometimes causing great damage 地震
•In 1906 an earthquake destroyed much of San Francisco.1906年的大地震给旧金山大部分市区带来毁灭性的灾难。




n. [地震] 地震；大动荡
 - temblor, seismic event
examples: (1) The earthquake rocked the houses.(2) There has been a dreadful earthquake in Iran.
(1) 地震震动房屋。(2) 伊朗发生了一次可怕的地震。

translation:
n. 轻松，舒适; 容易; 安逸; 不拘束，自在
vt. 解除痛苦; 减轻; 延缓; 松弛
vi. 缓解，减少; 轻松前进

时态：eased, easing, eases
分布：减轻(32%)，放松(17%)，缓和(14%)，自在(13%)，容易(12%)，安逸(7%)，悠闲(4%)，缓慢移动(1%)


→词源不详。
v.减轻;使舒适,使安心n.容易;舒适,悠闲The old couple lived a life of ease.这对老夫妇过着安逸的生活.



verb MAKE LESS  使变少   ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive ■to make or become less severe, difficult, unpleasant, painful, etc 减轻；减低；缓解
•To ease the problem of overcrowding, new prisons will be built.为了缓解监狱里人满为患的情况，将修建新的监狱。

•These pills should ease the pain.这些药丸能缓解疼痛。

•After the arrival of the United Nations soldiers, tension in the area began to ease.联合国维和士兵到达后，这个地区的紧张局势开始得到缓解。

[i:z] verb MOVE  移动  transitive + adverb or preposition ■to move or to make something move slowly and carefully in a particular direction or into a particular position （使）小心缓慢地移动；（使）缓缓移动
•She eased the key into the lock, anxious not to wake anyone.她小心翼翼地把锁匙插入锁孔，生怕惊醒任何人。

•I eased myself out of the chair.我慢慢地从椅子上站起身。

[i:z] verb ease your mind ■to stop you from worrying 使（某人）安心；宽慰（某人）
•If it will ease your mind, I'll have a word with Charlotte for you.要是你觉得这样便能安心的话，我去跟夏绿蒂谈一谈。

[i:z] verb   Phrasal Verbs   ease up/off STOP  ■to gradually stop or become less 逐渐停止；减少，减轻
•At last the rain began to ease off.最后雨势开始减弱了。
WORK LESS  ■to start to work less or do things with less energy 放松；缓和；变得悠闲
•As he got older, he started to ease up a little.随着年岁增长，他工作起来就不再那么拼命了。
TREAT LESS SEVERELY  ■to start to treat someone less severely 不再为难；（对某人）不再如此苛刻
•I wish his supervisor would ease up on him a bit.我希望他的上司能对他宽厚一些。

[i:z] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] ease sb out ■to make someone leave a job or powerful position 把（某人）打发走；使（某人）离职
•The head teacher was eased out of his job after teachers and parents accused him of being autocratic.老师和家长都指责这位校长太独断专行，于是他被迫离职。

[i:z] noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■when you experience no difficulty, effort, pain, etc 容易，不费力；舒适，安逸，自在
•She won the 400m race with ease.她轻松赢得了400米赛跑的冠军。

•The doors are extra-wide for ease of access (= so that people can get in without difficulty).门都是加宽的，出入方便。
at (your) ease ■relaxed 不拘束的；放松的
•He felt completely at ease.他感到全身放松。

•She soon put/set me at ease (= made me relaxed).她很快消除了我的紧张情绪
at ease (also standing at ease) ■If someone, especially a soldier, is at ease, they are standing with their feet apart and their hands behind their back. 稍息（姿势）




comfort, ease, leisure, rest, relaxation, relief

这组词都有“舒适，安逸、悠闲”的意思，其区别是：
comfort: 通常指在摆脱烦人、痛苦的事情，或在要求、愿望得到满足后所感到的舒适。
ease: 指因没有担心和忧虑而轻松。
leisure: 专指闲暇时间或悠闲状态。
rest: 与work相对，强调水分除身心痛劳，不着重休息方式。
relaxation: 强调消除肌肉疲劳或思想的紧张状态，使身心松弛，得到休息。
relief: 侧重有消除痛苦、不适或困难的负担，常暗含不利因素已不存在的意味。



relieve, console, soothe, comfort, ease

这组词都有“给人以帮助以减轻痛苦或悲伤”的意思，其区别是：
relieve: 指解除或缓解某人的病痛、担心或忧虑等，常用被动态。
console: 较正式用词，侧重缓和或减轻别人的痛苦或悲伤。
soothe: 着重以安慰减轻悲痛、愤怒或激动，使人理智地平静下来。也可指药物等减轻病痛。
comfort: 普通用词，指用语言或行动对痛苦者给予鼓励、勇气和力量，从而减轻其痛苦或悲伤，得到安慰。
ease: 正式用词，指减轻身心的痛苦、不安和忧虑。


vt. 减轻，缓和；使安心
 - moderate, relax
n. 轻松，舒适；安逸，悠闲
 - comfort, leisure
vi. 减轻，缓和；放松；灵活地移动
 - relax, to alleviate
examples: n.容易；悠闲；安逸；自在v.减轻；放松；缓和；缓慢移动

(1) He passed the test with ease.(2) He is expected to win the game with ease.(3) My parents are retired and now live a life of ease.(4) She is a rich woman now, and leads a life of ease.(5) I don't feel at ease in the strange place.(6) It would ease my mind to know where he was.(7) They did this to ease their economic crisis.(8) He eased himself along the ledge to reach the terrified boy.
(1) 他轻而易举地考及格了。(2) 预计他在比赛中会轻易获胜。(3) 我的父母都退休了，现在过着安闲舒适的生活。(4) 她现在是个富婆,过着安逸的生活。(5) 在这个陌生的地方，我觉得很不自在。(6) 要知道他在哪儿我就放心了。(7) 他们这样做是为了缓和经济危机。(8) 他小心翼翼地沿着突出的檐向那惊惶失措的男孩靠近。

translation:
adv. 容易地; 很可能; 迅速地; 频繁地

分布：容易地(55%)，无疑地(38%)，很可能地(7%)


adverb NOT DIFFICULT  轻易地   ESSENTIAL  ■with no difficulty or effort 容易地；轻易地；不费力地
•I can easily be home early tonight, if you want.你想让我回去的话，我今晚就能早早到家，完全不费力。

•Ever since the illness I get tired very easily (= more quickly than usual).自从生了那场病之后，我动不动就感到浑身乏力。

['i:.zɪ.li] adverb CERTAINLY  肯定  ■without doubt 无疑；肯定
•For me, Venice is easily the most beautiful city in Europe.对我来说，威尼斯绝对是欧洲最美丽的城市。

['i:.zɪ.li] adverb LIKELY  很可能  ■very likely to happen or be true 很可能发生或成为现实地
•Prices could easily rise further.价格很可能会进一步上涨。




adv. 容易地；无疑地
 - clearly, no doubt, readily, lightly
examples: adv.容易地；无疑地；很可能地
(1) We easily climbed down the side of the cliff.(2) This is easily recognized from its size and color.
(1) 我们很容易地从悬崖边上爬下来了。(2) 这种蚁可以很容易地通过其体积和颜色辨识出来。

translation:
adj. 东方的，东部（地方）的; 朝东的; 来自东方的
n. 东方人; （美国）东部地区的人; 东正教信徒

分布：东部的(68%)，东方的(32%)


东方的[-ern 1.表形容词"…方向的"2.表名词"…场所"]
a.东方的,东部的On the eastern Easter feast, at least one beast's breasts were tested with yeast.在东部复活节宴会上,至少有一头牲畜的乳房被用酵母做了试验.



US [-stɚn] (written abbreviation E) adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■in or from the east part of an area （某个地区的）东部的；来自东部的
•The eastern part of the country is very mountainous.这个国家的东部地区多山。

•Until about 1991, the Eastern bloc was the Soviet Union and the communist countries of Eastern Europe.直到1991年左右，东方集团是指苏联和东欧的共产主义国家。

•Buddhism and other Eastern (= Asian) religions fascinate me.佛教和其他东方宗教让我着迷。




adj. 东方的；朝东的；东洋的
 - oriental
n. 东方人；（美国）东部地区的人
 - oriental
examples: (1) The eastern situation is similarly intense.(2) Eastern Gnosticism took a somewhat different course.(3) The mountain was clearly defined against the eastern sky.
(1) 东部的情况同样紧张。(2) 东方的诺斯替派有些不同的实践。(3) 山巅被东方的天际衬托得轮廓格外分明。

translation:
adj. 容易的; 舒适的; 宽裕的; 从容的
adv. 容易地; 不费力地; 悠闲地; 缓慢地
vi. 停止划桨（常用作命令）
vt. 向（水手或划手）发出停划命令

级别：easier, easiest
分布：容易的(68%)，舒适的(11%)，安逸的(8%)，轻松的(7%)，不费力的(3%)，无约束的(1%)，轻微的(1%)，随和的(1%)


a.容易的,不费力的,安逸的,宽裕的It's easy and feasible to control the disease after cease-fire.停火之后控制这种病很容易也可行.



adjective NOT DIFFICULT  不难的   ESSENTIAL  ■not difficult; needing little effort 容易的；不费力的
•an easy exam容易的考试

•Would a ten o'clock appointment be easier for you?会面定在十点是不是对你更方便一点？

•[+ to infinitive] It 's easy  to see why he's so popular.不难看出他为何会那么受欢迎。

•She's very easy to talk to.她平易近人，跟她很容易谈得来。

•The easiest thing to do would be for us to take the train home.对我们来说，最简单的做法莫过于坐火车回家。

•It  isn't easy being a parent.为人父母，殊非易事。

•Getting into the film business is no easy matter.要跻身电影业可不是件容易事。

•I don't trust that easy (= relaxed) charm of his.他那副从容自如的潇洒风度倒是让我信不过。

•slang My car can do 250kph, easy.我的车每小时能跑250公里，轻而易举。
  Common Learner Errors   easy or easily?Warning:  do not confuse the adjective easy  with the adverb easily.✗ You can easy find a job if you speak English.You can easily find a job if you speak English.
['i:.zi] adjective COMFORTABLE  舒适的  ■comfortable or calm; free from worry, pain, etc 舒适的；安逸的；安心的
•They both retired and went off to lead an easy life in the Bahamas.他们两个都退休了，一起到了巴哈马群岛过安逸生活去了。

•I don't feel easy about leaving him alone in the house all day.把他一个人留在家里一整天，我可不放心。

•With the harvest finished, I was able to relax with an  easy  mind/conscience.收割结束了，我可以安心地／心安理得地放松一下了。

['i:.zi] adjective (as) easy as pie/ABC/anything/falling off a log informal ■extremely easy 极容易；不费吹灰之力
['i:.zi] adjective easier said than done informal  ADVANCED  ■said when something seems like a good idea but it would be difficult to do 说得比做的好听；说说容易
•"Why don't you just ask Simon to pay?" "That's easier said than done."“你为甚么不让赛门付钱？”“说得倒容易。”

['i:.zi] adjective the easiest thing in the world informal ■extremely easy 极容易；不费吹灰之力
•Making bread is the easiest thing in the world.没有比做面包更容易的了。

['i:.zi] adjective easy come, easy go informal ■said when something, especially money, is easily got and then soon spent or lost （尤指钱）来得容易去得快
•I lost £500 in a card game last night, but that's life - easy come, easy go.昨晚我赌牌输了500英镑，但是人生就是这样子——钱这东西来得容易去得也快。

['i:.zi] adjective Easy does it! informal ■used to tell someone to do something slowly and carefully 小心些！别着急！慢慢来！
['i:.zi] adjective be easy game/meat UK (US be an easy mark) slang ■to be easily deceived 容易上当；易受骗
•Old ladies living alone are easy game for con-men.孤身独居的老年女性是骗子们最容易得手的目标。

['i:.zi] adjective easy on the eye/ear ■pleasant to look at/listen to 悦目／耳的
•Her paintings are very easy on the eye.她的画赏心悦目。

['i:.zi] adjective go easy informal ■to not take or use too much of something 节省使用；对…有节制
•Go easy on/with the cream - I haven't had any yet.鲜奶油别放那么多——我还没吃呢 。
■to treat someone in a gentle way and not criticize them or punish them 温和地对待；宽容对待
•Go easy on the new students.对新生不要那么严。

['i:.zi] adjective I'm easy. informal ■used to say that you do not mind which choice is made （指无论哪种选择都可以）我随便；我无所谓
•"Shall we go to the Indian restaurant, or would you prefer Chinese food?" "I'm easy."“你是想吃印度菜呢还是吃中国菜?”“我无所谓。”

['i:.zi] adjective on easy street old-fashioned informal ■rich 生活优裕；富有
['i:.zi] adjective take it/things easy ■to relax and not use too much energy 不拼命工作；放松；休息
•I wasn't feeling too good, so I thought I'd take it easy for a couple of days.我感到不太舒服，所以我想还是休息几天吧。





easy, simple

这组词都有“简单的，轻易的”的意思，其区别是：
easy: 普通用词，指不需要花费太多精力的工作或事，在实际运用中常与simple换用。
simple: 普通用词，指不复杂、不难懂，从而容易被理解的事物。


adj. 容易的；舒适的
 - pleasant, comfortable, light, easiest
adv. 不费力地，从容地
 - lightly, painlessly
examples: adj.容易的；轻松的；不费力的；舒适的；安逸的；轻微的；随和的；无约束的

(1) It's not easy to rid oneself of a habit.(2) Her movements were easy and graceful.(3) It was not easy for me to get the rusty nail out.(4) He has stopped working and leads a very easy life now.(5) He began to pursue an easy and comfortable life.(6) Our teacher is easy on the girls and hard on the boys.(7) She's definitely not a woman of easy virtue.
(1) 要改掉一个习惯是不容易的。(2) 她的动作轻松而优雅。(3) 我好不容易才拔出这颗生锈的钉子。(4) 他现在不做事了,过着很舒服的日子。(5) 他开始追求安逸舒适的生活。(6) 我们老师对女生宽，封男生严。(7) 她决不是一个放荡的女人。

translation:
vt. & vi. 吃，喝
vi. （食物）吃起来感到; 咬; （人）感到苦恼（或烦恼）; 侵蚀，腐蚀
vt. （如酸）腐蚀; 吃完; 吃得使; 侵蚀成

时态：ate, eaten, eating, eats
分布：吃(80%)，吃饭(12%)，喝(8%)


→来自ed, 吃，词源同edible,comestible.
vt.吃,喝vi.吃饭,吃东西Monkey likes to eat banana.猴子喜欢吃香蕉.



[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to put or take food into the mouth, chew (= crush with the teeth) it, and swallow it 吃
•Do you eat meat?你吃肉吗？

•When I've got a cold, I don't feel like eating.我感冒时没有食欲。

•We usually eat (= have a meal) at about 7 o'clock.我们通常在七点前后吃饭。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive eaten up with/by sth informal ■If someone is eaten up with/by a negative emotion, they are experiencing it very strongly 被（某种消极情绪）所折磨；内心充满（某种消极情绪）
•He was so eaten up with guilt, he became ill.心中的愧疚无时无刻不在折磨着他，最后他病倒了。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive eat sb  alive ■to criticize someone very angrily 气愤地严厉批评某人
•If we get our facts wrong we'll be eaten alive by the press.如果我们把事实弄错了，媒体会对我们大肆发难的。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive eat sb for breakfast informal ■to be able to very easily control or defeat someone 不费吹灰之力地制伏（或打败）
•He eats people like you for breakfast.像你这样的人，他不费吹灰之力就制得服服贴贴了。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive eat your heart out humorous ■If someone says eat your heart out followed by the name of a famous person, they are joking that they are even better than that person （后接一个名人的名字，开玩笑地说比其还要强）比你强多了，你算老几
•I'm singing in the village production of Tosca next month - eat your heart out Pavarotti!下个月我们村里剧团要上演《托斯卡》，我会上台一展歌喉——帕华洛帝，我比你强多了！

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive  eat humble pie (US also eat crow) informal ■to admit that you were wrong 认错；道歉
•After boasting that his company could outperform the industry's best, he's been forced to eat humble pie.他吹嘘他的公司可以胜过业内最好的企业，但之后，他就不得不承认言过其实了。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive eat like a horse informal ■to always eat a lot of food 吃得很多；食量极大
•She's so thin yet she eats like a horse.她那么瘦，可是食量极大。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive  eat sb out of house and home humorous ■to eat a lot of the food someone has in their house 把（某人）吃穷；吃光（某人）的家当
[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive eat your words ■to admit that something you said before was wrong 承认自己说错了话
•Sam said it would never sell, but when he sees these sales figures he'll have to eat his words.山姆曾说这个永远不会有销路。可是他要是看到这些销售数字，就得承认自己错了。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive have sb eating out of your hand informal ■to easily make someone do or think what you want 牵着（某人）的鼻子走；使（某人）百依百顺；将（某人）搞得服服贴贴
•Within two minutes of walking into the classroom, she had the kids eating out of her hand.她走进教室不到两分钟，就把这群孩子治得服服贴贴的。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive I'll eat my hat old-fashioned ■used to say that you are sure something will not happen 我敢打赌…绝对不可能发生（或不是真的；要是发生…我把头给你）
•If she actually marries him I'll eat my hat.她要是真的会嫁给他，我就把脑袋给你。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive (I'm so hungry), I could eat a horse. humorous ■used to say that you are extremely hungry 我饿极了。
[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive What's eating sb ? informal ■used to ask why someone seems angry or upset 是甚么使（某人）烦心
•Jack's in a strange mood - I wonder what's eating him?杰克今天脾气怪怪的，甚么事让他那么烦啊？

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   eat away at sth ■to gradually damage or destroy something 逐渐毁掉；侵蚀；损耗
[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   eat away at sb ■If a bad memory or feeling eats away at someone, it makes them feel more and more unhappy. 长期困扰（某人）；烦扰（某人）
[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   eat in ■to have a meal at home rather than in a restaurant 在家吃饭
[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   eat into sth ■to use or take away a large part of something valuable, such as money or time 消耗，花掉，耗费（金钱或时间）
•The high cost of living in London is eating into my savings.伦敦生活费用太高了，我的积蓄都花了不少了。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   eat out  IMPROVER  ■to eat in a restaurant 去餐厅吃饭；在外用餐
•When I lived in Spain, I used to eat out all the time.我住在西班牙的时候，天天去外面吃饭。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] eat (sth) up ■to eat all the food that you have been given 吃完，吃光
•Be a good boy and eat up your vegetables.好孩子，乖，把蔬菜都吃了。

[i:t] (ate, eaten)verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   eat up sth ■to use or take away a large part of something valuable （大量）耗费，损耗
•A big old car like that eats up petrol.像那样的老式大型车很耗油。





dine, gorge, have, swallow, eat, devour, consume

这组词都有“吃”的意思，其区别是：
dine: 正式用词，既可指一日三餐中的任何一餐，也可以指特殊的用餐。
gorge: 侧重指拼命地吃或塞，强调吃饱或吃得过量。
have: 可与eat换用，但强调一次性的动作。
swallow: 主要指吃的整个过程的第二部分“咽”，并常指咀嚼得匆匆忙忙地吃。
eat: 普通用词，使用广泛。既可用于人，也可用于动物。
devour: 指狼吞虎咽地吃，强调吃得既快又彻底。
consume: 侧重痛痛快快地吃得一干二净，可用于人和动物。


vt. 吃，喝；腐蚀；烦扰
 - drink, take, burden
vi. 进食；腐蚀，侵蚀
 - attack, to erode
examples: (1) I often eat oatmeal as breakfast.(2) Do you always eat lunch at school?(3) If you eat too much chocolate you'll get fat.(4) The Chinese eat with chopsticks.(5) They usually eat out on Sundays.(6) Do you like to eat vegetable soup?
(1) 我经常吃燕麦粥当早饭。(2) 你总是在学校吃午饭吗？(3) 吃巧克力太多会发胖。(4) 中国人用筷子吃饭。(5) 星期天他们通常上馆子吃饭。(6) 你喜爱喝清菜汤吗?

translation:
n. 回声，共鸣; （言语、作风、思想等的）重复; 重复者; [无线电]回波
vt. 重复，效仿; 随声附和; 类似; 发射（声音等）
vi. 被重复; 产生回响; 充满回声

时态：echoed, echoing, echoes
分布：回声(53%)，回响(13%)，重复(10%)，共鸣(8%)，附和(6%)，模仿(5%)，发出回声(4%)，其哀声留于山间成为回声）(1%)


→来自wagh, 回声，回响，词源同catechism, 教义问答。
v./n.回声,反响,共鸣The mechanical mechanic knows the technique and technology of the echo mechanism.呆板的机修工知道共鸣装置的技术和工艺.



US [-oʊ] noun countable (plural echoes)SOUND  声音   ADVANCED  ■a sound that is heard after it has been reflected off a surface such as a wall or a cliff 回声，回音，回响
•The echoes of his scream sounded in the cave for several seconds.他的尖叫声在洞中回荡了好几秒钟。

•Thick carpet would reduce the echo in this hallway.厚地毯会减弱走廊中的回音。

UK ['ek.əʊ] US [-oʊ] noun countable (plural echoes)SIMILAR DETAIL  相似的东西  ■a detail that is similar to and makes you remember something else 十分相似的东西；如出一辙的事物；仿效
•There are echoes of Mozart in her first piano compositions.她最早创作的钢琴曲有些地方模仿了莫劄特。

UK ['ek.əʊ] US [-oʊ] verb SOUND  声音   ADVANCED  intransitive ■If a sound echoes or a place echoes with a sound, you hear the sound again because you are in a large, empty space 回响；发出回声；响起回声
•The sound of footsteps echoed round the hall.脚步声在大厅里回荡。

•Suddenly, the building echoed with the sound of gunfire.突然，大楼里响起一阵枪响。

UK ['ek.əʊ] US [-oʊ] verb SIMILAR DETAILS  相似的东西  transitive ■to repeat details that are similar to, and make you think of, something else 重复，附和；使产生似曾相识的感觉
•The design of the church echoes that of St. Paul's Cathedral.这座教堂的设计模仿了圣保罗大教堂。

•I've heard the Prime Minister's view echoed throughout the party.我听说党内普遍都附和首相的观点。

UK ['ek.əʊ] US [-oʊ] verb echo down/through the ages ■to continue to have a particular effect for a long time 影响后世；留传
•The ideas of Plato have echoed through the ages.柏拉图的思想已经流传了千百年。




vt. 反射；重复
 - reflect, mirror, repeat
n. 回音；效仿
 - aftersound, bounceback
examples: vi.发出回声；回响vt.重复；模仿；附和n.回声；重复；共鸣Echo.n.[希神]山林女神（失恋于那喀索斯；其哀声留于山间成为回声）

(1) His voice echoed in the big empty hall.(2) The room echoed with their happy laughter.(3) I would like to echo the words of the previous speaker.(4) This kind of fashion echoed an earlier style.(5) What he said is ridiculous, but many people echoed his words.(6) She shouted on the mountaintop and listened to the echo.(7) There are many echoes of Shakespeare in his work.(8) Her performance was cheered to the echo.(9) His words aroused no echo in their hearts.
(1) 他的声音在空荡的大厅里发出回声。(2) 房间里回荡着他们的欢笑声。(3) 我想重复前面一位发言者的话。(4) 这种流行风潮仿效了早期的时尚。(5) 他的讲话真荒唐,但竟然有很多人随声附和。(6) 她在山顶上大声喊着,然后聆听着回声。(7) 他的作品中有很多处模仿莎士比亚.(8) 她的表演获得长时间的喝采。(9) 他的话未能在他们心中引起共鸣。

translation:
adj. 经济的; 经济学的; 合算的; 有经济效益的

分布：经济的(55%)，经济学的(28%)，有利可图的(17%)


a.经济(上)的,经济学的This economic system is working in inefficiency.经济体制效率不高.



US [-'nɑ:.mɪk] adjective COUNTRY'S ECONOMY  国家经济   ESSENTIAL  [before noun] ■relating to trade, industry and money 经济的；经济上的
•The country has been in a very poor economic state ever since the decline of its two major industries.自从这个国家的两大主要产业衰退后，其经济一直萎靡不振。

•The government's economic policies have led us into the worst recession for years.政府的经济政策使我们遭遇了多年来最为严重的经济衰退。

UK [i:.kə'nɒm.ɪk/ UK [ek.ə-] US [-'nɑ:.mɪk] adjective MAKING A PROFIT  赚取利益  ■making a profit, or likely to make a profit 产生经济效益的；有利可图的；能赚钱的
•We had to close our London office - with the rent so high it just wasn't economic.我们不得不关闭伦敦办事处——租金太高，不划算。





economical, economic

economical: 节约的，节俭的。如：He is economical of money and time.
economic: 经济(学)的。如：the economic doctrines of Ricardo(李嘉图的经济学说)
examples: adj.经济学的；经济的；有利可图的

(1) They had led the country into economic disaster.(2) The threat of an economic depression hangs over the world.(3) The economic sanctions could not prevent the development of that country.(4) It is not always economic for buses to run on Sundays.
(1) 他们把国家带入了经济灾难中。(2) 经济衰退的威胁笼罩着世界。(3) 经济制裁不能阻碍那个国家的发展。(4) 公共汽车星期日行驶不一定准能赚钱。（《牛津高阶英汉双解词典》）

translation:
adj. 节约的; 经济的; 合算的

分布：经济的(84%)，节俭的(10%)，合算的(6%)


a.节约的,经济的Which method of making the metal helmet is more economical in total?生产这种金属头盔的方法哪一种总体上更节约?
【反】redundant（adj 多余的） 【参】economize（v 节约；有效地利用）；economy（n 经济；节约）



US [-'nɑ:.mɪ-] adjective  ADVANCED  ■not using a lot of fuel, money, etc 经济的；省钱的；节约的
•There's increasing demand for cars which are more economical on fuel.对低油耗汽车的需求与日俱增。

•What's the most economical way of heating this building?给这栋大楼供应暖气，怎样做才是最经济的方法？

UK [ˌi:.kə'nɒm.ɪ.kəl/ UK [ek.ə-] US [-'nɑ:.mɪ-] adjective economical with the truth humorous ■avoiding stating the true facts about a situation, or lying about it 隐瞒真相；撒谎；不完全说出真相
UK [ˌi:.kə'nɒm.ɪ.kəl/ UK [ek.ə-] US [-'nɑ:.mɪ-] adjective   Common Learner Errors   economical or economic?Warning:  choose the right adjective!To refer to the economy of a country or region, don't say 'economical', say economic :✗ Unemployment causes a lot of economical problems.Unemployment causes a lot of economic problems.




financial, econmic, economy, economical

这组词都有“经济的”的意思，其区别是：
financial: 指“财务的，金钱的，财政的，财力的”。
econmic: 指与political“政治的”相对而言的“经济的”。
economy: 在名词前作形容词用，相当于economical，表“节约的”或“经济实惠的”。
economical: 指与“节约”同义的“经济”，含“节约，不浪费”之意。



economical, thrify

economical: adj充分利用而无浪费
thrify: adj花费上节俭；



economical, thrifty

这组词都有“节约的”的意思，其区别是：
economical: 指正当使用财物，强调节省，避免浪费。
thrifty: 侧重节缩开支，积蓄收入。



economical, economic

economical: 节约的，节俭的。如：He is economical of money and time.
economic: 经济(学)的。如：the economic doctrines of Ricardo(李嘉图的经济学说)


adj. 经济的；节约的；合算的
 - managing, paying, saving
examples: (1) She is an economical housekeeper and feeds her family cheaply.(2) We are advocate economical life.(3) This is not an economical method of heating.(4) She writes novels with economical style.(5) She is economical in her use of salt when cooking.(6) A monthly is more economical than 4 weeklies.(7) When we had done the costings on the project, it was clear it would not be economical to go ahead with it.
(1) 她是一个节俭的家庭主妇，她全家的花销不大。(2) 我们提倡俭朴的生活。(3) 这不是一种经济的取暖方式。(4) 她以简练的风格写小说。(5) 她烹饪时用盐很少。(6) 一张月票比四张周票上算。(7) 我们计算了成本，清楚表明这项工程不合算。

translation:
n. 节约; 经济; 理财; 秩序

分布：经济(83%)，经济的(14%)，节约(2%)，廉价的(1%)


→来自weik, 家，词源同vicinity, village. 字母w脱落。-nomy, 学说，管理。原指管理家的学问，后指经济学。
经济(学)(eco环境;经济+nomy;参考：ecology生态学)[nom(y)=a field of knowledge表示"某一领域的知识"]
n.节约;经济We are looking for an economy motel.我们在找一家便宜的汽车旅馆.



US [-'kɑ:.nə-] noun SYSTEM  制度   ESSENTIAL  countable ■the system of trade and industry by which the wealth of a country is made and used 经济；经济制度
•the global economy全球经济

•the German/US economy德国／美国经济

•the state of the economy经济状况

•a weak / strong economy疲软／强劲的经济

•Tourism contributes millions of pounds to the country's economy.旅游业为这个国家带来数百万英镑的经济收入。

UK [ɪ'kɒn.ə.mi] US [-'kɑ:.nə-] noun SAVING MONEY  省钱  countable or uncountable ■the intentional saving of money or, less commonly, the saving of time, energy, words, etc 节省；节约；节俭
•They've had to make economies since Colin lost his job.自从科林失业以来，他们不得不节俭度日。

•This can be done by machines with more speed and economy.这可以用机器来完成，又快又经济。

•She writes with such economy - I've never known a writer say so much in so few words.她惜墨如金——我从没见过哪位作家能如此言简意赅。





financial, econmic, economy, economical

这组词都有“经济的”的意思，其区别是：
financial: 指“财务的，金钱的，财政的，财力的”。
econmic: 指与political“政治的”相对而言的“经济的”。
economy: 在名词前作形容词用，相当于economical，表“节约的”或“经济实惠的”。
economical: 指与“节约”同义的“经济”，含“节约，不浪费”之意。


n. 经济； [经] 节约；理财
 - saving, thrift
examples: n.经济；节约adj.经济的；廉价的

(1) The state of the economy is very worrying.(2) The determinate factor of our economy is to control inflation.(3) The last five years have seen a consistent improvement in the country's economy.(4) She preached economy as the best means of solving the crisis.(5) An economy class air ticket is fit for ordinary workers, because it costs much less.
(1) 目前的经济状况令人十分担忧。(2) 我们经济的决定性因素是控制通货膨胀。(3) 在最近的五年里，这个国家的经济状况一直在好转。(4) 她大力鼓吹节约是解决危机的关键。(5) 经济舱机票对一般工作人员比较合适,因为它的价格要便宜得多。

n. 版次，版本; （报纸、杂志的）一份; （广播、电视节目的）一期; （书、报、杂志等的）一版印刷总数

分布：版(78%)，版本(22%)


→来自edit, 编辑。
n.版,版本,版次It's incredible that the editor's editorial in this edition is edible.本版中的编辑社论可以食用让人难以置信.



noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a particular form in which a book, magazine or newspaper is published 版本
•the  paperback / hardback edition of the dictionary该词典的平装／精装本

•The regional editions of the paper contain specific information for that area.该报地方版刊登一些针对当地读者的内容。
 IMPROVER  ■a single broadcast of a series of radio or television programmes （广播电视节目的）一期，一辑
•This morning's edition of 'Women's Hour' is at the earlier time of a quarter to ten.今天上午的《妇女时光》节目将提前到九点四十五分播出
 IMPROVER  ■the total number of copies of a particular book, newspaper, etc. that are published at the same time 一版印刷总数；版次
•She collects first editions of nineteenth century authors.她收藏19世纪作家著作的初版本。
■US ■one of a series of repeated events （一系列重复进行的事件中的）一次，一回，一届
•The 77th edition of the Indianapolis 500 was held before an estimated 450 000 fans.第77届印弟安纳波里斯500英里汽车赛吸引了大约45万车迷观看。





edition, issue/number, version, copy

edition: 版数；
issue/number: 期数；
version: 译本，版本
copy: 册数；


n. [图情] 版本
 - version

(1) The second edition greatly improves on the first edition.(2) It has just entered the seventh edition.(3) This edition of the dictionary is sold out.(4) Have you read the unabridged edition of that book?(5) They issued a new edition of Lu Xun's works.
(1) 第二版比第一版好了许多。(2) 它刚出版了第七版。(3) 这个版本的字典已售完了。(4) 你读过那本书的全文版本吗？(5) 他们发行了鲁迅著作的一个新版本。

 edition 版本

US [-tˌɚ] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a person who corrects or changes pieces of text or films before they are printed or shown, or a person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine （书的）编辑；（电影电视的）剪辑员；（报刊的）主编

•Who is the current editor of the Times?《泰晤士报》的现任主编是谁？

(1) 编辑把那篇小说改得面目全非。(2) 编辑把整段全删掉了。(3) 他是报纸的副主编。

translation:
n. 教育; 教育学; 培养; 训练

分布：教育(95%)，教育学(4%)，修养(1%)


→e-, 向外。-duc, 引导，词源同duke, conduct,
教育(educate+ion)[duc,duct=lead,bring,表示"引导,带来"]
n.教育,培养,训练I had twelve years of good education.我受过十二年的良好教育.



noun [S or U]  ESSENTIAL  ■the process of teaching or learning in a school or college, or the knowledge that you get from this 教育；受教育获得的知识
•As a child he received most of his education at home.童年时他主要在家中接受教育。

•It's a country which places great importance on education.这是个非常重视教育的国家。

•She lectures in education (= the study of education) at the teacher training college.她在教师培训学院讲授教育学。

•It's important for children to get a good education.孩子得到良好的教育是非常重要的。




n. 教育；培养；教育学
 - cultivation, training, pedagogy
examples: (1) Education develops potential abilities.(2) No country can afford to neglect education.(3) Our teacher expounded his views on education to me at great length.(4) He was handicapped by lack of education.(5) He has a master's degree in education.
(1) 教育能开发人的潜能。(2) 任何国家都不容忽视教育。(3) 我们的老师向我详细讲述了他的教育观点。(4) 他因文化水平低而吃了亏。(5) 他有教育学硕士学位。

translation:
n. 影响; 效果; 印象; 所有物
vt. 使发生; 引起; 产生（效果）

时态：effected, effecting, effects
分布：影响(52%)，效果(31%)，效应(10%)，结果(4%)，引起(1%)，印象(1%)，要旨(1%)


→ef-, 向外。-fect, 做，词源同fact, affect. 即做出来的效果。
实施;生效;效果(ef出+fect→做出来→生效;效果)[fac,fact,fect,fic,fig=make,do,表示"做,制作"]
n.结果;效果;影响;印象vt.招致;实现;达到His affection for the defects is affected by the infectious perfect effect.他对缺点的钟爱受到具有感染力的完美效果的影响.



noun RESULT  结果   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■the result of a particular influence 效果；影响；结果
•The radiation leak has had a disastrous effect on/upon the environment.核辐射外泄给环境带来了灾难性的影响。

•I tried taking tablets for the headache but they didn't have any effect.我试着吃了几颗药片，但头痛一点都没有减轻。

•I think I'm suffering from the effects of too little sleep.我觉得我睡眠太少，健康受到了影响。

•She has a lot of confidence which she uses to good effect (= to her advantage) in interviews.她很自信，在面试时她充分利用这一点，占尽了优势。
⇒ See also after effectstake effect  ADVANCED  ■to produce or achieve the results you want 起作用；产生效果
•They had to wait ten minutes for the anaesthetic to take effect before they stitched up the cut.他们不得不等了十分钟，在麻醉药起作用后才缝合伤口。
for effect mainly disapproving ■If you say or do something for effect, you intentionally do it to shock people or attract their attention 哗众取宠；危言耸听
•I get the impression that she uses bad language in meetings for effect.我觉得她开会时说脏话是在故意引人注意。
in effect ■in fact, or in practice 实际上；事实上
•So in effect the government have lowered taxes for the rich and raised them for the poor.所以呢，实际上政府是为富人减了税，而给穷人加了税。
to that effect (also to the effect that) ■used to express that what you are reporting is only a short and general form of what was really said 有…的意思；大意是…，意思是…
•She said she was unhappy, or words to that effect.她说了一些她很不幸福之类的话。

•He said something to the effect that he would have to change jobs if the situation continued.他话里的意思是说，如果这种情况再持续下去，他将不得不换个工作。

[ɪ'fekt] noun USE  实用   ADVANCED  uncountable ■use 使用；实行；生效
•The present system of payment will remain in effect (= be used) until the end of the rental agreement.在租期结束前，将会继续采用现行的付款方式。

•When do the new driving laws come into effect?新的道路交通安全法规甚么时候开始实施？

•The new salary increases will take effect (= begin) from January onwards.新的加薪标准将从一月份起正式实行。

[ɪ'fekt] noun THEATRE, ETC  剧院等  effects [plural] (also special effects) ■lighting, sounds and objects which are specially produced for the stage or a film and are intended to make something which does not exist seem real 特技效果
•This is a movie worth seeing for its effects alone.这部电影光凭其特技效果就值得一看。

[ɪ'fekt] noun POSSESSIONS  财产  effects [plural] specialized■a person's possessions, especially after their death （尤指死后遗留的）财产，财物，所有物
•It says on the form that the insurance covers all personal effects.表上写明，所有个人财产都在该保险承保范围之内。

[ɪ'fekt] verb transitive formal ■to achieve something and cause it to happen 使发生；实现；完成
•As a political party they are trying to effect a change in the way that we think about our environment.作为一个政治党派，他们正在试图改变我们关于环境的观念。





effect, validity, influence, efficiency

effect: 指某人或某事的影响产生特殊“效果”
validity: 有效性，合法性
influence: 强调“潜移默化”的影响
efficiency: 效率



effect, influenced

effect: 影响，功效 结果，效果，是cause的对应词。表示由于必然或间接因果关系所产生的事物（如身体状况，社会情况或心境）
influenced: 影响



realize, cause, effect, produce

这组词都有“产生、实现”的意思，其区别是：
realize: 着重指把过去的计划或意愿变成现实。
cause: 强调事物的因果关系。
effect: 侧重成功地完成一件要做的事情，强调结果或影响。
produce: 侧重有意或无意地产生出好的或坏的，实际可见的效果。



result, effect, outcome, consequence

这组词都有“结果”的意思，其区别是：
result: 普通用词，含义广泛，侧重因某种原因所产生的最终结果，而不是眼前的结果。
effect: 指因某种原因直接产生的结果，着重持续稳定与其影响。
outcome: 普通用词，多指事物经过一系列发展变化所导致的最终结局，而不是某种原因的直接结果。常可与result通用。
consequence: 多指随某一事件引起的，必然或自然的不良结果，不强调直接的因果关系，而侧重事件发展的逻辑关系。



effect, influence, affect

effect: n. 功效，影响 v. 产生，实现（目的）等
influence: v. 潜移默化的影响人的行为，性格，观点
affect: v. 对…..产生不良影响


n. 影响；效果；作用
 - impression, influence, infection, affection, impact
vt. 产生；达到目的
 - form, inspire
examples: n.效应；结果；影响；印象；效果；要旨v.使产生；引起

(1) The aspirins soon took effect.(2) The advertising campaign didn't have much effect on sales.(3) What is certain is that every effect must have a cause.(4) This will have a negligible effect on the temperature.(5) The general effect of the painting is overwhelming.(6) It's the music to heighten the dramatic effect.(7) That is what he said, to that effect.(8) He told me to get out, or words to that effect.(9) Doctors cannot effect a cure if the disease has spread too far.(10) The temperature often effects a change of the state of matter.
(1) 服下的阿司匹林药片很快见效了。(2) 这些广告攻势对销售额并没有起到多大作用。(3) 每一个结果都有一个原因，这是确定无疑的(4) 这对温度的影响将是微乎其微的。(5) 这幅画给人总的印象是很有气势。(6) 那是用于提高戏剧效果的配乐。(7) 那便是他所说的话(8) 他说了一句叫我走开之类的话。(9) 假如这种疾病已扩散得厉害，医生也无法妙手回春。(10) 温度常常引起物态的变化。

translation:
adj. 有效的; 起作用的; 实际的，实在的; 给人深刻印象
n. [军]现役兵额，有生力量，精兵

分布：有效的(88%)，实际的(8%)，生效的(4%)


→来自effect, 效果。
有效的(effect+ive)[fac,fact,fect,fic,fig=make,do,表示"做,制作"]
a.有效的,生效的;被实施的;给人深刻印象We have taken effective measures to preserve our natural resources.我们已采取有效措施保护自然资源.
【记】ef出，fect做－做出来的效果【参】effect（n 结果；效果；影响；印象）；efficacious（adj 有效的；灵验的）；efficacy（n 功效；效验）



adjective SUCCESSFUL  成功的   ESSENTIAL  ■successful or achieving the results that you want 能产生预期结果的；有效的
•It's an extremely effective cure for a headache.这种药物治疗头痛极其有效。

•The lighting for the production made a very effective use of shadow.该戏剧的舞台灯光设计巧妙地运用了阴影效果。

•She's a very effective teacher.她课上得不错。
 Opposite ineffective
[ɪ'fek.tɪv] adjective IN FACT  事实上的  [before noun] ■in fact, although not officially 实际上的；事实上的
•Although she's not officially our boss, she's in effective control of the office.她虽然名义上不是我们的老板，但实际上掌管着该办事处。

[ɪ'fek.tɪv] adjective IN USE  生效，有效  ■If a law or rule becomes effective, it starts to be used （法律法规）生效的
•The new laws will become effective next month.新法律将在下月正式生效。





efficient, effective

这组词都有“有效的”的意思，其区别是：
efficient: “效率高的”，“有能力的”，用以指人或物，着重有效地利用时间、精力并取得预期效果。如：The German telephone system is highly efficient. (德国的电话系统效率很高。)
effective: 常用以指物，强调能产生某种预期的效果。如：effective medicine, effective method等。


adj. [数] 有效的，起作用的；实际的，实在的；给人深刻印象
 - valid, available, virtual, practical, telling, actual, honest
examples: (1) Advertising is often the most effective method of promotion.(2) Their efforts to improve the production have been very effective.(3) When does the new system become effective?(4) Her brother is the king, but she is the effective ruler.(5) Last year saw a decline in the effective demand for steel.
(1) 做广告往往是最有效的推销方法。(2) 他们提高生产力的措施卓有成效。(3) 新制度何时生效？(4) 她的兄弟是国王, 但她才是实际的主宰者。(5) 去年,钢铁的实际需求下降了。

translation:
n. 效率，效能; 实力，能力; [物]性能; 功效

分布：效率(99%)，功率(1%)


→ef-, 向外。-fic, 做，词源同fact, effect.
效率(ef出+fic做...做出事情...有效率)[-ency,-iency表名词,ence的变体]
n.效率;功效Friction lowers the efficiency of a machine.摩擦减低机器的效率.



noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■when someone or something uses time and energy well, without wasting any 效率；效能
•What is so impressive about their society is the efficiency of the public services.他们的社会给人留下最深刻印象的是其高效率的公共服务。

•energy efficiency能源使用效率
specialized ■the difference between the amount of energy that is put into a machine in the form of fuel, effort, etc. and the amount that comes out of it in the form of movement 效率；功率




effect, validity, influence, efficiency

effect: 指某人或某事的影响产生特殊“效果”
validity: 有效性，合法性
influence: 强调“潜移默化”的影响
efficiency: 效率


n. 效率；效能；功效
 - virtue, potency
examples: (1) We must improve our efficiency as soon as possible.(2) Their labor efficiency is very high.(3) The two companies consolidated for greater efficiency.(4) This jet has a very high propulsive efficiency.(5) Various PA linearization techniques have been adopted to improve linearity and power efficiency of wireless transmitters.
(1) 我们必须尽快地提高工作效率。(2) 他们的工作效率很高。(3) 这两家公司已合并以提高效率。(4) 该喷气机的喷射功率非常大。(5) 于是多种不同功率放大器的线性化技术被采用来改善无线发射机的线性度及效率。

translation:
adj. 有效率的; （直接）生效的; 能干的; （因省钱、省时或省力等而）收效大的

分布：效率高的(87%)，胜任的(13%)


(做事)有效的(ef出+fic+ent→能做出事来→有效率的)[fac,fact,fect,fic,fig=make,do,表示"做,制作"]
a.有效的,效率高的;有能力的,能胜任的The efficient ancient scientist had conscience in science.那个能干的古代科学家在科学上有良知.



adjective  IMPROVER  ■working or operating quickly and effectively in an organized way 效率高的；有能力的；有效的；生效的
•The city's transport system is one of the most efficient in Europe.这座城市的交通系统运行效率很高，在全欧洲名列前茅。

•We need someone really efficient who can organize the office and make it run smoothly.我们需要的人必须要高效干练，善于组织筹划，能使这个办事处顺畅运作。





efficient, effective

这组词都有“有效的”的意思，其区别是：
efficient: “效率高的”，“有能力的”，用以指人或物，着重有效地利用时间、精力并取得预期效果。如：The German telephone system is highly efficient. (德国的电话系统效率很高。)
effective: 常用以指物，强调能产生某种预期的效果。如：effective medicine, effective method等。


adj. 有效率的；有能力的；生效的
 - able, competent
examples: (1) This is a highly efficient new heating system.(2) The success of CAD systems is becoming more dependent on the efficient drafting.(3) He's efficient at his job.(4) I'll say this for them--I'll admit that they're efficient.
(1) 这是个高效的新取暖系统。(2) cad系统的成功在很大程度上取决于草图的制图效率。(3) 他胜任工作。(4) 我得为他们说句话——我会说他们很有能力。

translation:
n. 努力，尝试; 工作; 成就; 杰作

分布：努力(96%)，努力的成果(4%)


→ef-, 向外。-fort, 力量，词源同fort, fortify.
努力,奋发(ef出＋fort→出力→努力)[fore,fort=storng,表示"强大,力量"]
n.努力;成就;艰难的尝试I got this sort of comfortable soft shorts with no efforts.我不费吹灰之力弄到了这种柔软舒适的短裤.



US [-ɚt] noun  ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■physical or mental activity needed to achieve something 气力；精力；努力
•[+ to infinitive] If we could all make an effort to keep this office tidier it would help.如果我们都努力保持整洁，那么办公室的面貌肯定会大有改观。

•You can't expect to have any friends if you don't make any effort with people.如果不努力去和人们交往，你就别想有朋友。

•In their efforts to reduce crime the government expanded the police force.为了减少犯罪，政府扩充了警力。

•He's jogging round the park every morning in an effort to get fit for the football season.为了调整好身体状况迎接这个赛季的足球赛，他现在每天早晨都绕着公园慢跑。

•It takes a long time to prepare the dish but the results are so good that it's worth the effort.做这道菜很费时间，但结果大家都很爱吃，工夫真没白费。
countable ■the result of an attempt to produce something, especially when its quality is low or uncertain （尤指不理想的或难以确定的）结果
•Do you want to have a look at his exam paper? It's a fairly poor effort.你想看看他的试卷吗？成绩可不太好。

UK ['ef.ət] US [-ɚt] noun   Common Learner Errors   effortWarning:  Choose the right verb!Don't say 'do an effort', say make an effort :✗ We must do an effort to improve our English.We must make an effort to improve our English.




trouble, struggle, pains, effort, endeavour

这组词都有“努力”的意思，其区别是：
trouble: 和pains均侧重在面临困难或阻力时所作的努力，但强调在努力时的细心和谨慎，相比之下，pains更适合表示尽力的努力。
struggle: 指为克服困难或阻力所作的努力，也指因决心、意志或干劲而产生的极大努力。
effort: 通常指完成某特定任务所需付出的或大或小的努力，可指一次的努力，也可指坚持不懈的努力。
endeavour: 指持久的，坚持不懈的，甚至是终身的努力，强调努力的认真与决心。


n. 努力；成就
 - achievement, success, pain, struggle, trial
examples: (1) They are making every effort to decrease the production cost.(2) All my efforts were fruitless.
(1) 他们正尽力减少生产成本。(2) 我所有的努力都白费了。

translation:
n. 鸡蛋，蛋; 卵; <俚>家伙
vt. 煽动，怂恿; 用蛋烹调; <俚>向人扔鸡蛋

时态：egged, egging, eggs
分布：蛋(78%)，卵(18%)，怂恿(2%)，煽动(1%)，用蛋覆盖(1%)


→来自owyo, 蛋，词源同ovum,ovular.
n.蛋;卵;卵形物The one-legged beggar begins to beg eggs illegally.独腿乞丐开始非法讨蛋.



noun FOOD  食物   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■the oval object with a hard shell which is produced by female birds, especially chickens, and which is eaten as food （食用的）蛋，尤指鸡蛋
•a hard-boiled/soft-boiled egg煮得老的／嫩的鸡蛋

•How do you like your eggs - fried or boiled?鸡蛋你想怎样吃？是吃煎的还是煮的？
countable ■an object which is made in the shape of a bird's egg 蛋状物
•a chocolate/marble egg巧克力蛋／大理石球

[eg] noun REPRODUCTION  繁殖   ADVANCED  countable ■an oval object, often with a hard shell, which is produced by female birds and particular reptiles and insects, and contains a baby animal which comes out when it is developed （鸟类的）卵，蛋
•The cuckoo lays her egg in another bird's nest.杜鹃将卵产在其他鸟的巢里。

•After fourteen days the eggs hatch.14天后，卵孵化了。
 ADVANCED  countable ■a cell produced by a woman or female animal from which a baby might develop if it combines with sperm from a male 卵，卵子；卵细胞
•Identical twins develop from a single fertilized egg which then splits into two.同卵双胞胎是由一个受精卵分裂发育而来的。

[eg] noun egg on sb's face informal ■If someone has or gets egg on their face, they look stupid because of something that they have done （某人）丢脸，（某人）出丑
•This latest scandal has left the government with egg on its face.最近的这次丑闻让政府丢尽了颜面。

[eg] noun  put all your eggs in one basket informal ■to depend for your success on a single person or plan of action 孤注一掷；把鸡蛋放在同一个篮子里
•I'm applying for several jobs because I don't really want to put all my eggs in one basket.我申请了好几份工作，因为我可不想把鸡蛋都放在同一个篮子里。

[eg] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] egg sb on ■to strongly encourage someone to do something which might not be a very good idea 怂恿，鼓动，煽动（某人）
•Don't egg him on! He gets himself into enough trouble without your encouragement.别再给他煽风点火了，不用你怂恿他，他自己都一身麻烦了。




n. [禽] 蛋；卵子；家伙
 - apple, customer, fellow, guy, bird
vt. 煽动；怂恿
 - encourage, fan
examples: n.蛋；卵；蛋形物vt.用蛋覆盖；向 ... 扔蛋vt.怂恿；煽动

(1) The egg nestled in the long grass.(2) The black hen lays an egg a day.(3) The tadpole hatches from the egg.(4) The egg hatches into a larva (caterpillar).(5) You start your life in an egg like this.(6) Chocolate egg is traditionally eat on Easter day.(7) Egg mayonnaise is made with mayonnaise and hard-boiled eggs.(8) Don't let him egg you on--you shouldn't take any notice of him.(9) Don't egg him on to play a trick on others.(10) Why do you egg him on to do what you won't do yourself?
(1) 蛋隐藏在高草中。(2) 那只黑母鸡每天生一个蛋。(3) 蝌蚪从卵中孵化出来。(4) 卵孵化成了幼虫（毛虫）。(5) 你的生命从这样的一个卵开始。(6) 人们按传统吃巧克力彩蛋庆祝复活节。(7) 鸡蛋美乃滋是用蛋黄酱和煮老的鸡蛋做成的。(8) 别听他煽动，你根本就不要去理睬他。(9) 不要怂恿他捉弄别人。(10) 你自己不干,为什么撺掇他呢?

translation:
num. 八; 八个; 第八
n. 八; 八人（或物）一组; 八人划船队
adj. 八个的

分布：八(97%)，八个的(2%)，八人划船队(1%)


→来自okto, 八，词源同eight ,October.
num.八pron.八(个,只...)He went by the eight o'clock train.他坐八点钟的火车去.



number  ESSENTIAL  ■the number 8 （数字）八
•She was eight years old when her family moved here.八岁那年，她家搬到了这里。

•We've got eight people coming to dinner.有八位客人要到我们家来吃晚餐。




adj. 八的
 - octonary
examples: (1) I'm hardly functional if I don't get eight hours' sleep!(2) You are restricted to eight liters of duty-free wine.(3) There are eight forts in this section of the Great Wall.(4) Five members voted for the proposal, eight voted against, and two abstained.(5) I am sorry, you can only buy traveler's check at Window Eight.(6) His eight sons largely inherited his fortune.(7) There are eight students in the classroom.
(1) 我要是不睡上八个小时就无法工作。(2) 携带的免税酒不得超过八升。(3) 这一段长城有八个垛口。(4) 对于这项建议，五人投票赞成，八人反对，两人弃权。(5) 对不起，你只能在八号窗口买旅行支票。(6) 他的八个儿子继承了他的大部分遗产。(7) 教室里有八个学生。

translation:
num. 十八; 十八个
n. 十八岁; 十八的记号; 十九世纪; 是八点钟

分布：十八(100%)


num.十八,十八个He is eighteen years of age.他十八岁.



number  ESSENTIAL  ■the number 18 （数字）18
•seventeen, eighteen, nineteen17， 18， 19

•an eighteen-storey building一座十八层建筑物
examples: (1) There are eighteen students in that classroom.(2) He entered a university at the age of eighteen.
(1) 那教室里有十八个学生。(2) 他十八岁上大学。

translation:
pron. （两者之中）任何一个
adj. （两者中）任一的; 非此即彼的，两者择一的
adv. （否定句中）也; [用于否定句或否定词组后]也（不…），亦，而且; [口语] [用于否定句或否定词组后以加强语气]根本; 当然
conj. [通常用于“either…or…”结构中]或者，要么[在“either…or…”结构中，动词的人称和数一般与离得最近的主动响应，但有时用第三人称单数，在口语中也有把两个主语合在一起用作复数的]

分布：任一(66%)，任一的(26%)，两方的(8%)


→缩写自古英语aeghwaether, 来自ae, 词源同each. hwaether,同whether. 即两者中永远有一个。
ad.也(不)pron.两者之一a.(两者中)任一的There's coffee or tea - you can have either.咖啡或茶──你可以任选一种.



UK ['i:-] US [-ðɚ] adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■used in negative sentences instead of 'also' or 'too' （在否定句中代表 also 或 too）也
•I don't eat meat and my husband doesn't either.我不吃肉，我丈夫也不吃。

•"I've never been to the States." "I haven't either."“我从没去过美国。”“我也没有。”

•They do really good food at that restaurant and it's not very expensive either.那家餐厅饭菜做得很好，而且价格也不太贵。

UK ['aɪ.ðər] UK ['i:-] US [-ðɚ] determiner pronoun conjunction  ESSENTIAL  ■used when referring to a choice between two possibilities （两种可能性的选择）要么…要么，不是…就是，或者…或者；（两者中）任何一个
•Either candidate would be ideal for the job.这两个人任何一个都是做这项工作的理想人选。

•"Do you prefer pork or beef?" "I don't like either."“你喜欢吃猪肉还是牛肉? ” “任何一样我都不喜欢。”

•"Would you like the metal or plastic one?" "Either will do."“你是要金属的，还是塑胶的？”“哪种都行。”

•You can get there by train or bus - either way/in either case it'll take an hour.去那里你想坐火车和大巴士都行——怎么去都得花一个小时。

•We can either eat now or after the show - it's up to you.我们可以现在吃饭，也可以在演出后吃——由你决定。

•Either you leave now or I call the police!要么你现在离开，要么我就叫员警！

UK ['aɪ.ðər] UK ['i:-] US [-ðɚ] determiner  IMPROVER  ■both （两者中）每个，各方
•Unfortunately I was sitting at the table with smokers on either side of me.真倒楣，餐桌上坐在我两边的人都抽烟。





either, likewise, as well, also, too

这组词都有“也”的意思，其区别是：
either: 用于否定句，放在句末，之前加逗号。
likewise: 是书面语用词。
as well: 一般不用否定句，通常放在句末，强调时可放在句中。
also: 比too正式一些，语气较重，只用于肯定句，一般紧靠动词。
too: 语气较轻，多用于口语，在肯定句中使用，通常位于句末。


conj. 或者
 - or, vel
adv. 也（用于否定句或否定词组后）；根本
 - too, also, ultimately, likewise
examples: adj.任一的；两方的pron.任一adv.也（用于否定句中）conj.或者（常用于either...or...的结构中）

(1) The thief was put in the police car with a policeman on either side of him.(2) You may take either of the roads.(3) If you do not go, I shall not go either.(4) I will go on business either this week or next week.(5) Either we will find a supply, or we will make the goods.
(1) 窃贼被送到警车上，身旁各坐着一个警察。(2) 两条路你随便走哪一条。(3) 你不去，我也不去。(4) 我将在这星期或下星期出差。(5) 我们或是寻求供货，或者自己制造。

translation:
vi. 详尽说明; 变得复杂
vt. 详细制定; 详尽阐述; [生理学]加工; 尽心竭力地做

时态：elaborated, elaborating, elaborates
分布：复杂的(42%)，详尽的(17%)，精美的(15%)，精心的(11%)，变得复杂(6%)，推敲(5%)，详细地说明(3%)，用心制作(1%)


→e-, 向外。-labor, 劳动，辛苦，词源同laboratory.
精工细做的(e+labor劳动＋ate→劳动出来→精做的)[e-,ef-表示"出,出来"]

v./a.精心制作(的);详细阐述(的)The corporate bodies collaborate elaborately on producing vibrating evaporator.法人团体在生产振动蒸发器之后精心制作协作.
【记】e出，labor（n 劳动）一劳动出来的一精致复杂的【参】elaboration（n 苦心经营（的结果）；详尽的细节）【反】abstract（adj 抽象的；摘要的）；simplify（vt 单一化；简化）



US [-ə˞-] ADVANCED  ■containing a lot of careful detail or many detailed parts 精心计划（或制作）的；详尽的；复杂的
•You want a plain blouse to go with that skirt - nothing too elaborate.你应该用一件样式简单的衬衫来配那条裙子，不要样式太复杂的。

•They're making the most elaborate preparations for the wedding.他们正为婚礼做极为精心周到的准备。

•He came out with such an elaborate excuse that I didn't quite believe him.他突然说了那么一大套理由，搞得我不敢相信他。

verb intransitive /ɪˈlæb.ə.reɪt/ slightly formal ■to add more information to or explain something that you have said 详尽说明；阐述
•The minister said he was resigning, but refused to elaborate on his reasons for doing so.部长说他将辞职，但拒绝详细说明原因。




adj. 精心制作的；详尽的；煞费苦心的
 - detailed, full
vt. 精心制作；详细阐述；从简单成分合成（复杂有机物）
 - tailor-make
vi. 详细描述；变复杂
 - thicken
examples: adj.详尽的；复杂的；精心的；精美的v.详细地说明；用心制作；推敲；变得复杂

(1) He launched into an elaborate explanation of his theory.(2) Her elaborate hairstyle, to her disappointment, just amused us.(3) It was not the old man to indulge in elaborate preliminaries.(4) She had prepared herself for a very elaborate show.(5) She went on to elaborate her argument.(6) Please elaborate your plan before Friday.(7) I don't want this simple idea to elaborate as a result of discussions.
(1) 他开始详尽地阐发他的理论。(2) 令她失望的是,她复杂的发型只让我们感到好笑。(3) 这位老人向来不做那种煞费苦心的开场白。(4) 她准备了一场非常精美的表演。(5) 她进而详尽阐述了她的论点。(6) 请在星期五之前做出详细的计划。(7) 我不想这个简单的观点经过一次次讨论之后变得复杂。

translation:
adj. 有弹力的; 可伸缩的; 灵活的
n. 松紧带，橡皮圈

分布：有弹性的(57%)，灵活的(20%)，橡皮圈(16%)，有松紧的东西(5%)，可变的(2%)


→来自希腊文elastos, 延展的，有弹性的。
a.弹性的n.松紧带,橡皮圈The rules are elastic.这些规章是有弹性的.
【记】last（v 持续；维持）－能维持原状一有弹性的【参】inelastic（adj 无弹性的）



adjective ■describes material that is able to stretch and be returned to its original shape or size 有弹性的
•A lot of sportswear is made of very elastic material.许多运动装都是用弹性较大的材料制成的。
■able or likely to be changed 灵活的；易顺应（变化）的
•The project has only just started so any plans are still very elastic.案子才刚刚启动，所以各项计划都留有很大余地。

•In this country, time is an elastic concept.在这个国家，人们对时间的概念没有那么严格。

[ɪ'læs.tɪk] noun uncountable ■a type of rubber that is able to stretch and be returned to its original shape or size 松紧带；橡皮筋
•His trousers were held up with a piece of elastic.他用一条橡皮筋系住裤腰。





plastic, elastic, flexible

这组词都有“弹性的，易弯曲的”的意思，其区别是：
plastic: 科技用词，指事物质地柔软，易造型，可塑造成所需的形状。
elastic: 强调物体的伸展性，也可作引申用。
flexible: 主要指有韧性，暗示有可以弯曲而不脆继的特性，但不一定有弹性。也可作引申用。


adj. [力] 有弹性的；灵活的；易伸缩的
 - flexible, stretchy
n. 松紧带；橡皮圈
 - band, rubberband
examples: adj.灵活的；有弹性的；可变的n.橡皮圈；有松紧的东西

(1) The new policy was sufficiently elastic to accommodate both views.(2) Rubber is elastic.(3) This swimming costume is made of elastic material.(4) The slacks have an elastic waistband.(5) It snapped back like a piece of elastic.(6) I stretched that piece of elastic to its fullest extent.(7) This skirt needs some new elastic in the waist.
(1) 新政策充分灵活地适用两种观点。(2) 橡皮是有弹性的。(3) 这件游泳衣是由弹性材料做成的。(4) 这条便裤的腰带可伸缩。(5) 它像一条橡皮带那样迅速弹回。(6) 我将这条橡皮筋拉长到最大限度。(7) 这条裙子需要换一根松紧腰带。

【记】el旧时量布的长度，大约是小臂的长度；bow（n 弓形）读：埃尔伯（拜仁球星）是拜仁的左膀右臂－肘关节



US [-boʊ] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■the part in the middle of the arm where it bends, or the part of a piece of clothing which covers this area 肘；（衣服的）肘部
•Her arm was bandaged from the elbow to the fingers.她的手臂从肘部一直到手指全部缠上了绷带。

•The sleeve of his shirt was torn at the elbow.他衬衫的肘部被撕了个洞。

UK ['el.bəʊ] US [-boʊ] noun countable at sb's elbow ■close to and a little behind someone 在（某人）近旁；紧随（某人）之后；紧紧伴随（某人）
•During the visit, the interpreter was always at her elbow.在她参观的过程中，翻译始终紧随其后。

UK ['el.bəʊ] US [-boʊ] noun countable give sb the elbow UK informal ■to end your romantic relationship with someone 甩掉，和（恋人）分手
UK ['el.bəʊ] US [-boʊ] verb transitive usually + adverb or preposition disapproving■to push someone rudely with your elbows so that you can move or have more space 用肘推；用肘挤开（某人）
•He elbowed his way to the front of the crowd.他挤到了人群的前面。

•They elbowed the onlookers aside.他们把旁观者推到一边。
■to hit someone with your elbow, sometimes as a sign to make them notice or remember something （为让某人注意或记住某事而）用肘碰
•She elbowed me in the ribs before I could say anything.我还没开口呢，她就用肘在我肋部捅了一下。

UK ['el.bəʊ] US [-boʊ] verb transitive usually + adverb or preposition   Phrasal Verbs   [M often passive] elbow sb out ■to force someone or something out of a position or job 排挤；强行使…离开（职位或工作）
•He resigned before he was elbowed out.他不等被别人排挤出去，就自己先辞了职。

translation:
vt. 选举; 挑出，挑选; 决定

adj. 精选的，选出的; 选中的，当选而尚未就职的
n. 被选的人

时态：elected, electing, elects
分布：选举(69%)，选择(23%)，当选的(5%)，精选的(2%)，被选中者(1%)


→e-, 向外。-lect, 收集，选出，词源同collect,elite.
选出,选举(e出+lect→选出)[lect,lig=choose,gather表示"选择,收集"]
v.选举,推选;选择,作出选择In the selection the lecturer neglected the negligible negative reflection on the election.在选集中演讲者忽视了对选举的微不足道的消极反思.



verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to decide on or choose, especially to choose a person for a particular job, by voting 选举，推选
•The Government is elected for a five-year term of office.政府由选举产生，执政期为五年。

•[+ as + noun] We elected him as our representative.我们选他当代表。

•[+ noun] She was elected Chair of the Board of Governors.她被选为董事会主席。

•[+ to infinitive] The group elected one of its members to be their spokesperson.该团体选出了他们的一名成员代表他们发言。
elect to do sth  IMPROVER  formal ■to choose to do a particular thing 选择做…
•She elected to take early retirement instead of moving to the new location.她不想前往新的工作地点，就选择了提前退休。

[ɪ'lekt] plural noun the elect  IMPROVER  formal ■in the Bible, people who are chosen by God （《圣经》中所称的）上帝的选民 IMPROVER  humorous ■any group of people who have been specially chosen for their particular qualities 特权集团；特殊阶层




elect, select, pick, prefer, choose, opt

这组词都有“选择”的意思，其区别是：
elect: 指按照一定的规章或法律，用投票等方式进行的认真慎重的选择。
select: 书面用词，具有庄严、正式的感情色彩。强调精选。
pick: 口语用词，多指从个人角度仔细挑选，也含任意挑选之意。
prefer: 强调个人偏爱，不一定有选择的行动。
choose: 普通用词，侧重根据个人意愿和判断从众多的对象中进行选择，着重被选者的优点。
opt: 多指在几种可能性之间进行选择。


adj. 选出的；当选的；卓越的
 - remarkable, excellent, prominent
vt. 选举；选择；推选
 - opt for, to make a choice
vi. 作出选择；进行选举
 - take one's choice
examples: v.选举；选择adj.精选的；当选的；[神学]被上帝选中的n.被选中者；[神学]上帝的选民

(1) They elected him chairman.(2) They organized a poll to elect a president.(3) You can't elect to deal at some other rate.(4) The President elect will be installed next week.(5) Voters in New Jersey and Virginia will head to the polls to elect governors.
(1) 他们选他做主席。(2) 他们组织了一次投票选举总统。(3) 不能选择其他价格。(4) 候任总统将在下周正式就任。(5) 新泽西州和弗吉利亚的选民将投票选出他们的州长。

translation:
n. 选举，当选; 选举权; [神]神的选择

分布：选举(89%)，当选(9%)，选举权(2%)


选举(elect+ion)[lect,lig=choose,gather表示"选择,收集"]



noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■a time when people vote in order to choose someone for a political or official job 选举
•The Government is expected to call an election (= allow the country to vote) very soon.预计政府会很快举行大选。

•Local government elections will take place in May.地方政府选举将在五月份举行。

•The first election results have started to come in.初步选举结果开始揭晓。
⇒ See also by-election;general election




election, preference, choice, alternative, selection, option

这组词都有“选择”的意思，其区别是：
election: 强调目的和达到目的判断能力。
preference: 侧重因偏见、爱好或判断等而进行选择。
choice: 侧重指自由选择的权利或特权。
alternative: 指在相互排斥的两者之间作严格的选择，也可指在两者以上中进行选择。
selection: 指作广泛的选择，着重选择者的识别力或鉴赏力。
option: 着重特别给予的选择权利或权力，所选物常常相互排斥。


n. 选举；当选；选择权；上帝的选拔
 - option, vote, choice
examples: (1) Our party was routed at the election.(2) I may vote for her at the next election.(3) After the election the party was reduced to a rump.(4) The democrats hope to get back at the next election.(5) It's impossible to tell who will win the next election.
(1) 我们党在竞选中被彻底击败了。(2) 下届选举我可能选她。(3) 选举之后，该党的党员所剩无几了。(4) 民主党希望在下次大选中重新执政。(5) 下届选举谁能获胜无法预知。

UK [ɪˌlek'trɒn.ɪk] US [-'trɑ:.nɪk] adjective COMPUTING  电脑技术   ESSENTIAL  ■relating to computers or something that is done by computers 电脑的；电子的
•electronic communication/cash电子通迅／货币

electrical, electric, electronic

这三词都与电有关
electrical: 多指本身不产生电，但是与电有关的。如：electrical engineering(电机工程)；an electrical transcription(广播唱片)

electronic: 电子的，电子操作的。如：electronic engineering(电子工程学)
examples: (1) I am very interested in electronics.(2) My son has been doing electronics at Princeton.(3) A few years ago, it would have needed a shoe-box of electronics to drive it, and it would still have been hit-or-miss.

US [-'trɑ:.nɪk] adjective ELECTRICAL  电的   ESSENTIAL  ■(especially of equipment), using, based on or used in a system of operation which involves the control of electric current by various devices （尤指设备）使用电子器件的，电子的

•electronic components/devices电子元件／设备

•electronic communication/cash电子通迅／货币

•electronic publishing电子出版





electrical, electric, electronic

这三词都与电有关
electrical: 多指本身不产生电，但是与电有关的。如：electrical engineering(电机工程)；an electrical transcription(广播唱片)

translation:
n. [化]元素; 要素; 原理; [电]电阻丝

分布：元素(85%)，要素(10%)，元件(5%)


→来自elementum, 基础，基本。
n.元素;要素;成分;元件;自然环境The mental patient thinks the cement is the elementary element of the ornament.精神病人认为水泥是装饰品的基本成分.
【参】elemental（adj 基础的；自然力的）；elementary（adj 初步的；基本的；元素的）【反】pith（n 精华；精髓）－superficial element（表面因素）；adjunct（n 附件）－essential element（要素）



noun PART  部分   IMPROVER  countable ■a part of something 部分；部件；要素
•List the elements which make up a perfect dinner party.列举出一次尽善尽美的晚宴的所有构成要素。

•The film had all the elements of a good thriller.这部电影具备了一部精彩的惊栗片的一切要素。

•We weren't even taught the elements of (= basic information about) physics at school.学校连基本的物理知识都没有教给我们。

['el.ɪ.mənt] noun AMOUNT  数量  an element of sth  ADVANCED  ■a small amount of an emotion or quality 少量；有点，有些
•There was certainly an element of truth in what she said.她说的话当然也有些是真的。

•Don't you think there's an element of jealousy in all of this?你不觉得所有这一切都是妒嫉在隐隐作祟?

•We walked quietly up to the door to preserve the element of surprise.我们轻手轻脚地走近门口，想制造一个惊喜。

['el.ɪ.mənt] noun SIMPLE SUBSTANCE  简单物质  countable ■a simple substance which cannot be reduced to smaller chemical parts 元素
•Aluminium is an element.铝是一种元素。

['el.ɪ.mənt] noun EARTH, AIR, ETC.  地球，空气等  countable old use ■earth, air, fire and water from which people believed everything else was made 四大元素（旧时人们认为构成一切事物的土、风、火、水）
['el.ɪ.mənt] noun WEATHER  天气  the elements [plural] ■the weather, usually bad weather 天气，（通常指）恶劣天气
•We decided to brave the elements and go for a walk (= go for a walk despite the bad weather).我们决定冒着风雨去散步。

['el.ɪ.mənt] noun HEAT  热  countable ■the part of an electrical device which produces heat 电热元件；电热丝
•a heating element电热元件

•The kettle needs a new element.电水壶该换新的电热丝了。

['el.ɪ.mənt] noun be in your element ■to be happy because you are doing what you like or can do best 适得其所；得心应手
•Kate, of course, was in her element, making all the arrangements.凯特安排这一切当然是得心应手。

['el.ɪ.mənt] noun be out of your element ■to be unhappy and feel uncomfortable in a particular situation 不得其所；不适应




element, component, constituent, ingredient

这组词都有“组成、成分、部分”的意思，其区别是：
element: 指一个整体必不可少或固有的部分，强调一个复杂整体中最基本、最简单的元件、元素或成分等。
component: 指一个整体的组成部分。
constituent: 常可与component换用，指某一整体不可少的部分或成分。
ingredient: 普通用词，含义笼统。既可指混在一起而本身没有变化的物质，如配料，又可指与别的物质混在一起，发生了变化的成分。



element, component, ingredient, factor

这组词都有“组成成分”的意思，其区别是：
element: n.元素；组成部分，方面；某特定类型的人或群体，分子。
 • The elements hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.   氢元素和氧元素构成了水。
 • He belongs to a bad element in this city.   他属于这个城市的坏分子。
component: n.零部件；(某事物的)组成部分；成分。
 • Tires, the engine, the body, and the seats are component of a car.   轮胎，引擎，车身以及坐椅都是一辆汽车的零部件。
ingredient: n.原料，成分，要素。
 • Flour, milk, butter and yeast are some ingredients in bread.   面粉、牛奶、黄油和酵母是做面包的一些原料。
factor: n.因素，要素，侧重指原因。
 • Endurance is an important factor in success in sports.   耐力是体育比赛成功的一个重要因素。



element, component, composition, ingredient

element: 指“元素”类的“成分”
component: 尤用于机械装置的成分
composition: 尤用于指物体内在固有的不可分割的成分，如氢于水
ingredient: 主要指混合物的成分


n. [数] 元素；要素；原理；成分；自然环境
 - theory, mechanism, factor, basic, essential
examples: n.要素；元素；（学科的）基本原则；(复数)恶劣天气；元件

(1) Justice is an important element of good government.(2) Honesty, industry and kindness are elements of a good life.(3) Water is composed of the elements hydrogen and oxygen.(4) You must understand the elements of mathematics before we can proceed further.(5) These trees are exposed to (the fury of) the elements.
(1) 公正是仁政的要素.(2) 诚实、勤劳和善良是幸福生活的要素。(3) 水是由氢元素和氧元素组成的。(4) 你必须先弄懂数学基础知识，我们才能进一步学习。(5) 这些树经受着风吹雨打.

translation:
adj. 基本的; 初级的; [化]元素的; 初等

分布：基本的(60%)，初级的(25%)，元素的(15%)


→来自element, 基础，基本。
基本的(element元素,要素)[-ary 1.表形容词"…的"2.表名词"人,场所,物"]
a.初步的;基本的;[化]元素的;自然力的The mental patient thinks the cement is the elementary element of the ornament.精神病人认为水泥是装饰品的基本成分.



US [-tˌɚ-] adjective ■basic 基本的
•I have an elementary knowledge of physics.我懂一些基本的物理知识。

•They made some elementary mistakes.他们犯了一些很基础的错误。

•Millions of travellers fail to take even the most elementary of precautions.上百万的旅客甚至没有采取最基本的预防措施。
■relating to the early stages of studying a subject 初级的；基础的
•This book contains a series of elementary exercises for learners.本书含有为学习者设计的一系列基础练习。





basic, fundamental, elementary

basic: a.基本的，基础的，既可用于具体事物，也可用于抽象事物。
 • He has a basic understanding of the problem.   他对问题有基本的了解。
fundamental: a.根本性的，一般只用于抽象的事物；必要的，必须的。
 • Honesty is a fundamental principle in dealing with others.   诚实是与别人相处的基本原则。
elementary: a.初步的，初级的。elementary school小学



primary, elemental, elementary

这组词都有“基本的”的意思，其区别是：
primary: 可与作“初步的，初级”的elementary换用。
elemental: 强调属于事物的基础或本质。
elementary: 指属于事物的初步或起始阶段


adj. 基本的；初级的； [化学] 元素的
 - basic, fundamental, essential, primary, first
examples: (1) He is ignorant of even the most elementary facts.(2) They lack the most elementary sanitary facilities.(3) This is the elementary rules of social conduct.(4) This elementary school is affiliated to a university.
(1) 他连最基本的事实都不知道。(2) 他们缺乏最基本的卫生设备。(3) 这是社会行为的基本原则。(4) 这所小学附属于一所大学。

translation:
num. 第十一; 十一分之一的
n. 第十一; （每月的）第十一日; 十一分之一

分布：第十一(46%)，第十一的(27%)，十一分之一的(27%)


ordinal number ■11th written as a word 第十一（的）
[ɪ'lev.ənθ] ordinal number the eleventh hour ■the last moment or almost too late 最后一刻，最后时刻
•We only received the signatures at the eleventh hour.我们只是在最后一刻才收到签名。

•an eleventh-hour decision by the union to call off the strike工会在最后一刻作出的取消罢工的决定

[ɪ'lev.ənθ] noun countable ■one of eleven equal parts of something 十一分之一
examples: n.第十一adj.第十一的；十一分之一的
(1) I was born on January eleventh.(2) The president's visit was called off at the eleventh hour.(3) November is the eleventh month of the year.
(1) 我生于一月十一日。(2) 总裁的这次访问到最后取消了。(3) 十一月是一年中的第十一个月。

translation:
vt. 排除，消除; 淘汰; 除掉; <口>干掉

时态：eliminated, eliminating, eliminates
分布：淘汰(43%)，除去(31%)，剔除(19%)，忽略(7%)


→e-, 向外。-limin, 界限，门槛，词源同limit, sublime.
消灭;删除(e出+limin+ate→[赶]出门槛→删除)[limin,lim=threshold,表示"门槛,限制"]
vt.除去;淘汰;排(删,消)除;削减(人员)The limitation on the imitations is preliminarily eliminated.对模仿的限制初步被消除.
【记】e出，limi界限一扔出界限一淘汰



verb  IMPROVER  transitive ■to remove or take away 排除；消除；清除
•A move towards healthy eating could help eliminate heart disease.养成健康的饮食习惯有助于消除心脏病诱因。

•We eliminated the possibility that it could have been an accident.我们排除了这或许是一埸意外事故的可能性。

•The police eliminated him from their enquiries.员警已把他排除在调查对象之外。
 IMPROVER  transitive often passive ■to defeat someone so that they cannot continue in a competition （比赛中）淘汰
•He was eliminated in the third round of the competition.他在第三轮比赛中被淘汰。
 IMPROVER  transitive slang ■to murder 消灭；干掉
•A police officer was accused of helping a drug gang eliminate rivals.一名员警被指控帮助一个贩毒黑帮铲平敌对帮派。





extinguish, dispose, erase, exclude, cancel, eliminate, abolish

这组词都有“取消，除掉”的意思，其区别是：
extinguish: v.熄灭，扑灭(火)；使沉默，使暗淡。
 • Firefighters extinguished a big fire.   消防队员扑灭了大火。
dispose: v.处理，处置；表示“除掉、扔掉”时常与of连用。(这一点需要注意。)
 • After your picnic, please dispose of the litter.   野餐后请清除掉垃圾。
erase: v.除去，擦掉，指有意识地除去字迹、声音等。
 • I erased the music on the tape before recording on the tape again.   我在往磁带上录音之前先消掉了上面的音乐。
exclude: v.排斥；排除，不包括在内，与include互为反义词。
 • The restaurant excludes anyone who is not properly dressed from entering.   衣冠不整者不得进入该餐馆。
cancel: v.对预先安排的某种活动(如旅行、计划、会议等)的取消；删去(字、句)。
 • The meeting has been cancelled because of the flu.   会议由于流感而取消了。
eliminate: v.指消除、淘汰已经存在但是现在不需要的东西。
 • The losing team was eliminated from further competition.   失利的那个队被淘汰了，不能参加下一阶段的比赛。
 • The doctor helped him eliminate toxins from the intestine.   医生帮助他排出肠中毒素。
abolish: v.指对法律、习俗、制度的废除；完全破坏。
 • The government abolished the tax on alcohol.   政府取消了酒税。



preclude, discard, abandon, eliminate, abolish, dismiss

preclude: 排除
discard: 丢弃，抛弃（可指人也可指物）
abandon: 放弃（某物）
eliminate: 消除，淘汰
abolish: （依法）废除
dismiss: 解雇



remove, expel, eliminate, dismiss

这组词都有“开除，驱出，去掉”的意思，其区别是：
remove: 普通用词，不带任何感情色彩。
expel: 多指强行解除公职或驱出住地。
eliminate: 通常指例行的、有步骤地去掉某物或某人。
dismiss: 既可指突然地迅速地排除，也可指解雇或开除。


vt. 消除；排除
 - avoid, exclude
examples: (1) You must eliminate an unknown quantity.(2) Let us eliminate all uncertain on thought.(3) We must eliminate unnecessary steps and get directly to the point.(4) Their team was eliminated in the first round.
(1) 你必须消去一个未知数。(2) 让我们从思想上消除一切疑惑。(3) 我们必须忽略不必要的步骤,直接切入主题。(4) 他们队在第一轮就被淘汰了。

translation:
n. 排除; 除去; 根除; 淘汰

分布：消除(78%)，淘汰(19%)，除去(3%)


noun uncountable ■the removal of something 排除；消除，清除；淘汰
•the elimination of disease/pain消除疾病／解除疼痛

•their elimination from the competition他们被淘汰出局
by a process of elimination ■by removing from several possible answers the ones which are unlikely to be correct until only one is left 用排除法
•We eventually found the answer by a process of elimination.我们最终运用排除法得到了答案。




n. 消除；淘汰；除去
 - removing, erasure
examples: (1) Check out the chart below for general weed identification and elimination methods.(2) Elimination of phosphorous pentachloride was accomplished utilizing conventional extraction techniques.(3) You can crack the code by a process of elimination.(4) Treatment is based on elimination of moisture from the ear canal.(5) This is a single elimination tournament.
(1) 那就查阅下面的普通杂草识别和除去方法。(2) 使用传统的萃取技术除去五氯化磷。(3) 你可以用消除法破解这个密码。(4) 治疗首先在于消除耳道内的水分。(5) 这是一场简单的淘汰赛。

translation:
adv. 其他; 否则; 另外
adj. 别的; 其他的

分布：其他(60%)，此外(40%)


→来自al, 其它，词源同alias, alien.
ad.其它,另外,别的;[与or连用]否则Would you like anything else to drink?你还要喝点别的什么吗?



adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■used after words beginning with any-, every-, no- and some-, or after how, what, where, who, why but not which, to mean other, another, different, extra （用于以 any-，every-，no- 和 some- 开头的词后面，或用于 how，what，where，who，why 之后，但不用于 which 之后）其他，另外，别的
•Everybody else has (= All the other people have) agreed except for you.除了你其他人都同意了。

•If it doesn't work, try something else (= something different).如果这个行不通，试试别的。

•Let's go before they ask us to visit anyone else (= another person).趁他们还没有让我们再去拜访别人，我们还是走吧。

•It's not my bag. It must be someone else's (= it must belong to another person).这不是我的皮包，肯定是别人的。

•The book isn't here. Where else (= In what other place) should I look?书不在这里，我该再到哪里去看看呢？

•He came to see you. Why else (= For what other reason) would he come?他来是为了见你，他还能有甚么别的目的？

•After I'd thanked them I didn't know what else (= what other things) to say.我对他们道了谢，然后就不知道该说些甚么了。

[els] adverb or else ■used to say what will happen if another thing does not happen 否则，要不然
•We must be there by six, or else we'll miss the beginning.我们一定要在六点前赶到那里，要不然就会错过开场。
■used to compare two different things or situations （用于对比两种不同的事物或情形）要不，要么
•She's either really talkative and you can't shut her up or else she's silent.她要么滔滔不绝，你都堵不了她的嘴，要么就一言不发。
 informal ■used as a threat, sometimes humorously （表示威胁，有时是一种幽默的说法）要不然，否则的话：
•He'd better find it quickly, or else (= or I will punish him in some way) !他最好马上找到它，要不然，哼！




adv. 其他；否则；另外
 - otherwise, extra
adj. 别的；其他的
 - other, tother
examples: adv.其他；此外；(常与or连用)否则、不然

(1) Ask somebody else.(2) Would you like anything else to drink?(3) Yesterday, we went to the department store and nowhere else.(4) Hurry, or else you'll be late.(5) You will stay away from my girlfriend, or else.
(1) 问问别人。(2) 你还要喝点别的什么吗?(3) 昨天我们到百货公司去了, 其他什么地方也没去。(4) 快点儿，不然你要迟到了。(5) 离我女朋友远点,否则要你好看。

translation:
adv. 在别处，到别处; 他

分布：别处(100%)


ad.在别处,向别处I also heard of the false pulses elsewhere.我在别处也听说过这些虚假脉冲.



US [-'wer/ UK ['--] adverb  IMPROVER  ■at, in, from, or to another place or other places; anywhere or somewhere else 在别处；去别处；到别处
•The report looks at economic growth in Europe and elsewhere.这份报告研究了欧洲和其他地区的经济成长状况。

•They couldn't find what they wanted and decided to look elsewhere.他们找不到他们想要的东西，就决定到别处去看看。




adv. 在别处；到别处
 - otherwhere
examples: (1) I shall go elsewhere.(2) You can't find anything like this elsewhere.(3) He lived elsewhere during the summer months.(4) If the restaurant is full we can go elsewhere.
