translation:
vt. & vi. （使）窘迫，（使）局促不安; （使）困难

时态：embarrassed, embarrassing, embarrasses
分布：使尴尬(37%)，窘迫(28%)，使窘迫(21%)，使为难(14%)


→em-, 进入，使。bar, 阻止。-ass, 大词后缀，见largess.
使难堪(em+barrass套子→进入套子→难堪)[em-,en-①表示"进入…之中,包围"②表示"使…进入状态"]
使发育,使难堪(em进入+barr+ass表名词→被拦住→使难堪)[barr=stick表示,"捧,栏"]
vt.使困窘,使局促不安;阻碍,麻烦It was not the aluminum but the massive brass and bronze on the grass that embarrassed me.让我为难的不是铝而是草地上厚重的黄铜和青铜.
【记】em进入，barrass＝barrel（n 桶）－使你进入桶里－使难堪



US [-'ber-] verb transitive  ADVANCED  ■to cause someone to feel nervous, worried or uncomfortable 使尴尬，使窘迫；使为难
•You're embarrassing him with your compliments!你的赞美之词使他很不好意思。

•I didn't want to embarrass her in front of her friends.我并不想在她朋友面前让她感到难堪。





puzzle, confound, bewilder, perplex, confuse, distract, embarrass, baffle

这组词都有“使困惑、迷惑、糊涂、伤脑筋”的意思，其区别是：
puzzle: 侧重使人难于理解、困惑、伤脑筋。
confound: 常指人惊慌失措和狼狈不堪。
bewilder: 语气强烈，指因迷不解或惊愕而慌乱，不知所措，无法清醒地思考。
perplex: 除困惑外，还含焦虑或缺乏把握之意，因而难于作出决定，无从下手处理。
confuse: 语气较弱，指由于混淆、混乱而糊涂。
distract: 主要用于注意力分散、思想矛盾或过分激动时产生的昏乱。
embarrass: 常指因处境或困难问题而感到窘迫、局促不安或焦急而不知所措。
baffle: 语气最强，多指遇见奇怪情景或复杂困难情况时所产生的惶恐困惑心理。


vt. 使局促不安；使困窘；阻碍
 - slow, abash
examples: vt.使窘迫；使尴尬；使为难vi.窘迫

(1) She dragged up that incident just to embarrass me.(2) He was embarrassed by many debts.(3) She may embarrass you with her uncouth behavior.(4) You didn't embarrass me in the slightest.(5) Eye contact may convey sincerity and attentiveness in Western cultures but too much eye contact may embarrass people in some Oriental cultures.(6) True, job interviews are rife with opportunities for you to embarrass yourself, but hiring managers are more forgiving than you might think.
(1) 她又扯起那件事故意想使我难堪。(2) 他被很多债务弄得焦灼不安。(3) 她的粗野行为可能会让你尴尬。(4) 你一点也没让我为难。(5) 在西方文化，目光接触能传递真诚和关注，但太多的目光接触在某些东方文化中则令人窘迫。(6) 不错，面试中充溢了令人窘迫的陷阱，不过招聘经理可比你想象的要宽容。

translation:
vt. & vi. 拥抱
vt. 包括; 包含; 接受; 信奉
n. 拥抱，怀抱

时态：embraced, embracing, embraces
分布：拥抱(64%)，接受(25%)，信奉(5%)，包含(4%)，包围(2%)


→em-, 进入，使。brace, 胳膊，箍子。
拥抱(em+brace胳膊→进入怀抱)[em-,en-①表示"进入…之中,包围"②表示"使…进入状态"]
拥抱;包括(em进入+brace→进入两臂→拥抱)[brace=two arms表示"两臂"]
v.拥抱;包含;包围;环绕;采用;接受I feel a trace of disgrace for the gracious man's embracing her bracelet.我对仁慈男子拥抱她的手镯感到一丝耻辱.
【记】em进入，brace胳膊－拥抱【反】eschew（v 避开）；ostracize（v 放逐）；spurn（v 弃绝）；abrogate（vt 废除；取消）；abjure（vt 发誓放弃）；renounce（v 断绝关系）；condemn（vt 判刑；谴责）



verb ACCEPT  接受   ADVANCED  transitive formal ■to accept something enthusiastically 欣然接受；乐意采纳
•This was an opportunity that he would embrace.这样的机会他是求之不得的。

[ɪm'breɪs] verb HOLD  抱  intransitive or transitive literary ■to hold someone tightly with both arms to express love, liking or sympathy, or when greeting or leaving someone 抱，拥抱
•She saw them embrace on the station platform.她看到他们在月台上拥抱。

•He leant over to embrace the child.他弯腰去拥抱那个孩子。

[ɪm'breɪs] verb INCLUDE  包括  transitive formal ■to include something, often as one of a number of things 包括，包含
•Linguistics embraces a diverse range of subjects such as phonetics and stylistics.语言学包括一系列不同的科目，如语音学和文体学。





hold, contain, involve, embrace, comprise, comprehend, include

这组词都有“包括，包含”的意思，其区别是：
hold: 常和contain换用。指能够容纳或有足够的容纳量。强调包容能力。
contain: 普通用词，所涉及的物体常常是其组成部分或内容。强调包容关系。既可指具体有形的东西，也可指抽象无形的东西。
involve: 把包含因整体的性质决定的成分或结果。所包括的往往是无形的，不可触知的东西，多用作引申。
embrace: 正式用词，指把某事物纳入整个之中。
comprise: 书面用词，暗指一个整体包括不同部分所组成，可与include交换使用。
comprehend: 正工用词，指包含在整体范围以内。
include: 普通用词，指一整体包含着各独立的部分，也指某东西包含另一东西的某一部分。


vt. 拥抱；信奉，皈依；包含
 - involve, contain
vi. 拥抱
 - hug, cuddle
n. 拥抱
 - hug
examples: [联想] un（不能）breath（呼吸），拥抱（embrace）的太紧，不能呼吸了
v.拥抱；包含；包围；接受；信奉n.拥抱

(1) We embraced each other.(2) She held out her arms to embrace the little girl.(3) Many subjects are embraced in an encyclopedia.(4) We allowed the warm water to embrace us.(5) Vines embraced the hut.(6) She eagerly embraced the offer of a trip to Europe.(7) The settlers embraced the Christian religion.(8) He enfolded the child in an affectionate embrace.
(1) 我们互相拥抱。(2) 她伸出双臂来拥抱那个小女孩。(3) 百科全书中包含许多科目。(4) 我们让温水包围我们(5) 蔓藤环绕着小屋。(6) 她热情地接受了到欧洲旅行的建议。(7) 移民信奉基督教。(8) 他疼爱得把孩子紧紧搂在怀里。

translation:
vi. 出现，浮现; 暴露; 摆脱

时态：emerged, emerging, emerges
分布：浮现(100%)


→e-, 向外。-merge, 浸没，词源同immerse, submerge.
浮现(e+merge投入;淹没→淹没的东西出现→浮现)[e-,ef-表示"出,出来"]
浮现,出现(e出+merge→沉的东西出现→浮现)[merg,mers=sink,表示"沉,没"]
vt.显现,浮现;暴露;形成;The sun soon emerged from behind the clouds.太阳不久从云朵后钻出.
【记】merge（v 吞没；合并）【参】submerge（v 潜水）；emergence（n 浮现；露出；出现）【区】emergency（n 紧急情况；突然事件）



US [-'mɝ:dʒ] verb intransitive APPEAR  出现   IMPROVER  ■to appear by coming out of something or out from behind something 出现，浮现；露出
•She emerged from the sea, blue with cold.她浮出了海面，浑身冻得发青。
 IMPROVER  ■to come to the end of a difficult period or experience （从困境中）摆脱出来，存活下来
•The Prince emerged unscathed from the scandal.王子安然走出了丑闻。

UK [ɪ'mɜ:dʒ] US [-'mɝ:dʒ] verb intransitive BECOME KNOWN  为人所知   ADVANCED  ■to become known, especially as a result of examining something or asking questions about it （尤指经过审查或讯问后）为人知晓，显露，暴露
•The facts behind the scandal are sure to emerge eventually.丑闻背后的真相最终一定会水落石出。

•[+ that] It has emerged that secret talks had been going on between the two companies before the takeover was announced.现在已经真相大白，原来在接管计划宣布之前，两家公司一直在进行秘密会谈。

•She's the most exciting British singer to emerge on the pop scene for a decade.她是十年来在流行乐坛崭露头角的英国歌手中最令人兴奋的一位。





appear, show, emerge, loom

这组词都有“出现”的意思，其区别是：
appear: 强调公开露面，被看见。
show: 语气较强，强调“露出来”。
emerge: 侧重缓缓出现的过程。
loom: 指朦胧出现，好像从雾中浮现出来一样。


vi. 浮现；摆脱；暴露
 - ray, cast off
examples: vi.浮现；(由某种状态)脱出；(事实)显现出来
(1) A wonderful idea emerged in my mind.(2) Many facts emerged as a result of the investigation.
(1) 我的脑海里浮现出一个极妙的想法。(2) 调查结果,许多事实暴露出来。

translation:
n. 紧急情况; 突发事件; 非常时刻
adj. 紧急的，应急的

分布：紧急状态(30%)，突发事件(25%)，紧急的(23%)，应急的(11%)，备用的(11%)


→来自emerge, 出现，始料不及的情况。
突然事件(emerge+ency→[突然]出现的事情)[merg,mers=sink,表示"沉,没"]
紧急事件(emergent紧急的)[-cy表名词,也作-acy,"性质,状态"]
紧急情况(emerge出现...出现的紧急情况)[-ency,-iency表名词,ence的变体]
n.紧急情况,突然事件,非常时刻The energetic enemy submerged in the water on the verge of the emergency.在紧急情况快要发生时精力充沛的敌军沉入水中.



US [-'mɝ:-] noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■something dangerous or serious, such as an accident, which happens suddenly or unexpectedly and needs fast action in order to avoid harmful results 紧急情况；不测事件；突发事件
•How would disabled people escape in an emergency?如果发生紧急情况，伤残人士如何逃离？

•Is the emergency exit suitable for wheelchairs?安全出口适合轮椅通行吗？

•The pilot of the aircraft was forced to make an emergency landing on Lake Geneva.这架飞机的驾驶员不得不在日内瓦湖面上紧急迫降。





emergency, emergence

emergency: 意为“紧急情况”，“突然事件”。
emergence: 是emerge的名词形式。



emergency, crisis, urgency

emergency: “紧急情况”，强调突如其来的事故或情况
crisis: “危机，危急”，着重某一事故或情况关系到生死存亡
urgency: “紧急，急迫（的状态）”，an emergency=a matter of urgency

 - critical situation, bombshell

 - urgent, instant

(1) She has the ability to keep calm in an emergency.(2) We took the emergency in our stride.(3) Ring the bell in an emergency.(4) The rioting grew worse and the government declared a state of emergency.(5) He has made every arrangement to meet any emergency.(6) With these incidents, Tang Ying consulted experts from various vocations for measures in emergency.(7) There are four emergency exits in the department store.
(1) 她有处变不惊的本事。(2) 我们泰然地处理了紧急情况。(3) 情况紧急时请按铃。(4) 骚乱恶化，政府只得宣布进入紧急状态。(5) 他已作好了应急的一切准备。(6) 通过这些案例，唐颖向各行各业的专家请教了很多自我防范和应急的方法。(7) 这家百货公司有四个紧急出口。

→e-, 向外。-miss, 派遣，发送，见mission.
发光;发出(味等)(e出＋mit→送出［气味］等)[Miss,mit=send,cast,表示"送,放出"]
vt.发出;放射;吐露;散发;发表;发行The missionary transmitted emission emitted lately.传教士传播了新近散发出来的散发物.
【记】e出，mit＝miss送－送出－放出（味道等）【参】emission（n 散发；发射）【反】absorb（v 吸收）



[ɪ'mɪt] (-tt-)verb transitive ■to send out a beam, noise, smell or gas 发出，射出，散发（光、杂讯、气味或气体）
•The alarm emits infra-red rays which are used to detect any intruder.警报器能发出红外线探测入侵者。

•The machine emits a high-pitched sound when you press the button.一按这个按钮，机器就会发出尖厉的鸣叫声。

examples: (1) The cheese was emitting a strong smell.(2) A volcano emits smoke and ashes.(3) He was so pale that he seemed to emit a pearly glow.(4) Fireflies emit light but not heat.(5) The radio stations emit energy into the air.(6) A fixed star can emit light and heat by itself.(7) He emits his opinion.
(1) 干酪散发出强烈的气味。(2) 火山散发着烟和灰。(3) 他白得似乎发出像一样珍珠的微光。(4) 萤火虫发光但不放出热。(5) 无线电站把能量发射到空气中。(6) 恒星本身发光发热。(7) 他表达了他的观点。

translation:

US [-'moʊ-] adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■relating to the emotions 情绪（上）的，情感（上）的
•a child's emotional development孩子情感方面的发展

•My doctor said the problem was more emotional than physical.我的医生说问题主要出在情感方面而不是身体机能上。

•Amnesia can be caused by emotional trauma.情感创伤可以使人罹患健忘症。
 ESSENTIAL  ■having and expressing strong feelings 激动的；感情强烈的
•He's a very emotional man.他是个感情易冲动的人。

•I felt quite emotional during the wedding ceremony.在婚礼上我无比激动。

•He became very emotional when I told him I was pregnant.当我告诉他我怀孕了的时候，他非常激动。

•The President has made an emotional (= full of emotion) plea for the killing to stop.总统恳切地呼吁停止屠杀。

translation:
n. 强调; 着重; （轮廓、图形等的）鲜明; 突出，重读

分布：强调(54%)，重点(46%)


n.强调,重点You always put too much emphasis on the last syllable.你老是把最后一个音节读得太重.
【参】emphasize（vt 强调；着重）；emphatic（adj 语势强的；显著的）



['emp.fə.sɪs] (plural emphases)noun countable or uncountable  IMPROVER  ■the particular importance or attention that you give to something 重视；强调
•I think we should put as much emphasis on preventing disease as we do on curing it.我认为我们应该像重视治疗一样重视疾病的预防。

•Schools here put/place/lay great emphasis on written work and grammar.这里的学校特别重视写作和文法。
 IMPROVER  ■the extra force that you give to a word or part of a word when you are saying it 重读；重音
•The emphasis is on the final syllable.重音在最后一个音节上。

•Where do you put the emphasis in the word 'controversy'?这个词的重音在哪个音节上？





stress, emphasis

这组词都有“强调”的意思，其区别是：
stress: 常可与emphasis换用，但侧重指迫不及待地强调或坚持。
emphasis: 指尽力突出的重要性或重点。


n. 重点；强调；加强语气
 - stress, unode
examples: (1) They put emphasis on making to quota this quarter.(2) Our English course places great emphasis on conversational skills.(3) In recent years, the emphasis has moved away from punishing drug addicts towards helping them.(4) You put too much emphasis on the last syllable.
(1) 他们强调要达到这一季的配额。(2) 我们的英语课程非常重视会话技能。(3) 最近几年,重点从惩罚吸毒者转移到救助他们。(4) 你把最后一个音节读得太重。

translation:
vt. 强调，着重; 加强语气; 使突出

时态：emphasized, emphasizing, emphasizes
分布：强调(91%)，着重(8%)，使突出(1%)


→em-, 进入，使。-phas, 显现，词源同phase, photo, phantasm.
v.(emphasise)强调In occasional case the phrase emphasizes the importance of the phase to the laser.在偶然情况下该短句强调了相位对于激光的重要性.



(UK usually emphasise) ['emp.fə.saɪz] verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to show or state that something is very important or worth giving attention to 强调；重视
•[+ question word] I'd just like to emphasize how important it is for people to learn foreign languages.我只是想强调一下学习外语的重要性。

•[+ that] He emphasized that all the people taking part in the research were volunteers.他强调所有参加这项研究的人都是志愿者。

•You can use italics or capitals to emphasize a word in a piece of writing.你可以用斜体或者大写来强调文章中的某个词。
 IMPROVER  ■to make something more obvious 使突出；使明显
•Tight jeans will only emphasize any extra weight that you are carrying.紧身牛仔裤只会使你身上的赘肉更明显。





stress, emphasize, focus, highlight

stress: 重读（某音节）
emphasize: 加强…的语气
focus: 使…集中于一点
highlight: 对…予以特别的注意；将（头发）染成浅色使之有光泽


vt. 强调，着重
 - stress, highlight
examples: (1) He emphasized the importance of careful driving.(2) We cannot emphasize too much the importance of learning English.(3) Which word should I emphasize?(4) I would like to emphasize that we are ready to meet the management at any time.(5) Jane's short hair emphasized her cheekbones.
(1) 他强调小心驾驶的重要性。(2) 我们再怎样强调学英文的重要性也不为过。(3) 我应该重读哪个词?(4) 我想着重指出，我们愿意在任何时候与管理部门会谈。(5) 简的短发使她的颧骨更突出。

→em-, 进入，使。-ploy, 编织，卷入，词源同deploy, imply, implicate.即成为其中的一份子。
雇佣;运用(em进入+ploy→进入用的状态→雇佣)[ploy=use,invlve,表示"用,参与"]
n./v.雇用;用,使用The royal destroyer employs lots of loyal employees.皇家驱逐舰雇佣了很多忠心的雇员.



verb PROVIDE JOB  提供工作   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to have someone work or do a job for you and pay them for it 雇用
•How many people does your company employ?你们公司雇有多少员工？

•Can't we employ someone as an assistant to help with all this paperwork?我们不可以雇一位助理来协助处理这些文书工作吗？

•[+ to infinitive] We've employed a market researcher to find out what people really want from a cable TV system.我们已经雇用了一位市场调查研究员来调查人们到底想透过有线电视系统看到甚么样的节目。

•More people are now employed in service industries than in manufacturing.现在服务业的就业人数多于制造业。

[ɪm'plɔɪ] verb USE  利用  transitive formal ■to use something 使用；利用
•Sophisticated statistical analysis was employed to obtain these results.利用尖端的统计分析技术得到了这些结果。

[ɪm'plɔɪ] verb SPEND TIME  花时间  be employed in doing sth formal ■to spend time doing something 花时间做，从事于
•He was busily employed in lacing up his shoes.他忙着系鞋带。

[ɪm'plɔɪ] noun formal be in sb's employ ■to be working for someone 受雇于（某人）；为（某人）工作




apply, use, avail, utilize, exploit, employ

这组词都有“使用，应用”的意思，其区别是：
apply: 指将一事物运用于另一事物之上以发挥其有效作用。
use: 普通用词，着重为达到某一目的而利用某人或某物。
avail: 通常指使用手边或就近的人或物以有利于自己。
utilize: 侧重有利可图或能达到某一实际目的。书面用词。
exploit: 强调充分利用。
employ: 指使用处于消极状态或未被用过的人或物，可以与use换用，但强调进行选择、充分利用。



engage, employ, hire

这组词都有“雇用”的意思，其区别是：
engage: 可与hire换用，特指雇用专业人员。
employ: 正式用词，侧重受雇者虽为薪金而工作，但工作固定共享有相当尊严。
hire: 普通用词，常指短期或长期雇用某人从事某一特定工作或一次性的工作，含强调为薪金而工作的意味。


vt. 使用，采用；雇用；使忙于，使从事于
 - introduce, make use of, fashion, exercise
n. 使用；雇用
 - usage, utilization, use, hire
examples: (1) They employ casual labor to pick the fruit(2) You must employ someone to oversee the project.(3) Why do you think we should employ you?(4) Different artists employ different painting techniques.(5) We employ different security techniques to protect the database.
(1) 他们雇佣临时工摘水果。(2) 你得雇个人监督这一工程。(3) 你认为我们为何要雇佣你?(4) 不同的画家会使用不同的绘画技巧。(5) 我们使用不同的保护措施来保护数据库。

translation:
n. 雇主，老板; 雇佣者

分布：雇主(100%)


n.雇主An employer should appraise the ability of his employees.雇主应该能够鉴定员工的能力.



US [-ɚ] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a person or organization that employs people 雇用者，雇主
•We need a reference from your former employer.我们需要你前任雇主的推荐信。

UK [ɪm'plɔɪ.ər] US [-ɚ] noun countable   Common Learner Errors   employer or employee?Warning:  Choose the right word!To talk about someone who is paid to work for someone else, don't say 'employer', say employee :✗ We should send all our employers on a training course.



n. [劳经] 雇主，老板
 - boss, guvnor
examples: (1) He sued his employer for wrongful dismissal.(2) The university is a major employer in the area.(3) He was in his employer's good graces.
(1) 他控告雇主非法解雇他。(2) 该大学是这一地区的大雇主。(3) 他深得雇主的赏识。

translation:
n. 雇用; 使用; 职业; 有益的活动

分布：职业(55%)，雇用(28%)，使用(17%)


雇佣,就业(employ+ment)[ploy=use,invlve,表示"用,参与"]
n.雇用;使用;工作,职业He left his home to look for employment.他离家去找职业.



noun uncountable PROVIDE JOB  就业   ESSENTIAL  ■when someone is paid to work for a company or organization 受雇；就业
•Employment levels are unlikely to rise significantly before the end of next year.在明年年底之前就业率很难有大幅度提升。

•How long have you been looking for employment?你找工作已经找了多久时间了？
be in employment  ESSENTIAL  formal ■to have a job 有工作，在职
•Are you in employment at the moment?你现在有工作吗？

[ɪm'plɔɪ.mənt] noun uncountable USE  利用  formal ■use 使用；利用
•How can you justify the employment of capital punishment?你如何证明实行死刑是正当的？





work, vocation, occupation, employment, trade, profession, career, job

这组词都有“职业”的意思，其区别是：
work: 指任何种类的工作，也泛指职业。
vocation: 较正式用词，语气庄重，指长期从事，但不一定以此为主计的职业。
occupation: 泛指任何一种职业，既不分什么行业，也不管是脑力还是体力劳动。
employment: 指受雇于他人，领取工资以谋生计，有较固定工作的职业。
trade: 指需要有熟练技巧、技能和体力的职业。
profession: 以前常指要受过高等教育(尤指法律、医学和神学)才能获得的职业，现在一般指为谋生日的职业，尤指从事脑力劳动和受过专门训练，具有某种专业知识的职业。
career: 指经过专门训练，终身愿意从事的职业。
job: 通常指一切有收入，不分脑力与体力运动，不论是否有技艺的长期或临时的职业。


n. 使用；职业； [劳经] 雇用
 - usage, utilization, profession, career, use, pursuit
examples: (1) I got this job through an employment agency.(2) He enrolled with an employment agency for a secretary.(3) He left his home to look for employment.(4) Dictionary-making has not been his exclusive employment.(5) She is looking for permanent employment.(6) He is out of employment.(7) Mr Martin is no longer in our employ.(8) Employment is conditional on his ability.(9) The employment of airplanes sped up delivery.(10) Do you think the employment of force was justified?
(1) 我通过职业介绍所找到了这份工作。(2) 他在职业介绍所登记要当秘书。(3) 他离家去找职业。(4) 编字典一直都不是他唯一的工作。(5) 她正在找固定的工作。(6) 他失业了。(7) 马丁先生不再为我们所雇用了。(8) 是否雇用他取决于他的能力。(9) 使用飞机加快了投递的速度。(10) 你想想暴力的使用是正当的吗?

translation:
adj. 空的，空虚的，空洞的; 空闲的，无效的，徒劳的; 无聊的，愚蠢的; 言语或行动空洞的
vt. （使）成为空的， 把…弄空; 把…腾出来
vi. 成为空的; 流空
n. 空车; 空的东西

时态：emptied, emptying, empties
分布：空的(55%)，空洞的(12%)，倒空(10%)，空虚的(8%)，排空(6%)，变空(5%)，空腹的(3%)，空物(1%)


→来自古英语emty, 休闲，空闲。e, 没有，词源同out, ordeal(其词源同deal out), -mt, 必须，词源同must. 插入字母p缓和读音。原义为非必须的，有空的，词义由时间引申为空间。
a.空的;空洞的v.倒空,使成为空的The empty empire's emperor made an attempt to tempt the contemptuous man.空虚帝国的皇帝试图诱惑那个轻蔑的人.



adjective NOTHING IN  空无一物   ESSENTIAL  ■not containing any things or people 空的；无人的
•an empty house/street空屋／空无一人的街道

•Shall I take the empty bottles for recycling?我把这些空瓶子拿去回收吧？

•The train was empty (= There were no passengers) by the time it reached London.火车到达伦敦的时候，车内已经没有乘客了。

['emp.ti] adjective NOT SINCERE  不真诚的  [usually before noun] ■not sincere or without any real meaning 无诚意的；空洞的；无意义的
•empty threats/rhetoric虚张声势的威胁／虚夸之词

•They're just empty promises.这些承诺只不过是些空头支票。

['emp.ti] adjective WITHOUT PURPOSE  无目的  ■without purpose or interest 空虚的；无目标的，无意义的；百无聊赖的
•He says his life has been completely empty since his wife died.他说自从妻子去世后他的生活就完全失去了意义。

•I felt empty, like a part of me had died.我百无聊赖，如同行尸走肉一样。

['emp.ti] adjective on an empty stomach ■without eating anything 空着肚子，空腹
•You shouldn't go to work on an empty stomach.你不应该空腹去上班。

['emp.ti] verb transitive ■to remove everything from inside something 倒空，腾空；倾倒
•I emptied the closet and put my belongings into the black overnight case.我把衣橱清空，把我的东西放进那个外出过夜用的黑色旅行袋里。

•Would you mind emptying (out) your pockets?你把口袋掏空好不好？

•Empty the soup into a saucepan and simmer gently for ten minutes.把汤都倒进炖锅中，慢火炖十分钟。

•She quickly emptied her glass (= drank its contents) and ordered another drink.她一饮而尽，然后又叫了一杯。
intransitive ■to become empty 变空
•The place emptied pretty quickly when the fight started.战斗爆发后，这个地方很快就没人了。

['emp.ti] verb   Phrasal Verbs   empty into sth ■If a river empties into a larger area of water, the water from it flows into that larger area （河流）流入，注入
•The River Tees empties into the North Sea.蒂斯河注入北海。

['emp.ti] noun countable usually plural ■an empty drinks bottle 空瓶子
•Don't forget to take the empties to the bottle bank.不要忘了把空瓶子拿到玻璃瓶回收箱那里扔掉。





open, blank, vacant, hollow, empty

这组词都有“空的”的意思，其区别是：
open: 指未被占有，从而可被别人得到的。
blank: 指上面没有写字、印刷或做记号的空白表面，或指上面留着准备被填写的空白处。
vacant: 普通用词，侧重某物或某个位置没有被占用。
hollow: 指物体中间是空的。
empty: 指空无一人或一物，或空洞无意义的。



free, vacant, empty

free: 空的，指清除了或缺少了某物，与of 或from连用。如：She is free from anxiety.(她无忧无虑。)She is free of him.(她摆脱了他。)
vacant: 空闲的，指地方没有被占用。如：One day, man can make full use of vacant space.(将来，人们会充分利用浩瀚的天空。)empty，vacant和相同的名词连用时，含义不同。如an empty house指房子里既无家具也无人，空荡荡的。而a vacant house指房子没有被人占用，里面可有家具，也可无家具。
empty: 空的，指里面什么东西都没有。如：The case is empty.(这是个空箱子。)


adj. 空的；无意义的；无知的；徒劳的
 - dark, hollow, bare, vacant
vt. 使失去；使…成为空的
 - dispossess
examples: adj.空的；空洞的；空虚的；空腹的v.倒空；变空；排空n.空物

(1) His room is empty.(2) His wordy and empty speech was a frost.(3) He didn't want to retire and lead an empty life.(4) This medicine must be taken on an empty stomach.(5) They emptied the biscuits onto the plate.(6) He tilted the barrel so as to empty it.(7) Getting gorgeous doesn't mean you have to empty out your wallet.(8) I had to empty out the drawer to find the papers.(9) Did you empty the washing machine?(10) The police asked everybody to empty the building.(11) You don't mind if i ask you to empty your pockets.(12) Would you empty the ashtray, please?(13) Empties are not taken back.

(1) 他的房间是空的。(2) 他的冗长空洞的讲话使人厌烦。(3) 他不想退休过空虚的生活。(4) 这种药必须空腹服用。(5) 他们把饼干倒在盘子里。(6) 他将大桶倾侧倒空。(7) 想让自己光彩照人并不意味着要掏空腰包。(8) 我不得不倒出抽屉的东西以找出那些文件。(9) 你把洗衣机的衣服都拿出来了吗?(10) 警察疏散了楼里的人群。(11) 你不介意我搜一下你的口袋吧?(12) 请你把烟灰缸清理一下好吗?(13) 不退瓶子。

translation:
vt. （用墙、篱笆等）把…围起来; 把…装入信封; 附入

时态：enclosed, enclosing, encloses
分布：附上(79%)，围住(12%)，圈起(8%)，封入(1%)


→en-, 进入，使。close, 关住。
包围,围绕(en进入+close→被关起来→包围)[clos,clud,clus=close,表示"关闭"]
v.围住,圈起,封入The loser closely enclosed himself in the closet.那个失败者把自己严密地封闭在小室内.
【记】close（v 包围；关闭）



US [-'kloʊz] verb transitive SURROUND  包围   ADVANCED  ■to surround 把…围起来；围住，包住
•The park that encloses the monument has recently been enlarged.环绕着纪念碑的那个公园最近扩建了。

UK [ɪn'kləʊz] US [-'kloʊz] verb transitive SEND  寄送  ■to send something in the same envelope or parcel as something else 随信（或包裹）附上；附入，封入
•Please enclose a curriculum vitae with your letter of application.请在求职信中附上一份简历。





enclose, fence, encircle, surround, envelop

这组词都有“包围”的意思，其区别是：
enclose: 指把某物四周围住或封闭起来，使之与外界隔绝。
fence: 通常指用栅栏栏开或围起来。
encircle: 侧重在某事物周围围成圈状。
surround: 普通用词，既可指环绕、围绕，也可指军事上的包围。
envelop: 着重指把某个物体完全包起来或整个封起来。


vt. 围绕；装入；放入封套
 - enring, inclose
examples: (1) He enclosed the land with a hedge.(2) Farmers often enclose their land with hedges.(3) With respect to your enquiry, I enclose an explanatory leaflet.(4) We enclose a list showing our present availability.(5) We enclose the receipt for the draft, and be good enough to overlook our request for a remittance.
(1) 他用篱笆把地圈起来。(2) 农夫们常用树篱将他们的地围起来。(3) 关于你的询问,兹附上有关说明资料。(4) 兹附上我方现时可以供应的货单一张。(5) 同函奉上汇款收据一张，恳请原谅我方索汇通知。

translation:
vt. 不期而遇; 遭遇; 对抗
n. 相遇，碰见; 遭遇战; 对决，冲突
vi. 碰见，尤指不期而遇

时态：encountered, encountering, encounters
分布：遇到(61%)，遭遇(32%)，邂逅(6%)，偶然碰到(1%)


→en-, 进入，使。前缀countra-, 相对。即进入相对状态的，面对面遭遇的。
n./v.遇到,遭遇The county councilor encountered the accountant at the counter of a countryside shop.县委委员在一乡村商店的柜台边碰到了会计师.
【反】circumlocution（n 婉转曲折的陈述）



US [-tˌɚ] noun countable ■a meeting, especially one that happens by chance 偶然相遇，邂逅，不期而遇
•I had a rather alarming encounter with a wild pig.我曾经意外地碰到过一头野猪，真是惊险。

•This meeting will be the first encounter between the party leaders since the election.这是自大选以来两党领导人首次狭路相逢。
■an occasion when people have sex, usually with someone they have not met before 性经历（对象通常为陌生人）■an occasion when two teams play against each other （体育）比赛，交锋
•In their last encounter with Italy, England won 3-2.在上次和义大利队的对垒中，英格兰队三比二获胜。

UK [ɪn'kaʊn.tər] US [-tˌɚ] verb transitive MEET  遇到   ADVANCED  formal ■to meet someone unexpectedly 邂逅，不期而遇，偶然碰到
•On their way home they encountered a woman selling flowers.在回家的路上他们碰到一位卖花的女子。

UK [ɪn'kaʊn.tər] US [-tˌɚ] verb transitive EXPERIENCE  经历  ■to experience, especially something unpleasant 遭遇，遇到（尤指不愉快的事情）
•When did you first encounter these difficulties?你甚么时候开始遇到这些困难的？

•The army is reported to be encountering considerable resistance.据报道，部队正遭遇到顽强的抵抗。





face, encounter, meet, contact, confront

这组词都有“遇见，会见，碰见”的意思，其区别是：
face: 侧重双方静止地面对面，或指指充满勇气、信心和决心正视人或事。
encounter: 通常指遇到困难或挫折，也指偶然或意外地相遇。
meet: 普通用词，本义指双方或多方从不同方向或相反方向作向对运动，最终相碰(遇)。
contact: 多指通过书信、电话或直接会面和别人联系。口语用词。
confront: 不可避免的，面对面的相遇。也指敢于正视困难或问题的决心和信心。



withstand, undergo, experience, encounter

withstand: 经受，忍受
undergo: 经历（考验、苦难）
experience: 亲身体验
encounter: 遭遇，遇到遭遇或碰上棘手的事


vt. 遭遇，邂逅；遇到
 - confront, bring up against
n. 遭遇，偶然碰见
 - fell in with, lit on
vi. 遭遇；偶然相遇
 - bring up against, run into
examples: n.意外的相见；邂逅；遭遇v.遭遇；遇到；偶然碰到

(1) If both participate, it may be an actual encounter of bodiless consciousness.(2) A fortunate encounter brought us together.(3) It was a bloody encounter between the two armies.(4) Don't be afraid to encounter risks.(5) Otherwise, we will encounter grave difficulties.(6) I encountered an old friend at Rome.
(1) 如果是双向的，这会是一个真实的与灵魂的相见。(2) 一次幸运的邂逅使我们相识。(3) 这是那两军之间的一次激烈的遭遇战。(4) 不要害怕遭遇危险。(5) 否则便将遇到极大的困难。(6) 我在罗马邂逅了一个老朋友。

translation:
vt. 鼓励，鼓舞; 支持; 促进; 鼓动

时态：encouraged, encouraging, encourages
分布：鼓励(90%)，促进(6%)，支持(4%)


→en-, 进入，使。courage, 鼓励。
鼓励(en+courage勇气→使人进入勇气→鼓励)[em-,en-①表示"进入…之中,包围"②表示"使…进入状态"]
v.鼓励,怂恿Of course the man's courage encouraged the discouraged tourists in the courtyard.自然那个勇敢男子的勇气鼓舞了院子里泄气的游客们.
【记】courage（n 勇气）【反】scotch（v 镇压）



US [-'kɝ:-] verb transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to make someone more likely to do something, or to make something more likely to happen 刺激，激励；促进；助长
•transitive + to infinitive We were encouraged to learn foreign languages at school.在校时，学校鼓励我们学习外语。

•The council is encouraging the development of the property for both employment and recreation.市政委员会鼓励开发该项房地产的目的在于促进就业和增加娱乐设施。
 ESSENTIAL  ■to talk or behave in a way that gives someone confidence to do something （透过言语或行动）鼓励，支援
•They've always encouraged me in everything I've wanted to do.不论我想做甚么，他们总是会鼓励我。





motivate, encourage, excite, stimulate, inspire

这组词都有“鼓励、刺激”的意思，其区别是：
motivate: v.激发，促动，强调激起动机去做某事。
 • A desire to go to medical school motivates her to study hard everyday.   她希望上医学院，这成了她每天努力学习的动力。
encourage: v.鼓励，促进，含有"使增强勇气或给予希望"的意味。
 • He encouraged his son to go to good college.   他鼓励他的儿子上名牌大学。
excite: v.指使人感到激动、兴奋；煽动，鼓动。
 • The band played louder and excited the audience.   乐队演奏得更响亮了，使观众兴奋起来。
stimulate: v.刺激，激发，促进，强调刺激反应的结果。
 • Cold air stimulates me.   冷空气刺激我振作起来
inspire: v.鼓舞，激发，影响，常常带有"启迪，启发"的意思。
 • My mother inspires us with stories of her difficult childhood.   我的妈妈给我们讲童年时的艰苦生活以激励我们。


vt. 鼓励，怂恿；激励；支持
 - heart, stimulate, power, hand, second
examples: (1) Her success encouraged me to try the same thing.(2) Her parents encouraged her in her studies.(3) He aims to encourage mutual understanding.(4) Broadband support flat salary structure, to encourage their staff to study hard.(5) In some places, the local government underlets land to encourage private education.
(1) 她的成功鼓励我尝试做同样的事。(2) 她的父母鼓励她好好学习。(3) 他的目的在于增进相互了解。(4) 宽带薪酬支持扁平型结构，鼓励员工努力学习。(5) 在有些地方，政府廉价出租土地支持民办教育。

translation:
n. <正>结果; 端; 终止; 最后部分
vt. & vi. 结束，终止

时态：ended, ending, ends
分布：结束(81%)，末端(6%)，部分(5%)，目标(4%)，死亡(2%)，半边球场(1%)，端点(1%)


→来自ant, 相反，相对，词源同前缀anti-. 即终端，分开点。
n.末端,端,梢;目标,目的v.终止,结束With a knife the knitter ends his wife's life in the lifeboat.在救生艇上编织者用小刀结束了他妻子的性命.



noun LAST POINT  终点   ESSENTIAL  countable ■the point in space or time after which something no longer exists, or a part of something that includes this point 末端，尽头；最后部分，末尾
•This cable should have a plug at one end and a socket at the other.这根电缆应该一端有插头，另一端有插座。

•We damaged the  end  of the piano when we moved it.我们搬钢琴时把钢琴末端部分撞坏了。

•Get to the  end  of the queue and wait your turn like everyone else.到队伍后面去排队，像别人一样按照顺序等着。

•Our house is the third from the end on the left.我们家是从左边倒数第三户。

•Is it safe to stand the computer on (its) end?电脑倒着放安全吗？

•The end of the film was much more exciting than I'd expected.电影结尾比我预想的刺激多了。

•This latest injury must surely mean that her tennis career is now at an end (= finished).毫无疑问，最近这次受伤意味着她的网球运动生涯已到了尽头。

•The statement said there would be no end to the violence until the terrorists' demands were met.声明指称，如果恐怖分子的要求得不到满足，暴力就不会结束。
only singular polite word for ■death 辞世，过世，亡故
•We were all by her bedside when the end finally came.她临终时，我们都守在她的床边。

•He met  his  end (= died) in a shoot-out with the police.他在与警方的枪战中丧命
countable ■either of the two halves of a sports field 半边球场
•The teams change ends at half-time so that neither side has an unfair advantage.两队在上半场结束时交换场地，这样对任何一方都公平。
countable US ■one of the two players in American football who begin play furthest from the ball （橄榄球队的）边锋in the end  IMPROVER  ■finally, after something has been thought about or discussed a lot 最后，终于
•We were thinking about going to Switzerland, but in the end we went to Austria.我们一直打算要去瑞士，可是最后却去了奥地利。
for hours/days, etc. on end ■for hours, days, etc. without stopping 连续数小时／几天等
•He used to lock himself in his bedroom for hours on end and refuse to talk to anyone.他过去常把自己锁在卧室里一呆就是几个小时，不跟任何人说话。
come to an end  IMPROVER  ■to finish 完结，结束
•Everyone wishes the war would come to an end soon.每个人都希望战争尽快结束。

[end] noun SMALL PART  小的部分  countable ■a small unwanted part of something that is left after most of it has been used 剩余物；残余
•The floor was covered in cigarette ends.地板上都是烟蒂。

[end] noun AIM  目的  countable ■an aim, intention or purpose 目的；目标
•Do you have a particular end in mind?你心中有没有一个明确的目标？
to this end ■with this aim 为了这个目的；为此
•He wanted science students to take an interest in the arts, and to this end he ran literature classes at his home on Sunday afternoons.他想让理科学生也对文科产生兴趣，为此他星期天下午在自己家中开文学课。

[end] noun TYPE OF ACTIVITY  活动种类  only singular informal ■the parts of a task or process connected with one particular type of activity or person （和某类活动或人相关的）部分，方面
•Rick's more involved with the financial end of things.瑞克参与更多的是财务方面的事务。
 sb's end of the bargain/deal, etc. ■the area of activity for which someone is responsible （某人）分内的事情；（某人的）职责范围：
•We've kept our end of the deal - let's see if they keep theirs.我们把我们自己分内的事情做好了——看看他们能不能管好自己的事。

[end] noun at the end of the day UK ■something that you say before you give the most important fact of a situation 最终；到头来；不管怎么说
•Of course I'll listen to what she has to say but at the end of the day, it's my decision.当然她要说甚么我也会听，但最终还是我来作决定。

[end] noun The end justifies the means. saying ■said about a situation in which the final aim is so important that any way of achieving it is acceptable 为达目的，不择手段。
[end] noun end of slang ■something you say to tell someone that you have made a definite decision and you do not want to talk about it any more 已成定局；没有商量的余地
•You're not going out tonight - end of!你今晚不准出去，这事没有商量的余地！

[end] noun end of story informal ■something you say when you think that the opinion you have just expressed about something is correct and that there is no other way of thinking about it 情况就是这样；就这么办
•This woman is innocent - end of story.这个妇女是无辜的——情况就是如此。

[end] noun the end of the line/road ■the point where it is no longer possible to continue with a process or activity （过程或活动的）尽头；穷途末路
•We've struggled on for as long as we could, but now we're at the end of the line.我们一直在尽己所能勉力维持，但是现在我们是山穷水尽了。

•When the bank refused to lend us any more money we realised we'd reached the end of the road.当银行拒绝再给我们贷款的时候，我们意识到我们已经走投无路了。

[end] noun get/have your end away UK informal ■If a man gets his end away, he has sex 性交
•Did you get your end away last night, then?那你们昨晚上了床吗？

[end] noun keep/hold your end up UK ■to continue to deal with difficulties bravely and successfully 坚持；不泄气
[end] noun make ends meet ■to have just enough money to pay for the things that you need 使收支刚好能相抵
[end] noun no end ■very much 非常
•It would please Granny no end if you wrote to her occasionally.如果你能不时给奶奶写封信，她会非常高兴的。

[end] noun no end of sth ■a lot of 大量；许多
•If you don't want the job, there's no end of people willing to take your place.如果你不想做这份工作了，不知会有多少人巴不得要顶替你的位置呢。

[end] noun not be the end of the world informal ■If something is not the end of the world, it will not cause very serious problems 天还不会塌下来，还没到世界末日
•I'm really hoping to win, but it won't be the end of the world if I don't.我很希望能赢，但即使输了也没有甚么大不了的。

[end] noun put an end to sth  ADVANCED  ■to make something stop happening or existing 使终止；毁掉；消灭
•How can we put an end to the fighting?我们怎样才能制止这场打斗呢？

[end] verb intransitive or transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to finish or stop, or to make something finish or stop 使）结束；（使）停止
•When is your meeting due to end?你的会议预计甚么时候结束？

•Her resignation ends months of speculation about her future.她的辞职为数月来人们对她未来的种种揣测画上了句号。

•Their marriage ended in 1991.他们的婚姻在1991年走到了尽头。

•The match ended in a draw.比赛以平手告终。

•I'd like to end with a song from my first album.我想以我第一张专辑里的一首歌来结束演出。

•She ended her speech on an optimistic note.她以乐观的口吻结束了演讲。

[end] verb intransitive or transitive end it all usually humorous ■to kill yourself 自杀；一了百了
•And if this doesn't work, I'm just going to end it all.要是这个行不通，我就不活了。

[end] verb intransitive or transitive It'll (all) end in tears. ■something that you say which means something will end badly and the people involved will be upset 悲剧告终，不会有好结局
•She only met him in May and they were married by July. It'll end in tears, you'll see.她五月才认识他，然后他们七月就结婚了。这不会有好结果的，你等着瞧吧。

[end] verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   end up  IMPROVER  ■to finally be in a particular place or situation 最后（处于）；最后（成为）；（以…）告终
•They're travelling across Europe by train and are planning to end up in Moscow.他们正搭火车穿越欧洲旅行，最后一站计划是莫斯科。

•Much of this meat will probably end up as dog food.这块肉最后可能大部分得喂狗。

•[L] She'll end up penniless if she carries on spending like that.如果她继续这样挥霍，最后会落得身无分文的下场。

•[+ -ing verb] After working her way around the world, she ended up teaching English as a foreign language.靠打工游遍世界后，她最后做了教师，教外国人学英语。





conclude, finish, accomplish, terminate, complete, end, close

这组词都有“结束，完成”的意思，其区别是：
conclude: 正式用词，多指以某事或活动达到预期目的而告终。
finish: 与complete基本同义，着重圆满地结束或完成已着手的事。
accomplish: 正式用词，强调一个过程的完成；也可指依靠努力达到一定目的，或取得一定的结果。
terminate: 强调有一个空间和时间的限度，届时必须终止。书面语用词。
complete: 侧重指完成预定的任务或使某事完善，补足缺少的部分等。
end: 最普通用词，着重事情的完成。也指某种活动因达到目的而自然结束或由于某种原因而突然中止。
close: 普通用词，着重行为的终止或结束，不强调其目的。



aim, goal, purpose, end, target, object, objective

这些名词均有“目标、目的”之意。
aim: 从本义“靶子”引申而来，侧重比较具体而明确的目标，但常指短期目标。
goal: 指经过考虑和选择，需经坚持不懈的努力奋斗才能达到的最终目标。
purpose: 普通用词，既指以坚决、审慎的行动去达到的目的，又指心中渴望要实际的目标。
end: 指心目中怀着的某种目的，强调结果而非过程。较正式用词。
target: 指射击的靶，军事攻击目标。引申指被攻击、批评或潮笑的目标。
object: 强调个人或需求而决定的目标、目的。
objective: 与object基本同义，但语义更广泛，指具体或很快能达到的目的，也可指军事目标。书面用词。


n. 结束；目标；尽头；末端；死亡
 - completion, death, target, goal, object
vi. 结束，终止；终结
 - drop, determine, pass
vt. 结束，终止；终结
 - conclude, bring to a close
examples: n.结束；末端；目标；死亡；部分；终点站；端点；半边球场；剩余物，残余；过世v.终止，结束

(1) The battle finally brought the war to an end.(2) At the end of the film, the hero wept bitterly.(3) He makes a knot in the end of the string.(4) He could have achieved his ends by peaceful means.(5) He came to an untimely end by accident.(6) We need someone to handle the marketing end of the business.(7) Jean is going to meet me at the other end.(8) The teams changed ends at half-time.(9) He threw his cigarette end on the floor.(10) He came to an untimely end.(11) He met his end at the Battle of Waterloo.(12) The debate ended in uproar.(13) They ended the party off with a song.

(1) 这一仗使这场战争终告结束。(2) 在影片的结尾，主人公伤心地哭了。(3) 他在绳子末端打了个结。(4) 他要是采用和平手段的话就会完成他的目标。(5) 他遭不测而过早死亡。(6) 我们需要有人管理本公司的销售部。(7) 琼打算在那边终点站接我。(8) 上半场结束时双方交换了场地。(9) 他把烟头丢在地上。(10) 他英年早逝。(11) 他在滑铁卢战役中阵亡。(12) 那场争辩以大吵大闹收场。(13) 他们唱支歌结束了晚会。

translation:
n. 结局; 结束; 终结; 最后部份
v. 结束，终止(end的现在分词)

分布：结局(69%)，结尾(31%)


n.结尾,结局The writer arranges a happy ending.作者安排了一个大团圆的结局.



noun countable STORY  故事   IMPROVER  ■the last part of a story （故事的）结尾，结局
•People want love stories with happy endings.人们希望爱情故事的结局是有情人终成眷属。

['en.dɪŋ] noun countable WORD  词语   IMPROVER  ■a part added to the end of a word （单词）词尾
•To make the plural of 'dog', you add the plural ending '-s'.要把 dog 这个词变成复数形式，需在其后加表示复数的词尾 s。




n. 结局；结尾
 - conclusion, outcome
examples: (1) The story is flawed by a weak ending.(2) Write your own ending dear reader.(3) The writer contrived a happy ending.(4) She got revved up by the tragic ending of the film.
(1) 这个故事因结尾写得马虎而显得逊色了。(2) 亲爱的读者，您自己来作一个结尾吧。(3) 作者安排了一个大团圆的结局。(4) 她为这部电影的悲惨结局激动不已。

translation:
adj. 无尽的，无边的; 没完没了的; 永久的; 环形的，无端的

分布：没完没了的(55%)，无止境的(45%)


adjective  ADVANCED  ■never finishing, or seeming never to finish 无休止的；无穷尽的
•We used to have endless arguments about politics.我们过去老是对政治问题争论不休。

•He seems to think that I have an endless supply of money.他好像觉得我的钱永远花不完似的。

•The possibilities are endless.有无数种可能。





permanent, eternal, perpetual, everlasting, endless

这些形容词均有“持久的，永久的”之意。
permanent: 指总是处于相同的情况和地位，可长期持续下去，永久不变。
eternal: 语体较庄重，侧重指永远存在，无始无终。
perpetual: 语气最强，指保持永久不变，没有中断的行为，永无止境地持续下去。有时用于贬义，指令人厌烦之事。
everlasting: 语气较庄重，有时可与eternal换用，侧重持续不尽，或指开始后一直进行下去。
endless: 系日常用词，指无尽无休。


adj. 无止境的；连续的；环状的；漫无目的的
 - continuing, straight, running, serial, successive
examples: (1) Endless desires eventually led him astray.(2) I can't endure your endless complaints anymore.(3) I am too busy to listen to her endless grievance.(4) We feel boring about his endless querimony.
(1) 无止境的欲望最终将他引入了歧途。(2) 我再也不能忍受你无止境的抱怨了。(3) 我太忙了，没空听她那没完没了的牢骚。(4) 我们对他没完没了的埋怨感到厌烦。

translation:
vt. 忍耐; 容忍
vi. 持续，持久; 忍耐

时态：endured, enduring, endures
分布：忍耐(43%)，容忍(23%)，持久(18%)，持续(16%)


→en-, 进入，使。-dur, 硬，坚持，词源同during, true, tree.
持久,耐久(en进入+dure_进入持久→耐久)[dur=last,hard,表示"持久,坚硬"]
v.忍受,持久,持续My durable endurance made me endure the injury during insurance.我持久的忍耐力使我忍受了保险期间的伤害.
【记】dur持久，坚硬【参】endurance（n 忍耐力）



US [-'dʊr] verb EXPERIENCE  经历   ADVANCED  transitive ■to suffer something difficult, unpleasant or painful 忍耐；忍受
•We had to endure a nine-hour delay at the airport.航班延误，我们不得不在机场苦等了九个小时。

•She's already had to endure three painful operations on her leg.她已经承受了三次腿部手术的巨大痛苦。

UK [ɪn'djʊər] US [-'dʊr] verb CONTINUE  持续  intransitive formal ■to continue to exist for a long time 持续；持久
•The political system established in 1400 endured until about 1650.建立于1400年的政治体系一直沿用到1650年前后。





withstand, tolerate, stand, endure, suffer, abide

这组词都有“忍受”的意思，其区别是：
withstand: 指因具有一定实力、权力或能力而能忍受某种情况。
tolerate: 指以自我克制的态度，对待令人反感或厌恶的东西，含默认宽容意味。
stand: 口语用词，常可与hear换用，但前者侧重指经受得起，后者强调容忍，是普通用语。
endure: 书面用词，指长时间忍受痛苦和不幸，着重体力或意志力的坚强不屈服。
suffer: 通常指非自愿或被迫忍受各种痛苦、困难或不快，强调受到苦难。
abide: 指忍受长期的痛苦或折磨，强调耐心和屈从。多用于否定句和疑问句中。



withstand, bear, tolerate, stand, endure

这些词都表忍受，忍耐。
withstand: 经受，承受，指顶住外来的压力和攻势。如：They have withstood all test.(他们经受了一切考验。)
bear: 忍受，容忍，指忍受使人悲痛、烦恼或痛苦的事情。如：It is hard to bear to be laughed at.(被人取笑是难以忍受的。)
tolerate: 容忍，容许，指自我克制的态度，对于令人反感的事没有任何抗议。如：I can’t tolerate him if he goes on like that. (他如果继续这样下去的话，我决不会容忍他。)
stand: 忍受，与bear同义，但较口语化。如：She can’t stand having nothing to do.(没事干，她受不了。)
endure: 忍耐，书面语，指长时间经受痛苦而不屈服。如：It takes patience to endure hardships. 忍受苦难需要耐力。)



last, continue, endure, persist

这组词都有“持续”的意思，其区别是：
last: 着重存在的时间相当长，超过正常的或所期望的时间。
continue: 多指过程，强调持续而无终止，常含不间断之意。
endure: 与last同义，但还指经受住，有能耐忍受而并不受损。
persist: 强调超过了指定的或正常的时间。


vt. 忍耐；容忍
 - resist, tough, abide
vi. 忍耐；持续
 - resist, abide
examples: (1) I could not endure the insolence of his behaviour.(2) I cannot endure listening to that any longer.(3) If help doesn't come,we must endure to the end.(4) They vowed their love would endure forever.(5) These traditions have endured throughout the ages.
(1) 我不能再忍受他那傲慢无礼的行为了。(2) 我再也不耐烦听那一套了。(3) 如果没人来帮助,我们必须忍耐到底。(4) 他们海誓山盟地久天长。(5) 这些传统世代相传至今.

translation:
n. 仇敌; 敌军; 危害物
adj. 敌人的; 敌方的; 与敌对力量相关的

分布：敌人(78%)，敌军(21%)，有害物(1%)


→来自拉丁文inimicus, 敌人，词源同enmity, inimical。in-, 不，非，-im, 爱，见amour, amiable.
n.敌人,仇敌,反对者;敌人,敌军,敌国The energetic enemy submerged in the water on the verge of the emergency.在紧急情况快要发生时精力充沛的敌军沉入水中.



noun  ESSENTIAL  countable ■a person who hates or opposes another person and tries to harm them or stop them from doing something 敌人；仇敌；反对者
•He's made a few enemies in this company.他在公司中和几个人结了怨。

•Max stole Lee's girlfriend and they've been enemies ever since.马克斯抢走了李的女朋友，从那以后他们就成了死对头。

•political enemies政敌
 ESSENTIAL  countable usually singular ■a country, or the armed forces of a country which is at war with another country 敌国；敌军；敌兵
•The enemy had succeeded in stopping our supplies from getting through.敌人成功切断了我军的补给线。

•an attack by enemy aircraft敌机的空袭

•enemy forces/territory敌军／敌区
the enemy of sth literary ■something that harms something else 危害物；大敌
•Familiarity is the enemy of desire.习以为常，则无所欲求。





opponent, competitor, enemy, foe, rival

这些名词均有“对手，敌手”之意。
opponent: 最常用词，通常指在争论、辩论、竞选或竞赛以及其它各种矛盾冲突中站在对立面的“对手”或“敌手”。
competitor: 指为同一目标或目的竞争者，一般无感情色彩。
enemy: 多指充满敌意的仇敌。
foe: 语气较强，多用于书面文字和诗歌中。指不仅敌对，而且很危险，怀有很深的敌意。
rival: 指与某人目标一致而想赶上或超过他的人，匹敌者。


n. 敌人，仇敌；敌军
 - foe, hostes
adj. 敌人的，敌方的
 - hostile
examples: (1) The city is held by the enemy.(2) The enemy was forced to retreat.(3) This defeat was a powerful blow to the enemy.(4) In a frenzy of hate he killed his enemy.(5) The shield protected him from the blows of his enemy.(6) After several reverses the enemy was forced to retreat.(7) The enemy kept up their bombardment day and night.
(1) 这座城市已被敌人占领。(2) 敌人被迫撤退。(3) 这次失败是对敌人的有力的打击。(4) 在一阵痛恨的狂乱中，他杀死了敌人。(5) 这盾牌保护他免受敌人的打击。(6) 几经失败之后，敌军被迫后撤。(7) 敌军一直日夜不停地狂轰滥炸。

translation:
vt. 强迫服从; 实施，执行; 加强

时态：enforced, enforcing, enforces
分布：执行(39%)，实施(24%)，强制(21%)，加强(12%)，强迫(4%)


→en-, 进入，使。force, 力量。
强行;实行(en进入+force→进入力量→强行)[fore,fort=storng,表示"强大,力量"]
v.实施,执行;强制;支持,坚持(要求,主张等)The enforced law reinforced that forced divorce is forbidden.实施的法律强化了禁止强迫离婚.
【记】force（n 力量；vt 强制）



US [-'fɔ:rs] verb transitive  ADVANCED  ■to make people obey a law, or to make a particular situation happen or be accepted 使服从（法律）；（强制）实行，执行，把…强加于
•It isn't always easy for the police to enforce speed limits.对员警来说，严格执行限速规定并不总是件易事。

•The new teacher had failed to enforce any sort of discipline.这位新教师一点都管不住学生，搞得纪律涣散。




vt. 实施，执行；强迫，强制
 - perform, actualize
examples: vt.强迫；强制；实施；执行；加强

(1) You can't enforce cooperation between the players.(2) Don't enforce your will on the child, please.(3) Contracts are promises that the law will enforce.(4) It may be possible to enforce part of a contract.(5) The school will strictly enforce the dress code.(6) Policemen and judges enforce the law.(7) Have you any statistics that would enforce your argument?
(1) 队员间的配合并非强迫命令而成。(2) 请别把你的意愿强加给这孩子。(3) 合同是可强制执行的一项或一组诺言。(4) 合同可以部分被强制执行。(5) 该学校将严格实施着装规定。(6) 警察与法官执行法律。(7) 你有任何统计资料可以加强你的论点吗？

translation:
vt. 吸引住; 聘用; 与…交战
vi. 与…建立密切关系; 衔接; 从事; 紧密结合

时态：engaged, engaging, engages
分布：从事(59%)，参加(15%)，啮合(11%)，答应(5%)，订婚(5%)，预定(2%)，雇佣(2%)，与……交战(1%)


→en-, 进入，使。-gage, 承诺，加入，词源同wage, wedding. 词义由承诺向多方面扩展。
v.(in)从事,着手;约定;使订婚;保证;雇用Tom is engaged to Anne.汤姆已与安妮订婚.



verb EMPLOY  雇用   ADVANCED  transitive mainly UK formal ■to employ someone 雇用；聘用
•[+ to infinitive] I have engaged a secretary to deal with all my paperwork.我雇用了一名秘书来处理我全部的文书工作。

•We're engaging the services of a professional administrator.我们将聘用专业管理人员为我们服务。

[ɪn'geɪdʒ] verb INTEREST  兴趣   ADVANCED  transitive formal ■to interest someone in something and keep them thinking about it 吸引住，使感兴趣
•The debate about food safety has engaged the whole nation.关于食品安全的争论引起了全国关注。

•If a book doesn't engage my interest in the first few pages, I don't usually carry on reading it.如果一本书的前几页不能引起我的兴趣，通常我就不再往下读了。

[ɪn'geɪdʒ] verb FIT TOGETHER  接合  intransitive or transitive ■to make one part of a machine fit into and move together with another part of a machine （使）（机器）啮合，接合，衔接
•When the large cog wheel engages (with the smaller one), the mill stone will start to go round.当大齿轮（与小齿轮）啮合时，石磨就开始转动。

[ɪn'geɪdʒ] verb BEGIN FIGHTING  开始战斗  intransitive or transitive specialized ■to attack or begin to fight someone 进攻；（与…）交战，（与…）开战
•Enemy planes engaged the troops as they advanced into the mountains.部队进山的时候，敌机开始对他们发起攻击。

[ɪn'geɪdʒ] verb ARRANGE  安排  transitive mainly UK old-fashioned ■to arrange for something such as a theatre seat or a hotel room to be kept free 预订（剧院座位或酒店房间等）
[ɪn'geɪdʒ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   engage in sth formal  ADVANCED  ■to take part in something 参加；参与
•The two governments have agreed to engage in a comprehensive dialogue to resolve the problem.两国政府已经同意开展全面对话以解决该问题。
engage sb in conversation formal ■to start a conversation with someone 与某人攀谈
•Once Mrs Kirkpatrick engages you in conversation, you're stuck with her for half an hour.一旦柯克派翠克夫人跟你聊起来，不说上半个小时她是不会放过你的。





engage, employ, hire

这组词都有“雇用”的意思，其区别是：
engage: 可与hire换用，特指雇用专业人员。
employ: 正式用词，侧重受雇者虽为薪金而工作，但工作固定共享有相当尊严。
hire: 普通用词，常指短期或长期雇用某人从事某一特定工作或一次性的工作，含强调为薪金而工作的意味。


vt. 吸引，占用；使参加；雇佣；使订婚；预定
 - attract, absorb, draw, appropriate, budget
vi. 从事；答应，保证；交战；啮合
 - comply, wage
examples: v.雇佣；啮合；与……交战；答应；订婚；预定；参加；从事

(1) The restaurant decide to engage a pop singer.(2) If the big gear did not engage with the small one,the machine would refuse to work.(3) Our orders are to engage (the enemy) immediately.(4) I will engage to manage the business if you will engage to provide the capital.(5) I have engaged a room at this hotel.(6) I have no time to engage in the debate.(7) Is it wise to engage in active sports at your age?(8) They engage in the study of music.(9) Those who engage in mental work are also workers.
(1) 餐馆决定雇用一名流行歌手。(2) 如果大齿轮与小齿轮不相啮合的话，机器就不会工作。(3) 我们的命令是立即(与敌军)开战。(4) 如果你答应出资本，我答应经管这个生意。(5) 我已经在这个旅馆里预订了一个房间。(6) 我没时间参加辩论。(7) 我这样的年纪积极参加体育活动是否明智？(8) 他们从事音乐研究。(9) 从事脑力劳动的人也是劳动者。

translation:
n. 发动机，引擎; 工具; 火车头; 机车
vt. 给…安装发动机

分布：发动机(50%)，引擎(42%)，机车(4%)，火车头(3%)，给 ... 装引擎(1%)


→来自拉丁语ingenium, 来自词根gen，生育，词源同gene, generate.原指内生的天赋，技术，后用来指机械装置。
n.发动机,引擎;火车头The engineer examined the engine of the mining machine for stomach.工程师检查采矿机的发动机是否有肚子痛.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a machine that uses the energy from liquid fuel or steam to produce movement 引擎；发动机
•a jet engine喷射式引擎

•a car engine汽车引擎

•My car's been having engine trouble recently.我的汽车引擎最近老出问题。
(also locomotive) ■the part of a railway train that pulls it along 机车，火车头




machinery, engine, motor, apparatus, mechanism, machine

这组词都有“机器，装置”的意思，其区别是：
machinery: 指机器的总称。
engine: 既可泛指或大或小、简单或复杂的机械、机器，又可指产生动力的发动机或引擎。
motor: 通常指小型或轻型马达、发动机。
apparatus: 指具有特殊用途的装置。
mechanism: 指运行系统，简单的机械装置。
machine: 普通用词，泛指一切机器。



engine, locomotive

这组词都有“机车，火车头”的意思，其区别是：
engine: 其区别在于所使用的地区不同，engine是英国英语
locomotive: 其区别在于所使用的地区不同，而locomotive为美国英语。


n. 引擎， [动力] 发动机； [铁路] 机车，火车头；工具
 - facilities, instrument, vehicle, tool, gear
examples: n.发动机；引擎；机车；火车头vt.给 ... 装引擎

(1) What's the cubic capacity of this engine?(2) There must be something wrong with the engine of my car.(3) There was a puff of steam from the engine before it stopped.(4) Smoke rises from the engine as the train climbs a hill.
(1) 这台发动机的立体容积是多少？(2) 我汽车的引擎一定是出故障了。(3) 机车喷出一股蒸气后就停了下来。(4) 火车向山上爬着,浓浓的烟雾从火车头升起。

translation:

vt. 设计，策划; 安排或处理; 改变…的基因（或遗传）结构

时态：engineered, engineering, engineers

→来自engine, 机械装置，引擎，即设计机械的人。
工程师(engine发动机)[-eer表名词"…人员"]
n.工程师The engineer examined the engine of the mining machine for stomach.工程师检查采矿机的发动机是否有肚子痛.



US [-'nɪr] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a person whose job is to design or build machines, engines or electrical equipment, or things such as roads, railways or bridges, using scientific principles 工程师；工程（或机械）设计人员

•The engineer is coming to repair our phone tomorrow morning.技工明天上午来修我们的电话。
US * an engine driver
UK [ˌen.dʒɪ'nɪər] US [-'nɪr] verb transitive ARRANGE  安排  ■to arrange cleverly and often secretly for something to happen, especially something that is to your advantage （尤指为自己的利益）密谋策划，精心安排
•Left-wing groups engineered a coup against the military government.左翼集团密谋策划了一场反军政府的政变。

•I'm trying to engineer a meeting between them.我正在尽力谋划，好让他们见面。

UK [ˌen.dʒɪ'nɪər] US [-'nɪr] verb transitive BUILD  建立  ■to design and build something using scientific principles 设计制造



n. [经管] 工程师；工兵；火车司机
 - gineer, sapper

 - design, style, project, frame, scheme
vi. 设计；建造
 - project, design
examples: n.工程师；机(械)师vt.设计；建造；策划
(1) Hs is a civil engineer.(2) His dream is to become an engineer.(3) He is a locomotive engineer.(4) They are engineering a bridge.(5) It's his father who engineered the plot.

translation:
n. 工程（学）， 工程师行业; 操纵，管理; 土木工程，工事; 开车技术

n.工程学He is studying engineering at college.我正在大学学习工程学.



US [-'nɪr.ɪŋ] noun uncountable  IMPROVER  ■the work of an engineer, or the study of this work 工程设计；工程学
•German/British engineering德国／英国工程设计

•Richard studied engineering at Manchester University.理查在曼彻斯特大学攻读工程学。

examples: (1) That bridge was a miracle of engineering.(2) He is studying engineering at college.(3) Genetic engineering will have revolutionaryconsequences for mankind.(4) She works for an engineering company.

translation:
n. 英语；英国人；英文；英格兰人
adj. 英国人的；英国的；英文的
vt. 把…译成英语

分布：英语(86%)，英国人(5%)，英语的(5%)，英国的(3%)，英国人的(1%)


→来自Angles, 词源同angle. 来自在公元5世纪入侵英国的日耳曼盎格鲁人，因其生活在德国西北部一角状土地而得名。
英国的n.英语[-ish 1.表形容词"像…一样,有的..."通常放在一具体名词后2.表动词"造成…"3.表示"国家的或语言"]



noun uncountable ■the language that is spoken in the UK, the US, and in many other countries 英语
•American/British English美国／英国英语

•Do you speak English?你会说英语吗？

['ɪŋ.glɪʃ] noun uncountable   Common Learner Errors   EnglishRemember:  English is always written with a capital 'E'.✗ I've been studying english since September.I've been studying English since September.
['ɪŋ.glɪʃ] adjective ■in or relating to the English language 英语的
•an English teacher英语老师

•an English translation英语译文
■relating to or from England 英格兰的；英国的
•English films/food/people英国电影／食品／人

•English law英国法律

•Is she English?她是英国人吗？

['ɪŋ.glɪʃ] plural noun the English ■the people of England 英格兰人；英国人



adj. 英文的；英国的；英国人的
 - Royal, British
n. 英语；英文；英国人；英格兰人
 - Anglo, British person
examples: n.英语；英国人adj.英语的；英国人的；英国的

(1) He spares no efforts to study English.(2) It is important for us to learn English.(3) The English are often regarded as being cold and reserved.(4) She has a good grasp of the English language.(5) Hunting foxes is a peculiarly English sport.(6) The English countryside looks at its best in spring.
(1) 他不辞劳苦地学习英语。(2) 学习英语对我们来讲是很重要的。(3) 人们往往认为英国人冷漠且保守。(4) 她精通英语。(5) 猎狐是英国人特有的运动。(6) 英国的乡村在春天景色最美。

translation:
n. 英国人

分布：英国人(100%)


noun countable ■a man who comes from England; see table of Geographical names  英格兰（男）人；英国（男）人
['ɪŋ.glɪʃ.mən] noun countable An Englishman's home is his castle. UK old-fashioned saying ■used to show that English people believe that they should be able to control what happens in their own homes, and that no one else should tell them what to do there 英国人的家就是他的城堡（表示英国人认为在自己的家里有权做自己想做的事情）。
examples: (1) He stared at the Englishman across the table.(2) An Englishman is an alien in America.
(1) 他两眼一直盯著坐在桌子对面的那个英国人。(2) 英国人在美国便是外国侨民。

translation:
vt. 享有，享受; 欣赏; 喜欢; 使过得快活
vi. 使过得快活

时态：enjoyed, enjoying, enjoys
分布：喜欢(52%)，享受(48%)


→en-, 进入，使。joy, 高兴。
vt.享受...的乐趣;欣赏;喜爱We enjoy free medical care.我们享受免费医疗.



verb transitive PLEASURE  乐趣   ESSENTIAL  ■to get pleasure from something 享受…的乐趣；喜爱；欣赏
•I really enjoyed that film/book/concert/party/meal.我真的很喜欢那部电影／那本书／那场音乐会／那次派对／那顿饭。

•[+ -ing verb] I want to travel because I enjoy meeting people and seeing new places.我想去旅游，因为我喜爱结识不同的人，见识没去过的地方。
enjoy yourself  ESSENTIAL  ■to get pleasure from the situation which you are in 过得愉快；感到快乐；玩得痛快
•I don't think Marie is enjoying herself very much at school.我觉得玛丽在学校不是太开心。

•Come on, why aren't you dancing? Enjoy yourselves!快过来，你们怎么不跳舞啊？痛痛快快地跳吧！
Enjoy! informal ■something you say to someone when you have given them something and you want them to enjoy it 好好享用吧！
•Here are your drinks. Enjoy!这是您的饮料。请慢用！
  Common Learner Errors   enjoyWhen enjoy  is followed by a verb, that verb cannot be in the infinitive with 'to'.Do not say 'enjoy to do something', say enjoy doing something.✗ My parents enjoy to walk in the mountains.My parents enjoy walking in the mountains.  Common Learner Errors   enjoy yourselfTo talk about people getting pleasure from the situation they are in, remember to use a reflexive pronounDon't say 'enjoy', say enjoy yourself/himself/themselves :✗ I have made new friends and am enjoying in London.I have made new friends and am enjoying myself in London.
[ɪn'dʒɔɪ] verb transitive ADVANTAGE  优势  ■to have something good that is an advantage 享有；享受
•Even though he's 86, he enjoys excellent health.虽然都86岁高龄了，他身体依然很健康。





love, fancy, enjoy, prefer, like, adore

这组词都有“喜欢、喜爱”的意思，其区别是：
love: 不但表示强烈的喜欢，而且含依恋之情，因此多用于能激起深厚情感的人或物。
fancy: 指喜爱投合自己心意、嗜好或欲望等的人或物。
enjoy: 指对能提供感观或智力上满足或快乐的东西表示欣赏或喜爱。
prefer: 指有选择性或偏向性的喜欢。
like: 最常用词，往往只表不太强烈的兴趣或关注，不带强烈的感情，除非另加修饰语。
adore: 非正式用词，口语体。指非常喜爱，带强烈的感情色彩。



appreciate, enjoy

appreciate: 指对事物有深刻的理解能力并能鉴赏。
enjoy: 是一般用语，仅指感官或智力上的满足，“享受”的意味较强。



have, hold, possess, own, enjoy, keep

这组词都有“有，具有，持有”的意思，其区别是：
have: 最常用词，可指任何情况下的具有，无论是物质的或精神的。
hold: 指拥有并保持财产及持有见解等，暗示不让别人拿走或占有。
possess: 较正式，指拥有或占有并能加以控制与支配，强调其归属；也指具有某种品质、才能、特点或性能等。
own: 不及本组的possess正式，多指所属关系，强调所有权，不管所属物是否在物主手中。
enjoy: 指享有某种权利或长处，带有欣赏或喜爱的情感。
keep: 指长时间地保有，保存某物，防止别人占去，强调安全和感情上的依附。


vt. 欣赏，享受；喜爱；使过得快活
 - to appreciate, feast
examples: (1) Now that I am free, I can enjoy music for a while.(2) They enjoy the fruits of their hard labor.(3) How did you enjoy the concert?(4) I enjoy reading Mark Twain's autobiography.
(1) 既然有空，我可以享受一下音乐。(2) 他们享受自己辛勤努力的成果。(3) 你喜欢那场音乐会吗？(4) 我喜欢读马克•吐温的自传。

translation:
vt. & vi. 扩大，放大; 扩展，扩充; 拉长说，详述

时态：enlarged, enlarging, enlarges
分布：扩大(86%)，增大(10%)，详述(4%)


→en-, 进入，使。large，大。
vt.扩大,放大,增大The tormentor enlarged the engagement garment.折磨者加大了订婚服装.



US [-'lɑ:rdʒ] verb intransitive or transitive ■to become bigger or to make something bigger （使）增大；（使）扩大；（使）扩充
•They've enlarged the kitchen by building over part of the garden.他们占用一部分花园扩建了厨房。

•an enlarged spleen肿大的脾脏
transitive ■to print a bigger copy of a photograph or document 放大（照片或档）
UK [ɪn'lɑ:dʒ] US [-'lɑ:rdʒ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   enlarge on/upon sth formal ■to give more details about something you have said or written 详述；详细说明
•Would you care to enlarge on what you've just said?您能否再进一步阐述一下您刚才讲过的内容？





enlarge, magnify, increase, expand, multiply, augment, amplify

这组词都有“增加，增大”的意思，其区别是：
enlarge: 主要指面积或体积等的扩大。
magnify: 可指用光学仪器使物体看上去显得变大；也指事实上把某物增大，有时用于夸张意味。
increase: 指数量、强度和大小等方面的扩大或增加。
expand: 指范围、程度、体积和尺寸等方面的扩大或增加。
multiply: 通常指自然繁殖而产生的增长，有时也指同类事物数量的成倍增加。
augment: 较正式用词，一般指在原有的基础上增加含量而扩大。
amplify: 在科技中常指声音的扩大或电磁波的增强。也指补充了细节、详述或扩大内容等。此词系正式用语。



enlarge, stretch, expand, reinforce, magnify, amplify

enlarge: v.扩大，多指具体物品如相片的放大。
 • enlarge photograph   放大照片enlarge a house扩建房屋
stretch: v. (有弹性地)伸展，延伸，并有可能超过限度；伸长、伸出(身体某部位)并绷紧肌肉(尤指在放松后或为了够着某物)。
 • The pullover stretched after I had worn it a few times.   这件套头毛衣我穿了几次之后就撑大了。
 • Having finished their morning work, the clerks stood up behind their desks, stretching themselves.   完成了早间工作之后，职员们站到桌子后面伸伸懒腰。
expand: v.指范围、体积的扩大、增大，也可以指内容或细节的充实。
 • The balloon expanded, then exploded.   气球先是膨胀，然后就爆破了。
reinforce: v.增援，加固。
magnify: v.放大，指用透镜或显微镜使物体看上去大一些。
 • His eyeglasses magnify words so he can read them.   他借助眼睛把字放大以便能够阅读。
amplify: v.扩大，增加，尤其指通过增强电压或电流使声音扩大；补充叙述(故事、事件等)。
 • We must ask you to amplify your statement.   我们得请你对你的说法作进一步的说明。



enlarge, extend, stretch, prolong, inflate, expand, increase, multiply, lengthen, add, augment, amplify

enlarge: 放大（照片）
extend: 使…（在空间或时间上）更大，更长；伸长，伸展，延展；舒展（肢体），extend sth
stretch: vt 拉长，撑大；绵延，延续
prolong: 人为的延长时间
inflate: 使（轮胎、气球等）充气，膨胀，inflate sth (with sth)
expand: 使…变大，扩大，扩展，expand sth into sth
increase: 增加，增大（数目、数量、体积等），increase sth from…to…
multiply: 成倍的增加
lengthen: 指自然的延长时间或空间
add: 加，添加，add sth to sth
augment: vt 增多，增大，augment sth
amplify: 特指音量，电流等的扩大


vi. 扩大；放大；详述
 - extend, broaden
vt. 扩大；使增大；扩展
 - extend, grow
examples: (1) I have to enlarge my vocabulary.(2) I planned to enlarge this photograph.(3) We must enlarge our views by reading.(4) I needn't enlarge upon this matter; you all know my views.
(1) 我必须扩大自己的词汇量。(2) 我计划放大这张照片。(3) 我们必须以读书来增长见识。(4) 我不需要详述此事; 你们都知道我的意见。

translation:
adj. 巨大的; 庞大的; 极恶的; 凶暴的

分布：巨大的(87%)，庞大的(13%)


→e-, 向外。-norm, 正常，见normal. 即超出正常的，巨大的。
巨大的(e出+norm+ous→出了正常状态→巨大的,过分的)[norm=rule,norm,表示"规则,规范"]
a.巨大的,庞大的Normally, enormous deformation is abnormal.通常,巨大的变形是不正常的.



US [-'nɔ:r-] adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■extremely large 极大的；巨大的；庞大的
•an enormous car/house大轿车／大房子

•He earns an enormous salary.他工资极高。

•I was absolutely enormous when I was pregnant.我怀孕的时候，身体十分臃肿。

•You've been an enormous help.你真是帮了大忙。





tremendous, colossal, huge, gigantic, massive, vast, enormous, immense, giant

这组词都有“巨大的，庞大的”的意思，其区别是：
tremendous: 指某物很大，大得惊人；也可用作引申意义。
colossal: 侧重尺寸、规模和体积的无比巨大。
huge: 含义广，强调体积或容积的庞大。也可用于引申意义。
gigantic: 指面积或体积的巨大，但多用于引申意义。
massive: 指大的体积、数量和重量，侧重庞大而笨重。
vast: 多指空间、面积、范围的巨大，不涉及重量。
enormous: 指体积、数量或程度远远超过一般标准。
immense: 正式用词，侧重空间的广阔，也指面积或分量的巨大。
giant: 非正式用词，多为褒义。指如巨人般的庞大体积。


adj. 庞大的，巨大的；凶暴的，极恶的
 - huge, tremendous, massive, macro, vast
examples: (1) Long ago enormous animals lived on the earth.(2) She stood alone on the enormous stage.(3) They overlooked the enormous risks involved.(4) The sight of such an enormous crowd astonished us.(5) I was enormous when I was carrying my first baby.
(1) 很久以前，地球上生活着巨大的动物。(2) 她孤零零地站在巨大的舞台上。(3) 他们忽略了暗含的巨大危险。(4) 看到如此庞大的人群我惊讶万分。(5) 我怀头胎的时候非常胖。

translation:
adv. 足够地，充足地; 十分地
adj. 充足的; 足够的
n. 充分，足够; 满足
int. 够了

分布：足够(59%)，足够的(31%)，足够地(4%)，尚(2%)，相当(2%)，充分地(2%)


→来自古英语genog, 足够。ge-, 强调，-nog, 达到，来自nok, 达到，足够。
a.(for)足够的n.足够,充分ad.足够地"Rough cough is tough enough," Bough said while touching the torch."剧烈咳嗽是够难以对付的,"大树枝在触摸手电筒时说道.



determiner pronoun adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■as much as is necessary; in the amount or to the degree needed 充分；充足
•Is there enough cake/Are there enough cakes for everyone?蛋糕够大家分吗？

•There are 25 textbooks per class. That should be enough.每班25本教材，应该够了。

•Have you had enough (to eat)?你（吃）饱了吗？

•I know enough about art to recognize a masterpiece when I see one.我的艺术造诣足以使我看到一幅杰作就能辨认出来。

•He's tall enough to change the bulb without getting on a chair.他个头够高，不用踩椅子就可以换灯泡。
 ESSENTIAL  ■as much as or more than is wanted 足够；过多
•[+ to infinitive] I've got enough work to do at the moment, without being given any more.即使不再给我增加工作量，目前的工作也够我应付一阵子了。

•Half an hour in his company is quite enough!在他公司待上半小时就足以让人烦透了！

•Stop. You've made enough of a (= a lot of) mess already.别闹了，你已经弄得一团糟了。

•You've drunk more than enough (= too much) already.你已经喝多了。

•I've seen/heard enough now (= I do not want to see/hear any more).我已经看／听够了。

•I've had  enough  of your excuses (= I want them to stop).我已经听够了你的借口。

•Enough of this / USEnough already (= Stop) ! I don't want to discuss it any more.够了！我不想再讨论这个了。
Enough is enough ■something you say when you want something to stop 够了，行了，适可而止（认为不应再继续）
•Enough is enough - I don't want to argue with you any more.好了好了，我不想再跟你争了。
enough said informal ■something you say to tell someone that you understand what they have said and that they do not need to say any more 不必再讲，无需多说（表示已经明白）
•"Someone has to explain the situation to her." "Enough said."“ 必需有人向她说明一下情况。”“我明白 ，不用说了。”
have had enough ■to want something to stop because it is annoying you 受够了；烦透了；再也没法忍受了
•I've had enough - I'm going home.我受够了——我要回家了。
That's enough ■used to tell someone to stop behaving badly 不要那样，够了（用于制止不好的行为）
•That's enough, Peter. Give those toys back, please.够了，彼得。把那些玩具还回去，听话。

[ɪ'nʌf] adverb ■used after an adjective, adverb or verb to mean to the necessary degree （用于形容词、副词或动词后）足够地
•Is the water hot enough yet?水够热吗？

•I don't think he's really experienced enough for this sort of job.我认为做这类工作他经验不太足够。

•She told me it was brand new and I was stupid enough to believe her.她跟我说这是全新的，我也真够傻，竟然相信她。

•formal Would you be good enough to take my bag upstairs for me?你可以帮我把皮包拿到楼上吗？
■used after an adjective or adverb to mean quite 很，十分（用于形容词、副词后）
•He's bad enough, but his brother is far worse.他已经够坏了，可是他哥哥比他还要坏得多。

•She's gone away for six months, but strangely/oddly/funnily enough (= surprisingly) , her boyfriend doesn't seem too unhappy about it.她离开都六个月了，奇怪的是，她男朋友好像并没有因此不开心。

[ɪ'nʌf] adverb   Common Learner Errors   enoughWarning:  check your word order!When enough is used with an adjective, it always goes directly after the adjective.Don't say 'enough kind/healthy/brave etc.', say kind/healthy/brave etc. enough :I hope my instructions are clear enough.




adequate, enough, sufficient

这些形容词均含“足够的，充足的”之意。
adequate: 指数量上足够，质量上适当。
enough: 最普通用词，口语、书面语可用，较侧重分量或数量的足够，多指希望的满足。
sufficient: 正式用词，侧重数目或数量或程度达到某一特定要求或需要。


adv. 足够地，充足地
 - adequately, sufficiently
n. 很多；充足
 - amplitude, ton, plenty of
adj. 充足的
 - adequate, plenitudinous
examples: adj.足够的adv.足够地；充分地；相当；尚pron.足够

(1) I haven't enough time for reading.(2) He has enough money (=money enough) to buy a car.(3) John's old enough to take care of himself.(4) He is brave enough to face dangers.(5) He is competent enough to fill that position.(6) He was careful enough to check up every detail.(7) I've had enough of that.(8) I'm afraid I've eaten more than enough.
(1) 我没有足够的时间读书。(2) 他有足够的钱买一辆汽车。(3) 约翰长大了,能照顾自己了。(4) 他很勇敢,足以面对各种危险。(5) 他完全胜任那个职位。(6) 他非常仔细，把每一个细节都核对过了。(7) 我真受够了。(8) 我怕我是吃得过多了。

translation:
vt. 确保; 担保获得[避免]; 使（某人）获得; 使安全

时态：ensured, ensuring, ensures
分布：确保(71%)，保证(25%)，担保(2%)，使安全(2%)


→en-, 进入，使。sure, 确认。
v.确保,保证;使安全I assure the injured jury that a sure insurance is ensured.我让受伤的陪审团确信一笔有把握的保险得到的确保.
【记】sure（adj 可靠的；确定的）



US [-'ʃʊr] verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to make something certain to happen 确保；保证
•The airline is taking steps to ensure safety on its aircraft.航空公司正在采取措施以确保其航班的飞行安全。

•[+ (that)] The role of the police is to ensure (that) the law is obeyed.员警的职责就是确保人们遵守法律。

•[+ two objects] Their 2-0 victory today has ensured the Italian team a place in the Cup Final/ensured a place in the Cup Final for the Italian team.今天义大利队二比零获胜，稳操胜券进入世界杯的决赛。





insure, promise, pledge, guarantee, assure, ensure

这组词都有“保证”的意思，其区别是：
insure: 常与ensure换用，但前者多指经济方面的保证、保险。
promise: 侧重表自己的主观意向，设法用语言使人感到稳当可靠。
pledge: 正式用词，指通过郑重许诺、协议或立誓等保证承担某一义务或遵守某一原则。
guarantee: 指对事物的品质或人的行为及履行义务、义务等承担责任的保证。
assure: 侧重指消除某人思想上的怀疑或担心，从而有达到目的的保证感，但不如ensure普通。
ensure: 侧重使人相信某个行为或力量产生的结果。


vt. 保证，确保；使安全
 - undertake, assure, insure
examples: (1) We have worked closely with the Deaf community first, on passage of ADA, and most recently, to ensure that the Act is enforced.(2) I can't ensure that he will be there on time.(3) This medicine will ensure you a good night's sleep.(4) People should wash regularly to ensure personal hygiene.(5) The doctors were zealous in their efforts to ensure the survival of premature babies.(6) We must ensure the purity of drinking water.(7) If you want to ensure that you catch the plane, take a taxi.
(1) 我们最近经常在ada路边的聋人社会附近工作，可以担保该法案得到了实施。(2) 我不能担保他会及时到那儿。(3) 这药保证能让你好好睡一觉。(4) 人们应经常洗澡以保证个人卫生。(5) 医生们在努力保证早产婴儿成活方面热情很高。(6) 我们必须确保饮用水的纯净。(7) 你要想确保能赶上那班飞机，就坐出租车去吧。

translation:
vt. & vi. 进入; 开始; 参加; 登记

时态：entered, entering, enters
分布：进入(100%)


→en-, 进入，使。-ter, 比较级后缀，见external, extrovert.
vt.进入;参加,加入;写入vi.进去,进来Her dream to enter the famous university came true.她要进入名牌大学学习的梦想实现了.



US [-tˌɚ] verb GO IN  进入   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to come or go into a particular place 进来；进去；进入
•The police entered (the building) through/by the side door.员警从侧门进入（这座大楼）。

•You will begin to feel sleepy as the drug enters the bloodstream.药物进入血液后你就会开始感到昏昏欲睡。
  Common Learner Errors   enterWarning: when enter  has a direct object, it is not followed by a preposition.Don't say 'enter in/into a place', say enter a place :✗ As you enter into the station, the shop is on the right.As you enter the station, the shop is on the right.
UK ['en.tər] US [-tˌɚ] verb COMPETITION  竞赛   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to be included in a competition, race or examination, or to arrange for someone else to do this （为…）报名参加（竞赛、考试等）；安排…参加
•Both men have been entered for/in the 100 metres in Paris next month.两个人都已报名参加下个月在巴黎举行的百米短跑比赛。

•All three companies have entered the race to develop a new system.三家公司都加入了开发这套新系统的竞争。

•Are you going to enter the photography competition ?你要参加摄影比赛吗？

UK ['en.tər] US [-tˌɚ] verb INFORMATION  资讯   ADVANCED  transitive ■to put information into a computer, book or document 输入；登记；登录
•You have to enter a password to access the database.你必须输入密码才能进入资料库。
transitive formal ■to make a particular type of statement officially （正式）提出
•The prisoner entered a plea of not guilty.犯人提出无罪抗辩。

UK ['en.tər] US [-tˌɚ] verb ORGANIZATION  组织   ADVANCED  transitive ■to become a member of a particular organization, or to start working in a particular type of job 成为…的一员，加入；开始从事
•Ms Doughty entered politics/Parliament after a career in banking.道蒂女士在银行业工作了几年后开始从政／成为议员。

UK ['en.tər] US [-tˌɚ] verb PERIOD  时期  transitive ■to begin a period of time 进入…时期
•The project is entering its final stages.工程就要进入最后的阶段。

•The violence is now entering its third week.暴动现已进入第三周。

UK ['en.tər] US [-tˌɚ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   enter into sth formal  ADVANCED  ■to start to become involved in something, especially a discussion or agreement 参加，进入，开始（尤指讨论或协定）
•They refuse to enter into any discussion on this matter.他们拒绝就此事进行任何探讨。
not enter into sth ■If you say that something does not enter into something else, it is not an important or necessary part of it 对…没有影响；对…无关紧要；不是…的主要构成部分
•The Council's opinion doesn't enter into it - it's up to us to make the decision.政务委员会的意见无关紧要——决定权在我们手里。

UK ['en.tər] US [-tˌɚ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   enter on/upon sth formal ■to do or become involved in something 开始…；着手做…
•He first entered on a career in banking over 40 years ago.他四十多年前进入银行业。

UK ['en.tər] US [-tˌɚ] noun only singular ■the key on a computer keyboard which is used to say that the words or numbers on the screen are correct, or to say that an instruction should be performed, or to move down a line on the screen 输入键
•Move the cursor to where it says 'New File' and press enter.把游标移到“开新档案”处然后按输入键。




vt. 进入；开始；参加
 - institute, come into, participate in, go into, get into
vi. 参加，登场；进去
 - participate in, take part in, go through
n. [计] 输入；回车
 - import, inputting
examples: (1) Please do not enter before knocking on the door.(2) He has no choice but enter that college.
(1) 进来前请先敲门。(2) 他不得不进入那所大学读书。

translation:
vt. 热情款待; 使有兴趣; 抱着，怀有; 考虑
vi. 热情款待

时态：entertained, entertaining, entertains
分布：娱乐(50%)，招待(30%)，考虑(12%)，抱有(4%)，容纳(2%)，使有兴趣(2%)


→enter-, 更里面，中间。-tain, 握，维持，词源同contain, tenable. 即招待客人，维持客户。
v.招待,款待;使娱乐;使欢乐;容纳,接受Having attained the entertaining center, the retained man was detained and sustained pain.到达娱乐中心后,聘请的男子遭到拘留并经受到痛苦.



US [-tˌɚ-] verb AMUSE  使开心   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to keep a group of people interested or enjoying themselves 使有兴趣；使快乐
•We hired a magician to entertain the children.我们请了一位魔术师表演节目让孩子们开心。

•Most children's television programmes aim to educate and entertain at the same time.大多数儿童电视节目都旨在寓教于乐。

UK [en.tə'teɪn] US [-tˌɚ-] verb INVITE  邀请  intransitive or transitive ■to invite someone to your house and give food and drink to them （在家）招待，款待，请客
•We entertain a lot of people, mainly business associates of my wife's.我们经常在家请客，主要都是我妻子的业务伙伴。

•Now that I live on my own, I don't entertain much.既然我自己一个人生活，我也就不常请人到家里做客。

UK [en.tə'teɪn] US [-tˌɚ-] verb THINK ABOUT  考虑  transitive not continuous formal ■to hold in your mind or to be willing to consider or accept 怀着；抱有；心存；持有
•The General refused to entertain the possibility of defeat.将军拒绝考虑失败的可能性。





amuse, please, interest, entertain

这组词都有“使人娱乐，消遣”的意思，其区别是：
amuse: 指使人通过注意某些有趣或悦人的事物而消遣，着重使人愉快的效果。
please: 多指愿望、兴趣得到满足后产生的强烈满意情绪。
interest: 普通用词，指出于任何原因使人兴奋或对某事物保持好奇心或注意力，侧重引起兴趣或注意。
entertain: 指通过给他人快乐感的消遣活动，使自己或他人从单调中解脱出来。


vt. 娱乐；招待；怀抱；容纳
 - serve, invite, attend, contain, accept
vi. 款待
 - welcome in
examples: v.娱乐；使有兴趣；招待；考虑；抱有；容纳

(1) We were all entertained by his humorous stories.(2) A teacher should entertain as well as teach.(3) I like to entertain friends with music and refreshments at home.(4) It was futile to entertain such a question.(5) I have never entertained any illusions about him.(6) The human soul is hospitable, and will entertain conflicting sentiments and contradictory opinions with much impartiality.
(1) 他的幽默故事使我们大家都很开心。(2) 教师不仅要教书，也要激起学生的兴趣。(3) 我喜欢在家里用音乐和茶点招待朋友。(4) 考虑这样一个问题是没有用的。(5) 我从来没有对他抱过幻想。(6) 人类的灵魂是能够容纳一切的，它毫不偏袒地接受互相对立的感情和互相矛盾的意见。

translation:
n. 热情，热忱; 热衷的事物; 宗教的狂热

分布：热情(91%)，热心(7%)，热衷的事物(2%)


→来自enthuse，热情。
热情(en进入+thus[theo神]+iasm状态→进入神的状态→热情)[the(a)=god表示"神"]
n.热情,热心;狂热;积极性(for)He showed much enthusiasm for our plan.他对我们的计划表示极大热忱.
【源】原指：神灵附体的引起的狂喜，然后引申为宗教的狂热，现在的意思显然有所扩大。【反】ennui（n 倦怠；厌倦）



US [-'θu:-] noun  IMPROVER  uncountable ■a feeling of energetic interest in a particular subject or activity and an eagerness to be involved in it 巨大兴趣；热情；热忱；热心
•One of the good things about teaching young children is their enthusiasm.教小孩子的好处之一就是他们对甚么都充满了兴趣。

•After the accident he lost his enthusiasm for the sport.经历这场事故后，他对这项体育运动失去了热情。

•I just can't work up (= start to feel) any enthusiasm for the whole project.我就是对整个案子提不起一点热情。
countable ■a subject or activity that interests you very much 激发热情的事物；热衷的活动；热爱的事物
•One of his greatest enthusiasms was yoga.他最热衷的活动之一就是瑜伽。





enthusiasm, zeal

这组词都有“热情”的意思，其区别是：
enthusiasm: 侧重指比较理智的热情，如对人对事的钦佩或为了事业或目的等所表现出的追求与忠诚
zeal: 通常指为实现向往的事业或为达到所追求的目标而积极投身到实践活动中所表现出来的热情。


n. 热心，热忱，热情
 - passion, flame, fire, warmth
examples: (1) His refusal iced our enthusiasm.(2) His enthusiasm made everyone else interested.(3) One of my great enthusiasms is music.
(1) 他的拒绝浇熄了我们的热情。(2) 他的热心激发了大家的兴致。(3) 我的一大爱好就是音乐。

translation:
adj. 热心的; 热情的; 热烈的; 狂热的

分布：热情的(56%)，热烈的(22%)，热心的(22%)


a.热情的,热心的Thus the enthusiastic dumb man thumbed the humble man's umbrella.于是热情的哑巴用拇指拨弄谦卑男子的伞.
【反】halfhearted（adj 不认真的；不热心的）



US [-ˌθu:-] adjective  IMPROVER  ■showing enthusiasm 热心的；热情的；热衷的
•You don't seem very enthusiastic about the party - don't you want to go tonight?你好像对这个派对不怎么热衷——你今晚不想去了吗？





zealous, enthusiastic, intent

这组词都有“热心的，热诚的”的意思，其区别是：
zealous: 指对所从事的事表现出的高度热情和积极性。
enthusiastic: 指对参与某项活动或对感兴趣的计划或决定表现出的毫无保留的热切心情。
intent: 指集中精力从事正在进行的活动，也可指专心寻求自己感兴趣的东西。


adj. 热情的；热心的；狂热的
 - intense, warm, crazy, eager, tropical
examples: (1) He is enthusiastic about helping others.(2) He doesn't know much about this subject, but he's very enthusiastic.(3) The audience were enthusiastic on the opening night of the play.(4) His idea received an enthusiastic response.
(1) 他热心助人。(2) 他对这事所知不多,但他非常热心。(3) 那出戏首次公演之夜观众非常热情。(4) 他的想法获得热烈的响应。

translation:
vt. 使有资格; 给…定名; 给与…权利; 称做

时态：entitled, entitling, entitles
分布：使有权利(50%)，取名为(50%)


→en-, 进入，使。title, 赋予。
v.给以权利(或资格);给...称号(题名);授权A title is entitled to the retired worker who repaired the entire tire tirelessly.那个不倦地修理了整个轮胎的退休工人被授予了一个头衔.
【记】title（n 头衔；名称；标题；资格；字幕；权利）



US [-tˌl] verb transitive ALLOW  允许   ADVANCED  ■to give someone the right to do or have something 给予（某人…）的权利；使符合资格
•Being unemployed entitles you to free medical treatment.失业时，你有权享受免费医疗。

•[+ to infinitive] The employer is entitled to ask for references.雇主有权索取推荐信。

UK [ɪn'taɪ.tl] US [-tˌl] verb transitive GIVE TITLE  起名字  ■to give a title to a book, film, etc 给…命名，给…题名
•Her latest novel, entitled 'The Forgotten Sex', is out this week.她名为《被遗忘的性别》的最新小说将于本周出版。
examples: (1) She read a poem entitled The Apple Tree.(2) He entitled the book Savage Love.(3) His services entitle him to our respect.(4) Your qualifications entitle you to a higher salary.
(1) 她读了一首题为《苹果树》的诗。(2) 他给这本书取名为《野性的爱》。(3) 凭他的功劳他应受我们尊敬。(4) 你的资格使你有权享有较高的薪水。

translation:
n. 入口，进口; 进入; 进入方法，进入方式; 入场权
vt. 使出神，使入迷; 使喜悦，使狂喜

时态：entranced, entrancing, entrances
分布：入口(77%)，进入(12%)，使入迷(4%)，登场(3%)，进入权(2%)，使狂喜(2%)


→来自enter的名词形式。entrance 恍惚
n.入口,门口;进入;入学,入会After the entertainment the captain obtained an entrance fee.娱乐表演之后,船长获得了一笔入场费.
【记】源于enter（vt 进入；vi 进去；n 回车）【反】egress（n 出口）；disgust（v 令人厌恶）；repel（vt 击退；使厌恶）；repulse（v 拒绝；憎恶）；bore（v 使烦扰；钻孔）



noun  ESSENTIAL  countable ■a door, gate, etc. by which you can enter a building or place 入口；大门（口）；通道
•There are two entrances - one at the front and one round the back.入口有两个，一个在前面，另一个在后面。
 Compare exit countable usually singular ■when an actor or dancer comes onto a stage （演员的）入场，登场
•He makes a spectacular entrance in act two draped in a gold sheet.在第二幕，他身披金袍上场，光彩炫目。
countable usually singular ■the act of a person coming into a room in an ordinary situation, although often because there is something noticeable about it 进入；进门
•I noticed her entrance because she slipped and fell in the doorway.她进来时我注意到了，因为她在门口滑了一跤。
uncountable ■the right to enter a place 进入权；进入许可
•The management reserve the right to refuse entrance.管理部门保留拒绝他人入内的权利。

UK [ɪn'trɑ:nts] US [-'trænts] verb transitive literary ■Someone or something that entrances you is so beautiful or interesting that you cannot stop listening to or watching them 使…着迷
•He has entranced millions of people with his beautifully illustrated books.他曾以其附有精美插图的书吸引了上百万名读者。





admission, entry, admittance, entrance

这组词都有“入口或进入”的意思，其区别是：
admission: 指被允许进入某公共场所或建筑物的权利，也指进入某一组织。
entry: 强调正式地、礼仪地进入。用作“入口”解时，多指房门、院门、门廊等。
admittance: 指许可进入某地或某建筑物。
entrance: 含义广泛，作“进入”解时，可用于许多场合；作“入口”解时，指有门或栏的入口处。


n. [建] 入口；进入
 - threshold, access, portal, way in
examples: n.入口；进入；登场；进入权vt.使入迷；使狂喜

(1) There is an entrance just around the corner.(2) I'll meet you at the entrance of the zoo tomorrow.(3) A lighthouse marks the entrance to the harbour.(4) The actress makes her entrance in Act 3.(5) The police were unable to gain entrance to the house.(6) Guests have free entrance to the swimming pool and the health club.(7) Her beauty entirely entrances him.(8) This gift is bound to entrance any child.
(1) 拐角处有个入口。(2) 明天我会在动物园的入口处和你见面。(3) 灯塔是进入海港航道的标志。(4) 女演员在第三幕登场。(5) 警方未能得到进入这栋房子的许可权。(6) 客人们可以免费进入游泳池和健身房。(7) 她的美丽完全使他入迷了。(8) 这件礼物任何小孩看了都会欣喜若狂。

translation:
n. 进入，入场; 入口处，门口; 登记，记录; 参加比赛的人

分布：条目(44%)，进入(34%)，入口(21%)，进入权(1%)


→来自enter, 进入。
n.进入,入口;通道;记载,条目No entry.禁止入内.



noun WAY IN  进入   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■when you enter a place or join a particular society or organization 进入；加入，参加
•A flock of sheep blocked our entry to the village.一群羊挡住了我们进村的路。

•I can't go down that street - there's a 'No entry' sign.我不能走那条街——那里有“禁止入内”的标志。

•The actress's entry into the world of politics surprised most people.这位女演员进入了政界，这使得大多数人都感到诧异。

•She made her entry to the ceremony surrounded by a group of photographers.她在一群摄影师的簇拥下走进典礼仪式现场。

•The burglars gained entry by a top window.窃贼是从屋顶的天窗进入室内的。
countable ■a door, gate, etc. by which you enter a place 门；入口；通道
•I'll wait for you at the entry to the park.我会在公园入口处等你。

['en.tri] noun INFORMATION  资讯   IMPROVER  countable ■a separate piece of information that is recorded in a book, computer, etc 项目；条目；（一则）记录
•They've updated a lot of the entries in the most recent edition of the encyclopaedia.在最新版百科全书中他们更新了很多条目。

•As his illness progressed, he made fewer entries in his diary.随着病情加重，他日记记得越来越少。

['en.tri] noun COMPETITION  竞赛   ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■a piece of work that you do in order to take part in a competition, or the act of taking part in a competition 参赛作品；参赛
•There have been a fantastic number of entries for this year's poetry competition.今年的诗歌创作大赛收到的参赛作品很多，令人惊喜。

•the winning entries获奖参赛作品

•Entry to the competition is restricted to those who have a ticket.持票者方可参加竞赛。

•Have you filled in your entry form yet?你填写参赛表了吗？





admission, entry, admittance, entrance

这组词都有“入口或进入”的意思，其区别是：
admission: 指被允许进入某公共场所或建筑物的权利，也指进入某一组织。
entry: 强调正式地、礼仪地进入。用作“入口”解时，多指房门、院门、门廊等。
admittance: 指许可进入某地或某建筑物。
entrance: 含义广泛，作“进入”解时，可用于许多场合；作“入口”解时，指有门或栏的入口处。


n. 进入；入口；条目；登记；报关手续；对土地的侵占
 - threshold, registration, access, portal
examples: (1) He pretended not to observe our entry.(2) The people without a ticket are denied entry.(3) He has applied for an entry visa.(4) You can leave your umbrella in the entry.(5) This dictionary has over 30000 entries.
(1) 他装作没有看见我们进来。(2) 没有票的人不许入内。(3) 他已申请入境签证。(4) 雨伞可放在入口处。(5) 这本字典有3 万多词条。

translation:
n. 信封，封皮; 壳层，外壳; 包裹物; [生物学]膜，包袋

分布：信封(96%)，封袋(2%)，壳层(2%)


→来自envelop,包围，围住。
n.信封,信皮;封套The sloped envelope indicates the development velocity of printing.那个倾斜的信封显示了印刷的发展速度.
【记】envelop（vt 遮盖；包围n 包裹；信封）



US ['ɑ:n.və.loʊp] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a flat, usually square or rectangular, paper container for a letter 信封
UK ['en.və.ləʊp] US ['ɑ:n.və.loʊp] noun countable on the back of an envelope ■in a hurried way, without much detail 匆忙地；粗略地
•The prices were very roughly calculated - it looked as though he'd done them on the back of an envelope.计算出来的价格不很精确——看起来似乎他只是粗略算了一下。




n. 信封，封皮；包膜； [天] 包层；包迹
 - cover, involucrum
examples: (1) There are several enclosures in the envelope.(2) I use a prepaid envelope.(3) He glued a stamp onto the envelope.(4) The surface of the sun is a glowing gas envelope.(5) The papers are enveloped by plastic bag.
(1) 信封内装有几份附件。(2) 我用了一个邮资已付的信封。(3) 他把邮票贴在信封上。(4) 太阳的表面是一层炽热的气体层。(5) 论文用塑料纸包封好了。

translation:
n. 嫉妒，妒忌; 羡慕
vi. 感到妒忌; 显示出妒忌

时态：envied, envying, envies
分布：羡慕(78%)，妒忌(22%)


→来自拉丁语invidia, 来自词根vid, 看，词源同video,visage. 词义贬义化，指不怀好意的看。
毒剂(en+vy[=vid]看到[别人]→妒忌)[vis,vid=see表示"看"]
v./n.羡慕,忌妒How I envy you!我好羡慕你!



verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to wish that you had something that another person has 羡慕；忌妒
•I envy her ability to talk to people she's never met before.她与人初次见面就能侃侃而谈，这真让我羡慕。

•[+ two objects] I don't envy you the job of cooking for all those people.为所有那些人做饭，你这种工作我一点都不羡慕。

['en.vi] noun uncountable  IMPROVER  ■the feeling that you wish you had something that someone else has 羡慕；忌妒
•I watched with envy as she set off for the airport.看着她动身去机场，我心中好生羡慕。
 Compare jealousy be the envy of sb ■to be liked and wanted by a lot of people 是令（某人）羡慕（或嫉妒）的对象
•Her hair is the envy of the office.她的一头秀发令同办公室的人好生羡慕。





jealousy, envy

这组词都有“妒忌”的意思，其区别是：
jealousy: 强调对别人占有的东西恼恨不满。
envy: 侧重指因别人获得了自己本想获得的东西或成就而产生妒忌。


n. 嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕
 - jealousy, green-eyed monster
vt. 嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕
 - green eyed, be jealous
examples: v.羡慕；妒忌n.羡慕；(妒忌的)对象

(1) They envy him his good fortune.(2) I envy her ability to dance in front of a crowd.(3) Don't envy anyone who lives better than you.(4) He was filled with envy at my success.(5) His new house was the envy of all his friends.
(1) 他们羡慕他的好运气。(2) 她在众人面前所展现的的舞技令我羡慕不已。(3) 不要妒忌比你日子过得好的任何人。(4) 他对我的成功满怀羡慕。(5) 他的新居成了所有朋友羡慕的对象。

translation:
adj. 相等的，平等的; 平稳的; 势均力敌的; 胜任的
vt. 等于; 比得上; 使相等; 同样看待
n. 同样的人; 相等的数量; 能与之比拟的东西; （地位、实力等）相同的人
vi. 相等，相平（与out连用）

时态：equalled, equalling, equals
分布：平等(42%)，等于(25%)，平等的(21%)，相等的(8%)，比得上(3%)，同辈(1%)


→来自拉丁文aequus,平衡，相等。
相等的,平等的(equ+al)[equ,equi=equal,even,表示"相等,平均"]
a.相等的;胜任的n.相等的事务;对手v.等于Qualified quality and adequate quantity are equally important.合格的质量和足够的数量同等重要.



adjective SAME  相同的   ESSENTIAL  ■the same in amount, number or size, or the same in importance and deserving the same treatment （数量、大小）相同的，相等的；（地位、待遇）平等的，同等的
•All people are equal, deserving the same rights as each other.所有人都是平等的，享有同等的权利。

•They've got a long way to go before they achieve equal pay/status for men and women.要实现男女同工同酬／地位平等，他们仍有很长的路要走。

•One litre is equal to 1.76 imperial pints.1升等于1.76 英制品脱。

•One box may look bigger than the other, but in fact they are roughly (= almost) equal in volume.一个盒子可能看起来比另一个大，但其实它们的容量大致相等。

['i:.kwəl] adjective ABLE  有能力的  [after verb] formal ■skilled or brave enough for a difficult duty or piece of work （能力、勇气）胜任的，合适的，相当的
•It's a challenging job but I'm sure you'll prove equal to it.这项工作很有挑战性，但是我相信你最终有能力完成它。

•Is he equal to the task ?他能胜任这项任务吗？

['i:.kwəl] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■someone or something that has the same importance as someone or something else and deserves the same treatment （应获得同等待遇的）同等重要的人或物
•The good thing about her as a boss is that she treats us all as equals.作为老板，她的优点就在于她对待我们一视同仁。

•Throughout her marriage she never considered her husband as her intellectual equal.自结婚之日起，她一直就认为在才智上她丈夫根本无法和她相提并论。

•As an all-round athlete he has no equal (= no-one else is as good).他作为一名全能运动员，无人可望其项背。

['i:.kwəl] verb [L only + noun] transitive (-ll- or  US USUALLY  -l-)BE THE SAME  使平等  ■to be the same in value or amount as something else 与某物的质量或数量相等
•Sixteen ounces equals one pound.16盎司等于1磅。
■to achieve the same standard or level as someone else, or the same standard or level as you did before 达到其他人或自己过去所达的相同标准或水准
