(1) 我们学校的学生数超过八百人。(2) 尽人皆知他在聚会上十分放肆。(3) 食物中脂肪过多会导致心脏病。(4) 这种过剩密度的波就是声波。(5) 流动性过剩造成了通货膨胀。(6) 这个胖男孩节制饮食以减轻过量的体重。(7) 多余的行李最好托运。

translation:
adj. 过度的，极度的; 过分的; 过多的; 过逾

分布：过多的(60%)，过分的(40%)


过分的;过度的[ced,ceed,cess=go,表示"行走,前进"]
a.过多的;过分的;额外I exceed the excellent student who has excessive excellence.我胜过那个有过多优点的优秀学生.



adjective  ADVANCED  ■too much 过分的；过度的；过多的
•Excessive exercise can sometimes cause health problems.过度的运动有时也会导致健康问题。

•Any more pudding would simply be excessive.不能再吃布丁了，再吃就太多了。





gigantic, maximum, excess, excessive, multiple, surplus

gigantic: 巨大的，庞大的
maximum: 最大的，最高的
excess: （作定语） 过度的，额外的，超过了正常限度或标准
excessive: 过度的，过分的
multiple: 多样的，多重的，多倍的
surplus: 过剩的，多余的，剩余的


adj. 过多的，极度的；过分的
 - extreme, ultra, tall
examples: (1) Excessive patriotism can lead to xenophobia.(2) Excessive dosage of this drug can result in injury to the liver.(3) The quality of urban living has been damaged by excessive noise levels.(4) I consider the excessive smoking and drinking tend to cloud the brain.(5) Excessive rainfall had made the harvest impossible.
(1) 爱国主义过了头即可导致仇视一切外国人。(2) 这种药使用过量会损害肝脏。(3) 城市生活的质量已被过度的噪音所破坏。(4) 我认为过多的抽烟和过量的酗酒，会使人的头脑迟钝。(5) 雨量过多，丰收已经不可能了。

translation:
n. 交换; 交易; 交易所; 兑换（率）
vt. 交换，互换; 兑换; 交换，调换
vi. 交换，替换; 进行易货贸易，作物物交换; [金融业]（货币）交换，兑换

时态：exchanged, exchanging, exchanges
分布：交换(68%)，兑换(22%)，交易所(9%)，交战(1%)


→ex-, 向外。change, 改变。
v./n.(for)交换,兑换;交流,交易;交换台In the exchange the oranges are arranged into strange ranges.在交易所里橙子被排成奇怪的行.



noun  ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■when you give something to someone and they give you something else 交换；互换；交流
•an exchange of ideas/information思想／讯息交流

•They were given food and shelter in  exchange  for work.他们帮人工作以换取食宿。

•She proposes an exchange of contracts at two o'clock.她提议两点钟办理房屋产权过户手续。

•Several people were killed during the exchange of gunfire.交火中有几个人丧生。
countable ■a short conversation or argument （短暂的）交谈，对话；争吵
•There was a brief exchange between the two leaders.两位领导人进行了简短的交谈。

[ɪks'tʃeɪndʒ] verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to give something to someone and receive something from them 交换；互换；交流
•It's traditional for the two teams to exchange shirts after the game.比赛后两队队员交换球衣，这是传统。

•I exchanged those trousers for a larger size.我换了条大一点的裤子。

•Every month the group meets so its members can exchange their views/opinions (= have a discussion).小组每个月都聚会一次，这样成员之间就可以互相交流看法／观点。

•We exchanged greetings before the meeting.会前我们互相致意。

•We can exchange addresses when we see each other.等我们见了面，可以互相交换位址。

•Exchanging houses (= going to live in someone else's house while they live in yours) for a few weeks is a good way of having a holiday.与他人交换住所来住上几个星期也不失为一个渡假的好方法。

[ɪks'tʃeɪndʒ] verb transitive exchange words ■to speak with someone 交谈；对话
•We exchanged words after the meeting.我们在会后进行了交谈。





replace, substitute, exchange

这组词都有“换”的意思，其区别是：
replace: 的含义为“替换”，“取代”。如：George has replaced Edward as captain of the team.(乔石治已接替爱德华担任队长。)
substitute: 则表示“用……代替”。如：We substitute nylon for cotton.(我们用尼龙代替了棉花。)
exchange: 指“互相交换”。


n. [通信]  [计] 交换；交流；交易所； [金融] 兑换
 - communication, conversion
vt. [通信]  [计] 交换；交易； [金融] 兑换
 - turn, truck
vi. [通信]  [计] 交换；交易； [金融] 兑换
 - trade, traffic
examples: v.交换；兑换n.交换；交易所；兑换；交战

(1) May I exchange seats with you?(2) You can exchange your car at our nearest office.(3) We exchanged our opinions about the event at the meeting.(4) I'd like to exchange some pounds for dollars.(5) He gave me an apple in exchange of an orange.(6) It seems the exchange rate fluctuates almost daily.(7) A soldier was wounded in the exchange.
(1) 我和你调一个座位好吗?(2) 你可以到我们附近的公司换车。(3) 在会上，我们就此事交换了意见。(4) 我想把一些英镑兑换成美金。(5) 他给我一个苹果，交换一个橙子。(6) 外汇兑换率似乎每天都在上下波动。(7) 一名士兵在交火中受伤。

translation:
vt. & vi. 呼喊; 惊叫; 大声说

时态：exclaimed, exclaiming, exclaims
分布：呼喊(70%)，大叫(15%)，大声说出(15%)


→ex-, 向外。-cl, 呼叫，叫喊，词源同call, claim.
叫喊;大声说[claim,clam=cyrout,shout,表示"呼喊,叫喊"]
v.呼喊,惊叫,大声说The children exclaimed with excitement.孩子们兴奋地大叫.
【记】ex出，claim喊－喊出



verb intransitive  ADVANCED  ■to say or shout something suddenly because of surprise, fear, pleasure, etc （因吃惊、害怕、喜悦等）呼喊，惊叫
•[+ speech] "You can't leave now!" she exclaimed.“你现在不能离开！”她大声说。

•"Rubbish!" he exclaimed in disgust.“废话！”他充满厌恶地大声说。

•She exclaimed in delight upon hearing the news.她听到这个消息高兴得大叫。





call, scream, yell, roar, shriek, exclaim, shout, cry

这组词都有“喊”的意思，其区别是：
call: 指大声说话或喊叫，以引起某人的注意。
scream: 指因恐具、快乐或痛苦而发出的尖叫声。
yell: 多指求援、鼓励时的呼叫。也可指因外界因素刺激而发出尖厉声音。
roar: 指发出大而深沉的声音、吼叫或咆哮。
shriek: 指因惊恐、痛苦等或其它感情而发出比scream更为尖锐、刺耳的叫声。
exclaim: 多指因高兴、愤怒、痛苦、惊讶等突发感情而高声喊叫。
shout: 指有意识地高声喊叫，常用于提出警告、发命令或唤起注意等。
cry: 一般指因恐惧、痛苦、惊奇等而喊叫。


vi. 呼喊，惊叫；大声叫嚷
 - bay, shout
examples: (1) The children exclaimed with excitement.(2) "How beautiful the lake is!" we exclaimed.(3) She exclaimed at the beautiful view.(4) She exclaimed that she was innocent.(5) The newspapers exclaimed against the government's action.(6) He exclaimed that it was untrue.
(1) 孩子们兴奋地大叫。(2) 我们叫喊着说,"这个湖多美啊!"(3) 她对这美丽的景色感到惊奇。(4) 她大声呼喊她是无辜的。(5) 报纸指责政府的行动。(6) 他大声说那不是事实。

translation:
vt. 排除，不包括; 排斥; 驱除，赶出

时态：excluded, excluding, excludes
分布：排除(98%)，阻止(1%)，拒绝接受(1%)


→ex-, 向外。-clud, 关闭，词源同close, conclude.
排外(ex+clude关闭→关出去→排外)[ex-①表示"出,出去"②表示"前面的,前任的"]
排除;隔绝(ex出+clude→关出去→排除)[clos,clud,clus=close,表示"关闭"]
v.拒绝,把...排除在外,排斥They excluded people under 18 from joining the club.他们拒绝接纳十八岁以下的人加入俱乐部.
【记】ex出，clude关闭－关出去－排斥【参】occlude（v 使闭塞；堵塞）；preclude（n 预防；排除）；exclusion（n 拒绝；排斥）；exclusive（adj 排外的；唯我独尊的）



verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to prevent someone or something from entering a place or taking part in an activity 阻止…进入；把…排斥在外
•Women are still excluded from the club.这间俱乐部仍然不让女性进入。

•Microbes must, as far as possible, be excluded from the room during an operation.在手术过程中，要尽可能防止细菌进入手术室。

•Tom has been excluded from school (= he is not allowed to go to school) for bad behaviour.汤姆因为行为不正被学校开除了。
 Compare include  to intentionally not include something （有意地）不包括
•The price excludes local taxes.这个价格不包括地方税。
 Compare include  to decide that something is not true or possible 排除…；不考虑…；认为…不可能
•We can't exclude the possibility that he is dead.我们不能排除他已经死亡的可能性。





extinguish, dispose, erase, exclude, cancel, eliminate, abolish

这组词都有“取消，除掉”的意思，其区别是：
extinguish: v.熄灭，扑灭(火)；使沉默，使暗淡。
 • Firefighters extinguished a big fire.   消防队员扑灭了大火。
dispose: v.处理，处置；表示“除掉、扔掉”时常与of连用。(这一点需要注意。)
 • After your picnic, please dispose of the litter.   野餐后请清除掉垃圾。
erase: v.除去，擦掉，指有意识地除去字迹、声音等。
 • I erased the music on the tape before recording on the tape again.   我在往磁带上录音之前先消掉了上面的音乐。
exclude: v.排斥；排除，不包括在内，与include互为反义词。
 • The restaurant excludes anyone who is not properly dressed from entering.   衣冠不整者不得进入该餐馆。
cancel: v.对预先安排的某种活动(如旅行、计划、会议等)的取消；删去(字、句)。
 • The meeting has been cancelled because of the flu.   会议由于流感而取消了。
eliminate: v.指消除、淘汰已经存在但是现在不需要的东西。
 • The losing team was eliminated from further competition.   失利的那个队被淘汰了，不能参加下一阶段的比赛。
 • The doctor helped him eliminate toxins from the intestine.   医生帮助他排出肠中毒素。
abolish: v.指对法律、习俗、制度的废除；完全破坏。
 • The government abolished the tax on alcohol.   政府取消了酒税。


vt. 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出
 - preclude, rule out
examples: (1) At this stage we cannot entirely exclude the possibility of staff cuts.(2) I mean the last thing we would think about is to exclude the children from this plan.(3) Thick curtains help to exclude street noises.(4) The court excluded the improperly obtained evidence.
(1) 在目前这个阶段,我们还不能完全排除裁员的可能性。(2) 我的意思是,我们绝不会考虑把孩子们排除在这个计划之外的。(3) 厚窗帘有助于隔绝街上的噪音。(4) 法院不接受非正常渠道获得的证据

translation:
adv. 唯一地; 专门地，特定地; 专有地; 排外地

分布：专门地(37%)，仅仅(18%)，独占地(18%)，排他地(18%)，只(9%)


adverb ■only 仅仅；专门；单独
•This offer is available exclusively to our established customers.只有本店的老客户才能享受这个优惠价。

•an exclusively female audience只限女性观众




adv. 唯一地；专有地；排外地
 - solely
examples: adv.专门地；排他地；独占地；仅仅；只

(1) He writes exclusively for China Daily.(2) This room is exclusively for women.(3) I'd like you to focus on this project exclusively.(4) Most of this merchandise is sold exclusively here.(5) By definition an exclusively difunctional monomer can only give rise to a linear polymer.(6) The monthly cost of these items alone amounts to more than ten thousand silver dollars,which is obtained exclusively through expropriation of the local tyrants.(7) This fitness center is exclusively for women.
(1) 他专给《中国日报》写稿。(2) 这个房间是供妇女专用的。(3) 我希望你能把精力全放在这个项目上。(4) 这里的大部分商品都是独家发售的。(5) 按照定义，一个特定的双官能单体，仅仅能得到线型聚合物。(6) 仅仅发油盐柴菜钱，每月也需现洋万元以上，全靠打土豪供给。(7) 这家健身中心只为女性服务。

translation:
n. （尤指集体）远足; 短途旅行，游览; 离题; [机]冲程

分布：远足(63%)，短途旅行(37%)


→ex-, 向外。-cur, 跑，词源同course, current.
远足;游览(excurse+ion)[cur(r),curs,cours=run,表示"跑,发生"]
n.短途旅行,游览;离题;[物理]偏移,漂移We went on an excursion to the city.我们到这个城市去旅行.
【记】ex出，curs跑－跑出去－短途旅游【参】incursion（n 袭击；侵入）；cursive（n /v 草书的）



US [-'skɝ:-] noun countable ■a short journey usually made for pleasure, often by a group of people （常指结伴同行的）远足，短程旅行
•This year's annual excursion will be to Lincoln.今年的年度短途旅行的目的地是林肯。

•Next week we're going on an excursion.下星期我们要去远足。
excursion into sth ■a short involvement in a new activity （短暂）涉猎；（短期）涉足
•A teacher by profession, this is her first excursion into writing.她的职业是教师，这是她首次跨足文学创作。





expedition, voyage, journey, trip, travel, excursion, tour, cruise

这组词都有“旅行”的意思，其区别是：
expedition: 指有特定目的远征或探险。
voyage: 指在水上旅行，尤指海上旅行，也可指空中旅行。
journey: 最普通用词，侧重指时间较长、距离较远的单程陆上旅行，也指水上或空中的旅行。
trip: 普通用词，口语多用，常指为公务或游玩作的较短暂的旅行。
travel: 泛指旅行的行为而不指某次具体的旅行，多指到远方作长期旅行，不强调直接目的地，单、复数均可用。
excursion: 较正式用词，常指不超过一天的短时期娱乐性游玩，也可指乘火车或轮船往返特定景点的远足旅游。
tour: 指最后反回出发地，旅途中有停留游览点，距离可长可短，目的各异的周游或巡行。
cruise: 主要指乘船的游览并在多处停靠。


n. 偏移；远足；短程旅行；离题；游览圆
 - skewing, short trip
examples: n.远足；短途旅行；【物】偏移，漂移，偏离；偏差，偏振

(1) The excursion was the high spot of our holiday.(2) We are planning an excursion to the blue mountain.(3) I was roped in for this excursion before I knew it.(4) We shall make an excursion to Hangzhou this weekend.(5) The whole excursion took ten hours.(6) The hiking excursion might be a bit dangerous.
(1) 我们那个假日的最大乐趣是远足。(2) 我们正在计划去蓝山远足。(3) 我不知不觉被拉来参加了这次远足旅行。(4) 这个周末我们将去杭州旅行。(5) 整个短途旅游花了十个小时。(6) 徒步旅行可能会有点儿危险。

translation:
vt. 原谅; 为…申辩; 免除，宽免; 给…免去
n. 借口，托辞; 道歉，歉意; 辩解; 请假条
vi. 作为借口; 请示宽恕; 表示宽恕

时态：excused, excusing, excuses
分布：借口(46%)，原谅(27%)，理由(18%)，辩解(9%)


→ex-, 向外。-cus,原因，词源同causal, because.
v.原谅,宽恕,免除n.借口,辩解He had an amusing excuse for executing the executive.对于处决决策人,他有一个可笑的理由.



verb transitive /ɪkˈskjuːz/ IMPROVER  ■to forgive someone 原谅；宽恕
•Please excuse me for arriving late - the bus was delayed.我来迟了，请原谅——因为公车延误了。

•Nothing can excuse that sort of behaviour.无论如何那种行为都是不可原谅的。

•No amount of financial recompense can excuse the way in which the company carried out its policy.这间公司竟如此执行制度，这种行为无论赔多少钱都不能宽恕。

•We cannot excuse him for these crimes.我们无法原谅他犯下的这些罪行。

•I asked the teacher if I could be excused from (= allowed not to do) football practice as my knee still hurt.我的膝盖仍然很痛，因此我向老师请假希望可以不参加足球训练。

•Please excuse me from (= allow me to miss) the rest of the meeting - I've just received a telephone call which requires my immediate attention.请原谅我不能继续出席会议——我刚接到电话，有急事要立即处理。
Excuse me  ESSENTIAL  ■a polite way of attracting the attention, especially of someone you do not know （用于礼貌地引起他人、尤其是陌生人的注意）劳驾，打扰，请原谅
•Excuse me, does this bus go to Oxford Street?打扰一下，请问这辆公车会去牛津大街吗？
 ESSENTIAL  ■used to politely ask someone to move so that you can walk past them （用于礼貌地请求别人让路）借过，劳驾，对不起
•Excuse me, can I just get past?不好意思，请让我过一下。
 ESSENTIAL  ■used to tell someone politely that you are leaving （用于礼貌地辞别）抱歉，失陪
•Excuse me a moment, I'll be with you shortly.抱歉，失陪一会儿，我马上回来。
 ESSENTIAL  ■used to say sorry for something you have done by accident （用于无意做了某事后致歉）对不起
•Did I take your seat? Do excuse me.我坐了你的座位吗？太对不起了。
 IMPROVER  ■said before disagreeing with someone （用于表示异议）请原谅，对不起
•Excuse me but aren't you forgetting something?请原谅，但你是不是忘记了些甚么？
 IMPROVER  US (UK Pardon?) (I beg your pardon?) ■used to politely ask someone to repeat something they have said because you have not heard it （用于没听清楚某事礼貌地请别人重复）对不起，请再说一遍
noun countable /ɪkˈskjuːs/ ESSENTIAL  ■a reason that you give to explain why you did something wrong （辩解的）理由，借口
•He'd better have a good excuse for being late.他迟到最好有正当的理由。

•I've never known him to miss a meeting - I'm sure he'll have an excuse.据我所知，他从来没有缺席过会议——我敢肯定他不来是有原因的。

•There's no excuse for that sort of behaviour.根本没有借口为那种行为开脱。
 IMPROVER  ■a false reason that you give to explain why you do something （虚假的）理由，借口，托词
•[+ to infinitive] She was just looking for an excuse to call him.她只是找个借口打电话给他。

•Any excuse for a holiday!只要可以去渡假，任何借口都不成问题！
make your excuses ■to explain why you cannot be present somewhere 因为不能到场表示歉意
•Please make my excuses at the meeting on Friday.我不能参加星期五的会议了，请代我致歉。
make excuses  IMPROVER  ■to give false reasons why you cannot do something 找借口；编理由
•You're always making excuses for not helping me.你总是找各种借口不来帮我。

noun countable /ɪkˈskjuːs/a miserable/poor, etc. excuse for sth ■a very bad example of something …的拙劣样本；蹩脚的…，极糟糕的…东西
•It was a miserable excuse for a meal.这顿饭真是太难吃了。





pardon, overlook, forgive, excuse

这组词都有“原谅”的意思，其区别是：
pardon: 比excuse正式，指原谅或宽恕严重的过失或法律上的犯罪行为；在社会交场合则指对打搅他人表示歉意。
overlook: 语气较弱，指宽容或不计较无关大局的过失。
forgive: 侧重从心里宽恕某人，暗示放弃一切愤恨和要求报偿的权利。
excuse: 口语常用词，语气较轻。指原谅轻微的过错、疏忽或过失。



cause, reason, excuse

这组词都有“原因”的意思，其区别是：
cause: 指直接导致事情发生的原因，与所发生的事个有因果关系。
reason: 强调指从逻辑推理上得出的结论性原因，不是直接说明起因。
excuse: 指为自己辩解，希望得到谅解时所提出的种种理由，是借口性的理由。


n. 借口；理由
 - reason, sake, account, blind, occasion
vt. 原谅；为…申辩；给…免去
 - forgive, pardon for
vi. 作为借口；请求宽恕；表示宽恕
 - beg for mercy
examples: vt.原谅；辩解n.理由；辩解；借口

(1) Excuse me, but I must say you are completely wrong.(2) I hope you will excuse me if I have to leave early.(3) He told a real whopper to excuse his lateness.(4) His excuse for being late was that he had missed the train.(5) Such conduct allows of no excuse.(6) My lame excuse is that I have too much to do.(7) I won't let him get away with that excuse.
(1) 对不起，但是我必须说你完全错了。(2) 如果我必须早些离开,希望你能原谅我。(3) 他撒了个大谎为自己的迟到辩解。(4) 他迟到的理由是没有赶上火车。(5) 这样的行为是不容辩解的。(6) 我那站不住脚的借口就是我要干的事太多了。(7) 我不会让他用那种借口蒙混过去。

translation:
vt. 执行; 处死，处决; 履行; 完成

时态：executed, executing, executes
分布：执行(93%)，完成(3%)，处决(2%)，实行(2%)


→ex-, 向外。-sec, 跟随，相接，词源同sequence, prosecute. 即一步接一步的执行。
v.实行;实施;执行;完成;履行;处死He had an amusing excuse for executing the executive.对于处决决策人,他有一个可笑的理由.
【参】execution（n 执行；死刑）；executioner（n 刽子手）；executive（adj 实行的；n 经理）



verb transitive KILL  杀死   ADVANCED  ■to kill someone as a legal punishment （依法）处决，处死
•He was executed for murder.他因犯谋杀罪被处死。

['ek.sɪ.kju:t] verb transitive DO  做  formal ■to do or perform something, especially in a planned way （尤指有计划地）实施，履行，表演
•to execute a deal/plan进行交易／实施计划

•The whole play was executed with great precision.这出戏由头到尾都表演得丝丝入扣，有板有眼。
execute a will legal ■If you execute someone's will, you deal with their money, property, etc., according to the instructions in it. 执行遗嘱




massacre, execute, murder, slaughter, assassinate, kill

这组词都有“杀，杀死”的意思，其区别是：
massacre: 语气比slaughter强。指大屠杀，尤指屠杀失去了自卫能力的人。
execute: 指依法处死罪犯。
murder: 指谋杀或凶杀。
slaughter: 本义指大批宰杀动物，也指像屠宰牲畜一样一次杀死许多人。
assassinate: 通常指因政治原因用非法手段杀害政治领袖人物或短名人士。
kill: 普通用词，含义广泛，泛指以任何方式使人、动物或植物死亡。



execute, conduct, do, perform, fulfil

这组词都有“做，执行，实施，完成”的意思，其区别是：
execute: 指需专门技术熟练技巧去完成某种复杂的任务或表演等，也指用行动把计划或打算付诸实施或执行某项命令。
conduct: 和perform一样比较正式，二者意义相近，但conduct含指导、领导或监督等意味。
do: 最普通常用词，指完成某项具体工作、任务，也指完成某种行为或动作。
perform: 指完成困难较大、较复杂的任务。较正式用词。
fulfil: 指履行和实现所许诺的、所期望或要求的事情，含最终完成的意味。


vt. 实行；执行；处死
 - perform, implement, enforce
examples: (1) Congress makes the laws; the President executes them.(2) We then execute the code that we want to test.(3) Now that we have made the decision, we may execute the scheme as previously agreed.(4) They executed the king.(5) We can execute big volume orders in 20 days.
(1) 国会制定法律，总统执行法律。(2) 接下来,我们执行我们要测试的代码。(3) 既然我们已经做了决定,我们就可以实行既定方案了。(4) 他们把国王处决了。(5) 我们可以在20天内完成大批量的订单。

translation:
n. 总经理; 行政部门; [计算机]执行指令
adj. 执行的; 管理的; 政府部门的

分布：行政部门(42%)，行政主管(20%)，行政的(20%)，经营的(10%)，决策者(4%)，决策的(4%)


n.总经理,董事,行政负责人a.执行的,实施的He had an amusing excuse for executing the executive.对于处决决策人,他有一个可笑的理由.



US [-jə.tˌɪv] noun countable  IMPROVER  (informal exec) ■someone in a high position, especially in business, who makes decisions and puts them into action （尤指商业机构中的）行政主管，经理
•She is now a senior executive, having worked her way up through the company.她现在是高级行政主管，这是她在公司中一步一脚印爬上来的。
the executive ■the part of a government that is responsible for making certain that laws and decisions are put into action （政府）行政部门■a group of people who run a business or an organization （公司或组织的）执行委员会，领导阶层
•The executive of the health workers' union accepted the proposed pay increase on behalf of their members.医疗工会执行委员会代表其会员接受了加薪的提议。

UK [ɪg'zek.jʊ.tɪv] US [-jə.tˌɪv] adjective [before noun] ■relating to making decisions and managing businesses, or suitable for people with important jobs in business 决策的，管理的；给重要的人使用的
•His executive skills will be very useful to the company.他的管理能力对公司将会非常有用。

•executive cars豪华汽车

•an executive suite贵宾套房




adj. [计] 行政的；经营的；执行的，经营管理的
 - administrative, front-office
n. 经理；执行委员会； [计] 执行者；经理主管人员
 - manager, gerente
examples: adj.行政的；决策的；经营的；[计算机]执行指令n.行政主管；行政部门；决策者
(1) The executive manager tossed out my application.(2) I was allowed to sit in on an executive meeting.(3) He is on the executive committee.(4) An executive should be experienced in administration.
(1) 行政经理拒绝了我的申请。(2) 我获准列席一次行政会议。(3) 他是该执行委员会委员。(4) 一个管理者应有行政管理的经验。

translation:
n. 练习; 运动，训练; 运用; 典礼
vi. 锻炼，训练，练习
vt. 锻炼（身体某部位）; 使焦虑，使忧虑; 实行，发挥（作用）; 运用

时态：exercised, exercising, exercises
分布：锻炼(43%)，运动(33%)，练习(16%)，运用(6%)，作业(2%)


→ex-, 向外。-erc, 保护，限制，隐藏，词源同ark, arcane. 即去除限制，进行练习。
n.练习,习题;训练,锻练v.训练,锻练;行使I highly appreciate the preceding man's precious precise exercise.我高度欣赏前面那个人可贵的精确演练.



US [-sɚ-] note_panel noun HEALTHY ACTIVITY  健身活动   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■physical activity that you do to make your body strong and healthy 体育活动；锻炼；运动
•Swimming is my favourite form of exercise.我最喜欢的运动是游泳。

•You really should take  more exercise.你真的应该多做运动。

•I do stomach exercises most days.我经常做锻炼腹肌的运动。

UK ['ek.sə.saɪz] US [-sɚ-] note_panel noun PRACTICE  练习   ESSENTIAL  countable ■an action or actions intended to improve something or make something happen 练习；训练；演习
•Ships from eight navies will be taking part in an exercise in the Pacific to improve their efficiency in combat.来自8个国家的海军军舰将参加在太平洋举行的军事演习，以提高其作战效率。

•It would be a useful exercise for you to say the speech aloud several times.大声朗读几次讲稿，将会有助你的发挥。

•an exercise in public relations公共关系课的情景模拟练习
 ESSENTIAL  countable ■a short piece of written work which you do to practise something you are learning 习题；练习
•The book has exercises at the end of every chapter.这本书每一章的后面都有练习题。

UK ['ek.sə.saɪz] US [-sɚ-] note_panel noun USE  使用  uncountable formal ■the use of something 行使；运用；使用
•The exercise of restraint may well be difficult.克制情绪可能是件很难的事。

UK ['ek.sə.saɪz] US [-sɚ-] note_panel noun CEREMONY  典礼  exercises [plural] US formal ■a ceremony which includes speeches and usually traditional music or activities 典礼；仪式
•graduation exercises毕业典礼

UK ['ek.sə.saɪz] US [-sɚ-] note_panel verb DO HEALTHY ACTIVITY  做健康的运动   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to do physical activities to make your body strong and healthy 锻炼；运动
•She exercises most evenings usually by running.她几乎每晚都做运动，通常是跑步。

•A work-out in the gym will exercise all the major muscle groups.健身房里做的运动能使所有主要肌肉都得到锻炼。
transitive ■If you exercise an animal, you make it walk or run so that it stays strong and healthy 遛（动物）
•Now he's retired he spends most afternoons exercising his dogs.他已经退休了，下午的时间大都用来遛狗。

UK ['ek.sə.saɪz] US [-sɚ-] note_panel verb USE  使用   ADVANCED  transitive formal ■to use something 行使；运用；使用
•I exercised my democratic right  by not voting in the election.在选举中，我透过不投票的方式来行使我的民主权利。

•Always exercise caution when handling radioactive substances.处理放射性物质时要随时小心谨慎。

•We've decided to exercise the option (= use the part of a legal agreement) to buy the house we now lease.我们已经决定行使合约所赋予的买卖选择权，买下我们现在租住的房屋。

UK ['ek.sə.saɪz] US [-sɚ-] note_panel verb exercise your mind formal ■to worry you 使担忧；使烦恼；使不安
•The whole situation is exercising our minds greatly.整个局势使我们大伤脑筋。





training, practice, exercise, drill, discipline

这组词都有“练习、训练、锻炼”的意思，其区别是：
training: 普通用词，泛指为从事某种职业而进行的身体或智力方面的训练。
practice: 指把所学的理论或知识用于实践以获得技艺与技巧。
exercise: 主要指为强壮体魄而进行的锻炼，也可指进行练习以保持已经获得的技巧。
drill: 侧重进行有系统的，严格和重复的练习。
discipline: 既可指训练又可指为达到某种熟练程度而进行的约束。



practice, exercises, exercise

practice: (反复做的)练习 Practice makes perfect.
exercises: 练习(可数),
exercise: 运动,锻炼(不可数),


n. 运动；练习；运用；操练；礼拜；典礼
 - movement, sport, ceremony, campaign, practice
vt. 锻炼；练习；使用；使忙碌；使惊恐
 - make use of, fashion, occupy, alarm, employ
vi. 运动；练习
 - motion, do sport
examples: n.运动；练习；作业vt.运用vi.锻炼

(1) Exercise is good for your heart and lungs.(2) I suggest you go on a diet and take more exercise.(3) Next I'd like you to do the exercises on page 10.(4) She does her piano exercises in the afternoon.(5) Should I hand in my exercise book tomorrow?(6) You should learn how to exercise self-control.(7) You can exercise your right as a citizen.(8) You should try to exercise patience.(9) You should exercise more so as to keep energetic.(10) He exercises in the morning every day.
(1) 对您的心脏和肺,运动也是有益的。(2) 我建议你节食,多做运动。(3) 下面我让你做第10页上的练习。(4) 她每天下午练习钢琴。(5) 我是否该明天交作业？(6) 你要学会运用自制力。(7) 你能行使公民权利。(8) 你应当努力运用忍耐力。(9) 你应当多锻炼以保持精力充沛。(10) 他每天早晨锻炼。

translation:
vt. 发挥; 运用; 使受（影响等）; 用（力）

时态：exerted, exerting, exerts
分布：施加(76%)，运用(24%)


→ex-, 向外。-sert, 连接，词源同series, insert. 即断开，推出，词义进一步扩大为行使，竭力。
v.尽(力),施加(压力等),努力He exerted himself to win the game.他竭力想在游戏中获胜.
【记】ex出，ert加入－加入到活动中出力【参】inert（adj 惰性的；迟钝的）；exertion（n 尽力；发挥；运用）



US [-'zɝ:t] verb USE  使用  transitive ■to use something such as authority, power, influence, etc. in order to make something happen 运用；行使（权威、权力等）；施加（影响等）
•If you were to exert your influence they might change their decision.如果你可以施加你的影响，他们或者会改变决定。

•Some managers exert considerable pressure on their staff to work extra hours without being paid.一些老板向员工施加巨大的压力迫使他们无薪加班。

UK [ɪg'zɜ:t] US [-'zɝ:t] verb MAKE AN EFFORT  努力  exert yourself [R] ■to make a mental or physical effort 用力；尽力；努力
•I was too tired to exert myself.我太累了，心有余而力不足。




vt. 运用，发挥；施以影响
 - handle, to put to use
examples: (1) He exerted all his influence to make them accept his plan.(2) He doesn't have to exert himself on my behalf.(3) You have to exert more efforts if you want to catch up with your classmates.(4) His teachings still exert a strong influence.
(1) 他用尽一切影响力使他们接受他的计划。(2) 他不必为我费那么大力气。(3) 你要想赶上你的同学的话,就得多花些功夫。(4) 他的教导仍在产生巨大影响。

translation:
vt. 用尽，耗尽; 使精疲力尽; 排出; 彻底探讨
vi. 排气
n. （排出的）废气; 排出; 排气装置

时态：exhausted, exhausting, exhausts
分布：废气(62%)，耗尽(22%)，排气装置(10%)，使筋疲力尽(4%)，详尽论述(2%)


→ex-, 向外。-haust, 排出。
用尽;抽干(ex出+haust→抽干→抽出)[haust=drawwater,表示"抽水"]
v.使筋疲力尽,耗尽;抽完n.排气装置;废气The exhausted man and the trustful guy thrust a knife into the rusty crust.精疲力竭的男子和深信不疑的家伙将一把刀子刺向生锈的外壳.
【记】ex出，haust拉－拉出－耗尽【参】exhaustion（n 耗尽；筋疲力尽；详尽无遗的论述）



US [-'zɑ:st] verb transitive TIRE  疲倦   ADVANCED  ■to make someone extremely tired 使筋疲力竭；使疲惫不堪
•The long journey exhausted the children.长途旅行后，孩子们疲惫不堪。

•I've exhausted myself with all that cleaning.打扫完，我累得筋疲力尽。

UK [ɪg'zɔ:st] US [-'zɑ:st] verb transitive USE  用  ■to use something completely 用完；花光；耗尽
•How long will it be before the world's fuel supplies are exhausted?再过多长时间地球上的燃料就耗尽了？

•I'm afraid he's exhausted my patience.恐怕我对他已经失去耐性了。

•We seem to have exhausted this topic of conversation (= we have nothing new to say about it).这个话题我们好像已经没有甚么好谈的了。

UK [ɪg'zɔ:st] US [-'zɑ:st] noun uncountable ■the waste gas from an engine, especially a car's, or the pipe the gas flows through （引擎排出的）废气；（尤指汽车的）尾气；排气管
•Car exhaust is the main reason for the city's pollution.汽车排出的废气是造成城市污染的主要原因。




vt. 排出；耗尽；使精疲力尽；彻底探讨
 - issue, drain out
vi. 排气
 - air out
n. 排气；废气；排气装置
 - air discharge, flue gas
examples: v.使筋疲力尽；耗尽；详尽论述n.排气装置；废气

(1) Caring for young children can exhaust you physically and mentally.(2) The expedition was forced to turn back when it exhausted its food supply.(3) He failed to exhaust this subject.(4) The car needs a new exhaust.
(1) 照顾小孩子会使你身心疲惫。(2) 没有了食物,这个探险队不得不返航。(3) 他没能对这个题作详尽无遗的论述。(4) 这辆车需要换一个新的排气管。

translation:
vt. 陈列，展览; 呈现; 证明; [法]提交证据
vi. 公开展览某物; 展出
n. 展览，陈列; 展览品; 公开展示; [法]证据

时态：exhibited, exhibiting, exhibits
分布：展览(48%)，展示(19%)，表现(19%)，展品(9%)，陈列(5%)


→ex-, 向外。-hibit, 持，握，词源同habit, prohibit. 即把握住的展开，展览。
展览;显示(ex出+hibit→拿来→展览)[hibit=hold,表示"拿住"]
v.展出,陈列n.展览品,陈列品I feel a bit of bitterness for his ambitious exhibition.我为他雄心勃勃的展览感到一点点触痛.
【记】ex出，hibit坚持－坚持拿出来－展览



verb intransitive or transitive  ADVANCED  ■to show something publicly 展出，展览；展示
•He frequently exhibits at the art gallery.他经常在艺廊展出作品。

•In the summer the academy will exhibit several prints which are rarely seen.该学会将于今年夏天对外展出几幅罕见的版画作品。

•He exhibited great self-control considering her rudeness.她那么无礼，他表现得如此克制已经很好了。

[ɪg'zɪb.ɪt] noun countable ■an object such as a painting that is shown to the public 展品；展出物；陈列品
•The museum has a fascinating collection of exhibits ranging from Iron Age pottery to Inuit clothing.这个博物馆收藏的展品，从铁器时代的陶器，到因努伊特人的衣物，丰富多彩，令人称奇。
■legal ■a thing used as evidence (= proof that something is true) in a trial （法庭上出示的）证据，物证
•Is exhibit C the weapon which you say was used?物证C是不是你说的所使用的武器？





exposition, display, show, exhibition, fair, exhibit

这组词都有“展览”的意思，其区别是：
exposition: 多指大型博览会或国际博览会。
display: 指展销会，商店橱窗或柜台上的陈列品。
show: 指艺术品、农产品、工业品或商品等的任何形式的公开展览。
exhibition: 一般指较正规的展览会。
fair: 侧重指为促销商品而举办的展览会或商品交易会。
exhibit: 多指个人或团体陈列的展览品，规模可大可小。



demonstrate, manifest, display, show, exhibit

这组词都有“显示、显露、展现”的意思，其区别是：
demonstrate: 指明显地表露感情。也指用实例、实验推理等手段表演证明，或论证某一问题。
manifest: 书面正式用词，指明确地表明。
display: 多指将某物陈列在显眼之处以便让发现其优点，侧重有意识地显示。
show: 最普通用词，泛指任何有意或无意地把东西给别人看的行为。
exhibit: 指公开或正式地展示，以便引人注目或让人检查。


vt. 展览；显示；提出（证据等）
 - introduce, reveal, prove, make clear, prefer
n. [贸易] 展览品；证据；展示会
 - proof, witness
examples: v.展览；陈列；展示；表现n.展品；展览

(1) Many unearthed cultural relics were exhibited at the museum.(2) He was given a whole room to exhibit his paintings.(3) She exhibited great powers of endurance during the climb.(4) They deprecated the new exhibit.(5) The exhibit will be open through February, 2004.
(1) 博物馆展出了许多出土文物。(2) 整个房间用来展览他的画作。(3) 她在攀登过程中表现出极大的耐力。(4) 他们很不赞成新展品。(5) 展览将一直开放到2004年2月。

translation:
n. 陈列，展览; 展览品，陈列品; 表明; [法]（证据等的）提出

分布：展览(93%)，展示(7%)


展览,表演(exhibit+ion)[hibit=hold,表示"拿住"]
n.展览会;陈列,展览I feel a bit of bitterness for his ambitious exhibition.我为他雄心勃勃的展览感到一点点触痛.



noun countable or uncountable  IMPROVER  ■when objects such as paintings are shown to the public, or when someone shows a particular skill or quality to the public 展览（会）；表现，显示
•The photographs will be on exhibition until the end of the month.这些照片将一直展出到月底。

•There's a new exhibition of sculpture on at the city gallery.市立美术馆正在举行一场新的雕塑作品展。

•The athlete's third, and winning, jump was an exhibition of skill and strength.这个运动员的第三次试跳，也是获胜的那一跳，充分展示了他的技巧和体能。

[ˌek.sɪ'bɪʃ.ən] noun countable or uncountable make an exhibition of yourself disapproving ■to do something stupid in public 出洋相；出丑
•I hope I didn't make an exhibition of myself last night.我希望我昨晚没有出丑。





exhibition, demonstration

exhibition: 展示，展览
demonstration: 示范，证实



exposition, display, show, exhibition, fair, exhibit

这组词都有“展览”的意思，其区别是：
exposition: 多指大型博览会或国际博览会。
display: 指展销会，商店橱窗或柜台上的陈列品。
show: 指艺术品、农产品、工业品或商品等的任何形式的公开展览。
exhibition: 一般指较正规的展览会。
fair: 侧重指为促销商品而举办的展览会或商品交易会。
exhibit: 多指个人或团体陈列的展览品，规模可大可小。


n. 展览，显示；展览会；展览品
 - expo, display, show, fair, manifestation
examples: (1) There will be an exhibition of the development of automobile industry in our country next week.(2) They came from afar to see the exhibition.(3) Such an exhibition of rudeness is absolutely unacceptable.
(1) 下星期将举办一个关于我国汽车工业发展的展览。(2) 他们从远处赶来参观这个展览会。(3) 这样无礼的表现是绝对不能接受的。

translation:
vi. 存在; 生存; 生活; 继续存在

时态：existed, existing, exists
分布：存在(91%)，生存(8%)，活着(1%)


→ex-, 向外。-sist, 站，立足，词源同extant, assist. 即站出来的，存在的。
存在,生存(ex+sist→站出来→活下来→存在)[sist=stand表示"站立"]
v.存在;生存;生活In the faithful waiter's waist exists a list of the ten listeners.在忠实的侍者的腰里存有那十位听众的名单.



verb intransitive BE  存在   ESSENTIAL  ■to be, or to be real 存在；实际上有
•I don't think ghosts exist.我认为鬼是不存在的。

•Poverty still exists in this country.这个国家仍存在贫困现象。

[ɪg'zɪst] verb intransitive LIVE  生存  ■to live, or to live in difficult conditions 生存，生活；（艰难）存活
•Some species exist in this small area of forest and nowhere else on Earth.一些物种仅存于这一小片森林中，地球上其他地方都没有。

•Few people can exist without water for more than a week.很少有人能在断水的情况下生存超过一星期。

•No-one can be expected to exist on such a low salary.无法想像有甚么人能靠这么低的工资维持生计。





exist, live, be

这组词都有“存在”的意思，其区别是：
exist: 通常指可观察到的或众所周知的存在现象。
live: 多指有生命的东西的存在。指无生命事物时，强调可联想起生命的那些特点。
be: 指某时某地确存在的事物或现象，多与there连用。


vi. 存在；生存；生活；继续存在
 - occur, live, harbor
examples: (1) Most scientists believe that water doesn't exist on the surface of the moon.(2) That department has ceased to exist.(3) The old lady exists only on rice coffee and bread.
(1) 多数科学家认为,月球表面不存在水。(2) 那部门已不复存在。(3) 老太太仅靠咖啡面包生活。

translation:
n. 存在，实在; 生活，生活方式; 实体，存在物

分布：存在(84%)，生存(16%)


→来自exist, 存在。
存在,生存(exist+ence)[sist=stand表示"站立"]
n.存在,实在;生存,生活(方式)The elephant is the largest land animal in existence.大象是现有的最大的陆上动物.



noun  IMPROVER  uncountable ■when something or someone exists 存在；实有
•Many people question the existence of God.很多人怀疑上帝是否真的存在。

•Modern cosmology believes the Universe to have come into existence about fifteen billion years ago.现代宇宙论认为，宇宙大约在150亿年前就已经形成了。

•The theatre company that they started is still in existence today.他们创办的剧团直到今日仍在演出。
countable usually singular ■a particular way of life 生活；生活方式
•She has a miserable existence living with him.和他生活在一起，她的日子苦不堪言。





life, creature, maintenance, survival, existence

life: 生命，生活
creature: 生物，动物，人
maintenance: 保持，保养，维修，一般不指人；
survival: 在困难中的生存、幸存；
existence: 艰难或无聊的生活方式


n. [计] 存在，实在；生存，生活；存在物，实在物
 - presence, being, entity, life, is
examples: (1) The newspaper ceased to appear after an existence of three months.(2) According to some philosopher, everything in existence is reasonable.(3) The family lived a precarious existence.(4) Pollution poses a threat to the continued existence of this species.
(1) 该报发行3 个月后停刊了。(2) 某位哲学家认为，存在的事物都是合理的。(3) 这家人过着朝不保夕的生活。(4) 污染对这一物种的继续生存造成了威胁。

translation:
n. 出口，通道; 退场; 退去，退出; 死亡
vi. 离开; 退出; 退场; 去世

时态：exited, exiting, exits
分布：退出(53%)，出口(37%)，退场(7%)，离去(3%)


→ex-, 向外。-it, 走，词源同ion, itinerary.
出口,出去(ex出+it→走出,出口)[it=go,表示"行走"]
n.出口,通道Where is the exit?哪儿是出口?



noun countable DOOR  门   ESSENTIAL  ■the door through which you might leave a building or large vehicle, or the act of leaving especially a theatre stage （建筑物或大型交通工具的）出口，安全门；（尤指演员）退场
•a fire exit (= a door you can escape through if there is a fire)消防出口

•an emergency exit紧急出口

•He saw Emma arrive and made a quick exit.他见到艾玛匆匆而来又匆匆离去。

•She made her exit from the stage to rapturous applause.在观众热烈的掌声中，她退场走下舞台。
 Compare entrance
['ek.sɪt] ['eg.zɪt] noun countable ROAD  道路  ■a smaller road used to leave a main road （驶出主干道的）出口，出路
•Come off the motorway at the Duxford exit.从达克斯福德出口驶出高速公路。

['ek.sɪt] ['eg.zɪt] verb intransitive or transitive LEAVE  离开  ■to leave a building or large vehicle 离开（建筑物或大型交通工具）
•I exited quickly before anyone could see me.趁没人看到，我赶快离开了。

•Please exit the theatre by the side doors.请从侧门离开剧场。

['ek.sɪt] ['eg.zɪt] verb intransitive or transitive COMPUTER  电脑  ■to end a computer program that you are using 退出，终止（一个电脑程式）
•You have to exit the program before starting another.你必须退出这个程式，才能打开另一个。




n. 出口，通道；退场
 - door, channel, route, way out
vi. [计] 退出；离去
 - to quit, back out
examples: (1) At the roundabout, take the third exit.(2) I was eventually granted an exit visa.(3) He made a quick exit to avoid meeting her.(4) When he stands to exit, he turns and sees Michael for the first time.(5) At the end of the third scene the actress exits.(6) If I fail, I will exit the company.
(1) 在环状交叉路口，从第三条出路驶出。(2) 我终于获得了出境签证。(3) 他迅速离去以避免见到她。(4) 当传教结束后，林肯起身离去时，他第一眼就看见了迈克尔。(5) 该女演员于第三场结束时退场。(6) 如果失败，我将退出该公司。

translation:
vt. 使…变大; 扩张; 详述
vi. 扩展; 发展; 张开; 展开

时态：expanded, expanding, expands
分布：扩张(49%)，增加(23%)，详述(15%)，张开(11%)，使 ... 膨胀(2%)


→ex-, 向外。-pand, 展开，词源同pace, feather.
v.(使)膨胀,(使)扩张;张开,展开The landlord's land on the highland of the mainland expanded a lot.地主在大陆高原上的土地扩张了很多.
【记】ex出，pand展开－展开出去－扩大【参】expansion（n 扩张；膨胀）；expanse（n 膨胀；宽广空间）



verb intransitive or transitive  IMPROVER  ■to increase in size, number or importance, or to make something increase in this way （使）（尺寸、数量或重要性）扩大，增加；（使）膨胀
•The air in the balloon expands when heated.气球里的空气受热后膨胀。

•They expanded their retail operations during the 1980s.20世纪80年代他们扩大了零售业务。

[ɪk'spænd] verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   expand on sth ■to give more details about something you have said or written 对…详述；进一步说明
•She mentioned a few ideas, but she didn't expand on them.她提到了几个想法，但并没有进行详细说明。





enlarge, magnify, increase, expand, multiply, augment, amplify

这组词都有“增加，增大”的意思，其区别是：
enlarge: 主要指面积或体积等的扩大。
magnify: 可指用光学仪器使物体看上去显得变大；也指事实上把某物增大，有时用于夸张意味。
increase: 指数量、强度和大小等方面的扩大或增加。
expand: 指范围、程度、体积和尺寸等方面的扩大或增加。
multiply: 通常指自然繁殖而产生的增长，有时也指同类事物数量的成倍增加。
augment: 较正式用词，一般指在原有的基础上增加含量而扩大。
amplify: 在科技中常指声音的扩大或电磁波的增强。也指补充了细节、详述或扩大内容等。此词系正式用语。



raise, extend, increase, expand, inflate, add

raise: 提高
extend: (程度、长度)
increase: 增加
expand: （尺码，数量，稳定性）扩大，增加，提高
inflate: 膨胀，鼓气，涨价
add: 增加，添加



enlarge, stretch, expand, reinforce, magnify, amplify

enlarge: v.扩大，多指具体物品如相片的放大。
 • enlarge photograph   放大照片enlarge a house扩建房屋
stretch: v. (有弹性地)伸展，延伸，并有可能超过限度；伸长、伸出(身体某部位)并绷紧肌肉(尤指在放松后或为了够着某物)。
 • The pullover stretched after I had worn it a few times.   这件套头毛衣我穿了几次之后就撑大了。
 • Having finished their morning work, the clerks stood up behind their desks, stretching themselves.   完成了早间工作之后，职员们站到桌子后面伸伸懒腰。
expand: v.指范围、体积的扩大、增大，也可以指内容或细节的充实。
 • The balloon expanded, then exploded.   气球先是膨胀，然后就爆破了。
reinforce: v.增援，加固。
magnify: v.放大，指用透镜或显微镜使物体看上去大一些。
 • His eyeglasses magnify words so he can read them.   他借助眼睛把字放大以便能够阅读。
amplify: v.扩大，增加，尤其指通过增强电压或电流使声音扩大；补充叙述(故事、事件等)。
 • We must ask you to amplify your statement.   我们得请你对你的说法作进一步的说明。



enlarge, extend, stretch, prolong, inflate, expand, increase, multiply, lengthen, add, augment, amplify

enlarge: 放大（照片）
extend: 使…（在空间或时间上）更大，更长；伸长，伸展，延展；舒展（肢体），extend sth
stretch: vt 拉长，撑大；绵延，延续
prolong: 人为的延长时间
inflate: 使（轮胎、气球等）充气，膨胀，inflate sth (with sth)
expand: 使…变大，扩大，扩展，expand sth into sth
increase: 增加，增大（数目、数量、体积等），increase sth from…to…
multiply: 成倍的增加
lengthen: 指自然的延长时间或空间
add: 加，添加，add sth to sth
augment: vt 增多，增大，augment sth
amplify: 特指音量，电流等的扩大


vt. 扩张；使膨胀；详述
 - dwell on, enlarge on
vi. 发展；张开，展开
 - grow, go way
examples: v.使 ... 膨胀；详述；扩张；增加；张开

(1) Metals expand when they are heated.(2) Would you expand upon the matter a little further?(3) They conferred on the best way to expand business.(4) Our foreign trade has expanded during recent years.(5) The petals of many flowers expand in the sunshine.
(1) 金属遇热则膨胀。(2) 请你再进一步谈谈这件事好吗?(3) 他们商议扩展业务的最好方法。(4) 近年来我们的对外贸易有所增加。(5) 许多花的花瓣在阳光中绽放。

translation:
n. 扩大; 扩张; 扩张物; 膨胀物

分布：膨胀(56%)，扩展(35%)，扩充(9%)


扩张(expanse扩大,ex出+panse扩展)[-ion 1.表名词"动作或状态“2.表示"某种物,用品"]
n.扩张,膨胀;张开,伸展There are plans for the expansion of our school building.有扩大我们学校建筑的计划.



noun countable or uncountable  IMPROVER  ■when something increases in size, number or importance （尺寸、数量或重要性的）扩大，增加，扩展
•the rapid expansion of the software industry软体业的迅速发展

•Expansion into new areas of research is possible.拓展新的研究领域是可能的。

•an expansion of industry工业的发展




n. 膨胀；阐述；扩张物
 - inflation, exposition
examples: (1) Metals undergo expansion when heated.(2) The thermostat is based on the fact that different metals have different coefficients of expansion.(3) His economic policies paved the way for industrial expansion.(4) The time has come for the firm to consolidate after several years of rapid expansion.(5) This book is an expansion of the play he wrote before.
(1) 金属加热时会膨胀。(2) 恒温器是以不同的金属有不同的膨胀系数这一事实为根据的。(3) 他的经济政策为工业的扩展铺平了道路。(4) 公司经过几年的迅速发展之後，该整顿一下了。(5) 这本书是他以前写的剧本的扩充。

translation:
vt. 期望; 预料; 要求; 认为（某事）会发生
vi. 预期; 期待; 怀胎; 怀孕

时态：expected, expecting, expects
分布：期待(50%)，预期(37%)，盼望(13%)


→ex-, 向外。-spect, 看，词源同spectator, telescope. 即向外看，向前看。
期待,盼望(ex出+spect→看出去→期待)[spect,spic=look,see,表示"看"]
v.预料,预期;期望,指望My wife is expecting.我的妻子不久要生孩子了.



verb THINK  想   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to think or believe something will happen, or someone will arrive 预料，预计；期待
•We are expecting a lot of applicants for the job.我们预计会有很多人来应征这份工作。

•[+ (that)] I expect (that) you'll find it somewhere in your bedroom.我想你会在你的卧室找到它。

•I expect (that) he'd have left anyway.我想无论怎么说他都已经离开了

•[+ to infinitive] He didn't expect to see me.他没有预料到会遇见我。

•The financial performance of the business is fully expected (= almost certain) to improve.公司的财务状况确定会大有改观。

•We were half expecting you not to come back.我们原本一直以为你不会回来了。
(only) to be expected ■normal and what usually happens 在预料之中；并不意外
•All parents of small children get tired. It's to be expected.所有照顾幼儿的父母都会非常累，这是可以预见的。

[ɪk'spekt] verb DEMAND  要求  transitive ■to think that someone should behave in a particular way or do a particular thing 要求；期望
•I expect punctuality from my students.我要求我的学生守时。

•[+ to infinitive] Borrowers are expected to (= should) return books on time.借书者应该按时归还图书。

[ɪk'spekt] verb BE PREGNANT  怀孕  be expecting (a baby) ■to be pregnant 怀孕；有孕在身
•She shouldn't be lifting those boxes if she's expecting.如果有孕在身，她就不应该搬这些箱子。

•Kate and Dom are expecting a baby.凯特和多姆快有孩子了。





expect, urge, promise, intend

expect: 要求，指望
urge: 敦促，力劝（某人做某事）
promise: 承诺，答应，保证
intend: 打算，计划，想要（做某事）



expect, anticipate

expect: 怀着确信之心来期待；
anticipate: 怀着喜悦或痛苦之心来预想



expect, desire, wish, long, want, hope

这组词都有“希望”的意思，其区别是：
expect: 通常指有很大程度的把握，但仍含有预料之意，或预计某事或某行动的发生。
desire: 语气较正式庄重，着重渴望的力量与热切，常含有强烈的意图和目的。
wish: 语气较弱，多指难于实现或不可能实现的愿望。
long: 语气强，指极殷切地盼望着，这种盼望侧重于很难或不可能得到的东西。有时也指一般愿望，但含一定感情色彩。
want: 一般指所想要的东西是切望得到的东西，能弥补实际需要。
hope: 指对愿望实现有一定信心的希望。


vt. 期望；指望；认为；预料
 - promise oneself, guess, find, feel, make
vi. 期待；预期
 - look foward to, to look forward to
examples: (1) This is what we expect to happen.(2) He is expected to get through to the finals.(3) At last they got the telegram they had been expecting.
(1) 这就是我们所预期将会发生的。(2) 我们期待他进入决赛。(3) 最后他们收到了他们盼望的电报。

translation:
n. 期待; 预期; 前程; [数]期望值

分布：期望(89%)，预料(11%)


→来自expect,预期。
期待,希望(expect+ation)[spect,spic=look,see,表示"看"]
n.预期,期望,指望It's our expectation that you will be the best.我们期望你成为最好的.



noun  IMPROVER  countable usually plural ■when you expect good things to happen in the future 期盼；盼望；希望
•The holiday lived up to all our expectations (= was as good as we were expecting).假期过得一点也没有令我们失望。

•I have high expectations for this job (= I believe it will be good).我对这份工作有很高期望。

•We did so well - beyond all (= better than) our expectations.我们做得非常好——远远超出我们的预期。

•I think she had unrealistic expectations of motherhood.我觉得她对当妈妈的憧憬有些不切实际。
 IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■when you expect something to happen 预料，预期；期待
•Considering the injuries he's had there can be little expectation of him winning the race.考虑到他的伤势，他赢这场比赛的希望不大。

•Our expectations are that the UK will cut its interest rate.我们预计英国会调降利率。
against/contrary to all expectations ■different from what is expected 出乎所有人的预料；意想不到的是
•Contrary to all expectations, she was accepted by the academy.意想不到的是，她竟然被学院取录了。





outlook, expectation, prospect, hope

这组词都有“期望，指望”的意思，其区别是：
outlook: 多指根据征兆或分析对要发生的事情的愿望或预料。
expectation: 指期待某事发生或假设某事能发生，多含揣想的意味。
prospect: 与outlook的含义相近，但侧重对成功、利润和舒适生活等方面的期待。
hope: 通常指建立在愿望基础上的期待。这种期待有可能发生或实现，但也可能相反。


n. 期待；预期；指望
 - Prospects, looking forward to, be
examples: (1) It is really out of my expectation.(2) His parents have great expectations for his future.(3) She had high expectations of what university had to offer.
(1) 这真是出乎我的意料。(2) 他父母对他的前途深寄厚望。(3) 她对大学所能给她提供的一切期望很高.

translation:
n. 费用; 花费的钱; 消耗; 花钱的东西
vt. 向…收取费用; 把…作为开支勾销

分布：费用(63%)，代价(19%)，花费(18%)


→来自expend, 花费。
n.花费,消费,消耗The immense expense in condensing the steam made me tense.凝结蒸汽的巨大开支使我感到紧张.



noun  ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■when you spend or use money, time or effort 花钱；支付；耗费
•Buying a bigger car has proved to be well worth the expense.事实证明，买辆大一点的车还是值得的。

•We've just had a new garage built at great expense.我们刚用了很多钱盖一座新车库。

•We went on holiday at my father's expense (= he paid for it).我们去度了假，一切费用由我父亲支付。

•It's silly to go to the expense of (= spend money on) buying new clothes when you don't really need them.花钱去买你并不真正需要的新衣服是很傻的。
 ESSENTIAL  countable ■something which causes you to spend money 花钱的东西（或缘由）；开销
•Our biggest expense this year was our summer holiday.我们今年最大的开支就是暑期渡假。

•We need to cut down on our expenses.我们必须缩减开支。
expenses [plural] ■money that you spend when you are doing your job, that your employer will pay back to you （向雇主报销的）业务费用，开支，花销
•I need to get my expenses approved.我要去办核销手续。

•UK Don't worry about the cost of lunch - it's on expenses.不要担心午餐用多少钱——这是可以报销的。

[ɪk'spents] noun all expenses paid ■If something is all expenses paid, it means that you do not have to pay for anything yourself 一切费用已付的；别人支付的；免费的
•She's going on a trip to New York, all expenses paid.她将要去纽约旅行——免费的。

•an all expenses paid trip to New York免费去纽约旅行

[ɪk'spents] noun at the expense of sb (also at sb's expense) ■making another person look silly 捉弄（某人），戏弄（某人）；拿（某人）开心
•Would you stop making jokes at my expense?你不要再戏弄我了，好不好？

[ɪk'spents] noun blow/hang the expense UK informal ■used for saying that you want something so much that you do not care how much it costs 不用理会用多少钱，不在乎用多少钱
•I'm going to book a holiday. Blow the expense!我要预约渡假。才不管会用多少钱呢！

[ɪk'spents] noun no expense is spared ■If no expense is spared in arranging something, a lot of money is spent to make it extremely good 不惜重金；不惜代价
•No expense was spared in making the guests feel comfortable.为了使客人住得舒适不惜重金。





fee, expense, price, charge, fare, cost

这组词都有“价格，费用”的意思，其区别是：
fee: 指上学、求医以及找律师等付的费用，还可指会费、借书费等。
expense: 常指实际支付的费用总数额，有时也指钱的花费。
price: 指商品在市场出售的价格，尤指卖方对商品所提出的单价。比喻意义指付出的代价。
charge: 指提供服务时索取的费用，也指货物的价格、价钱。
fare: 侧重指旅行时所付的车、船费等费用。
cost: 指生产某东西的成本，也泛指商品的价格，可与price换用。


n. 损失，代价；消费；开支
 - consumption, losing, price, cost, disadvantage
examples: (1) It's too much of an expense for me to own a car.(2) Societies should try to save every plant and animal species, regardless of the expense to humans in effort, time, and financial well-being.(3) Don't involve yourself in unnecessary expense.(4) He finished the job at the expenses of his health.(5) That's why a reduction in price can never be made at the expense of quality.
(1) 对我来说，拥有一辆汽车的花费太大。(2) 社会应尽力挽救每一动植物物种,不管花费多少人力、时间和财力。(3) 勿做不必要的花费。(4) 他以牺牲健康完成了这项工作。(5) 正因为如此,降低价格的同时,并不能以牺牲质量为代价。

translation:
adj. 昂贵的，花钱多的; 豪华的

分布：昂贵的(94%)，高价的(6%)


昂贵的(ex+pens+ive→要花钱的→昂贵的)[pend,pens,pond=weight,expend,表示"称重量,称银子",引申为"花费"]
a.花费的,昂贵的I spend money on expensive things endlessly; so the expenditure trends up.我无休止地花钱买昂贵的东西,所以开支趋向上升.



adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■costing a lot of money 昂贵的；用钱多的；价格高的
•Rolls Royces are very expensive.劳斯莱斯汽车价格昂贵。

•Big houses are expensive to maintain.大房子的维修费很高。

•She has expensive tastes (= she likes things that cost a lot of money).她喜欢昂贵的东西。





expensive, dear, costly

这组词都有“高的，昂贵的”的意思，其区别是：
expensive: 指物品的价格超过了它本身所值，或超过了购买者的支付能力。
dear: 侧重指要价过高，或远高于公道、合理的价格，其反义词是cheap。
costly: 指物品价格高，通常是因物品稀少或珍贵所致。


adj. 昂贵的；花钱的
 - rich, dear, costly
examples: (1) The dress is too expensive for me to buy.(2) A cheaper camera is not always inferior to a more expensive one.(3) This set of crystal wine cups is very expensive.(4) The overhead costs are ridiculously expensive.(5) It is more expensive to go by plane than by boat.
(1) 那衣服太昂贵，我买不起。(2) 廉价照相机的质量并总不比昂贵的差。(3) 这套水晶玻璃酒杯非常昂贵。(4) 日常开支太高了。(5) 坐飞机去比坐船去的费用更高一些。

translation:
n. 经验，体验; 经历，阅历
vt. 亲身参与，亲身经历; 感受; 发现

时态：experienced, experiencing, experiences
分布：经验(51%)，经历(26%)，体验(20%)，感受(3%)


→来自experiment, 实验。
经验,经历(ex出+per+ience→尝试出来的东西→经验)[per=try,表示"尝试"]
n./vt.经验;经历;体验;阅历He has not much experience in programming.他没多少编程的经验.



US [-'spɪr.i-/ note_panel noun  ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■(the process of getting) knowledge or skill from doing, seeing or feeling things 经验；经历；实践
•Do you have any experience of working with kids (= Have you ever worked with them) ?你有照顾小孩的工作经验吗？

•The best way to learn is by experience (= by doing things).最好的学习方式是在实践中学习。

•I know from experience that Tony never keeps his promises.经验告诉我，汤尼从不会信守诺言。

•I don't think she has the experience for the job (= enough knowledge and skill for it).我认为做这种工作她经验不足。

•In my experience, people generally smile back if you smile at them.据我的经验，如果你对别人微笑，他们通常也会对你微笑的。

•The experience of pain (= what pain feels like) varies from one person to another.对痛的感觉是因人而异的。

•There's nothing we can do about it now, we'll just have to put it down to experience (= consider it as a mistake we can learn from).现在我们已经无计可施，只可以把它当作一次经验教训了。
 ESSENTIAL  countable ■something that happens to you that affects how you feel 经历；阅历
•I had a rather unpleasant experience at the dentist's.我有一次很不愉快的看牙医经历。

•It was interesting hearing about his experiences as a policeman.听他讲当员警时的那些经历很有趣。

•I did meet him once and it was an experience I shall never forget.我的确跟他见过一次面，那是我永生难忘的一段经历。

UK [ɪk'spɪə.ri.ənts] US [-'spɪr.i-/ note_panel noun   Common Learner Errors   experienceThe correct preposition to use after experience is of.Don't say 'experience in/on doing something', say experience of doing something :✗ I have two years' experience in working in a bank.I have two years' experience of working in a bank.
UK [ɪk'spɪə.ri.ənts] US [-'spɪr.i-/ note_panel noun   Common Learner Errors   experienceWarning:  Choose the right verb!Don't say 'make an experience', say have an experience :✗ I know several people who have made the same experience.I know several people who have had the same experience.
UK [ɪk'spɪə.ri.ənts] US [-'spɪr.i-/ note_panel verb transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■If you experience something, it happens to you, or you feel it 经历；体会到，感受到
•We experienced a lot of difficulty in selling our house.我们卖房子几经波折。

•New companies often experience a loss in their first few years.新公司在刚起步的几年中经常亏损。

•It was the worst pain I'd ever experienced.那是我这辈子受过最剧烈的痛楚。





withstand, undergo, experience, encounter

withstand: 经受，忍受
undergo: 经历（考验、苦难）
experience: 亲身体验
encounter: 遭遇，遇到遭遇或碰上棘手的事



sustain, undergo, suffer, experience

这组词都有“经历，经受，遭受”的意思，其区别是：
sustain: 指遭受痛苦或承受负担。
undergo: 多指经受艰难、痛苦、不愉快或危险等事。
suffer: 常可与sustain通用，尤指受到损害或伤害。
experience: 指亲身经受或体验某事。


n. 经验；经历；体验
 - areer
vt. 经验；经历；体验
 - suffer, live, undergo
examples: n.经验；经历v.经历；体验；感受

(1) I know from my own experience how difficult the work can be.(2) I had a singular experience in Africa.(3) The shipwreck was a harrowing experience.(4) You will experience a dream of fantasy.(5) Today I'm going to experience the slide activities.(6) He experienced a pang of sadness.
(1) 从我自己的经验我明白这项工作会有多难。(2) 我在非洲时有过一次奇特的经历。(3) 那次船难是一个惨痛的经历。(4) 你将会经历一个梦幻之旅。(5) 今天我要体验一下滑行项目。(6) 他感到一阵悲痛。

translation:
n. 实验，试验; 尝试
vi. 做实验，进行试验; 尝试

时态：experimented, experimenting, experiments
分布：实验(65%)，试验(24%)，尝试(6%)，做实验(5%)


→ex-, 向外。-per, 尝试，试验，词源同peril, empiricism.
实验(ex出+per+I+ment)[per=try,表示"尝试"]
n.实验;试验v.(on)进行实验;做试验From the experiment the experienced expert gained an unexpected expertise.有经验的专家从实验中获得一项意外技能.



noun countable or uncountable /ɪkˈsper.ɪ.mənt/ ESSENTIAL  ■a test done in order to learn something or to discover whether something works or is true 实验；试验；试用
•Some people believe that experiments on animals should be banned.有些人认为应该禁止拿动物做实验。

•[+ to infinitive] Scientists are conducting/carrying out/doing experiments to test the effectiveness of the new drug.科学家们正在做实验来检验这种新药的疗效。

•I've bought a different kind of coffee this week as an experiment (= in order to see what it is like).这个星期我买了不同牌子的咖啡来尝试。

•We can only find the best solution by experiment.我们只能摸石头过河，寻找最好的解决办法。

verb intransitive /ɪkˈsper.ɪ.ment/ ADVANCED  ■to try something in order to discover what it is like or find out more about it 进行实验；做试验；试用
•Things would never change if people weren't prepared to experiment.如果人们不愿意去尝试，事情就永远不会有转机。

•The school is experimenting with new teaching methods.这间学校正在尝试新的教学法。

•Experimenting on mice can give us an idea of the effect of the disease in humans.在老鼠身上做实验可以使我们了解这种疾病对人类的影响。





test, experiment, trial, try

这组词都有“试验”的意思，其区别是：
test: 普通用词，含义广，指用科学方法对某物质进行测试以估价其性质或效能等。
experiment: 多指用科学方法在实验室内进行较系统的操作实验以验证、解释或说明某一理论、定理或某一观点等。
trial: 指为观察、研究某事物以区别其真伪、优劣或效果等而进行较长时间的试验或试用过程。
try: 普通用词，多用于口语或非正式场合，指试一试。


vi. 尝试；进行实验
 - have a try, try one's hand
n. [试验] 实验，试验；尝试
 - stroke, proof, try, go
examples: n.试验；实验；尝试vi.尝试；做实验

(1) The researchers are repeating the experiment on rats.(2) The students will have an experiment in the laboratory tomorrow.(3) Fortunately, these folks love to experiment.(4) With Multiple Level Undo you can safely experiment with various what-if scenarios.(5) Small businesses are anxious to experiment with computers.(6) Is he any good at gardening? We might experiment with him.(7) Some scientists experiment on animals.(8) Don't experiment with such dangerous drugs.
(1) 研究人员用老鼠反覆做该试验。(2) 学生们明天要在实验室里做实验。(3) 幸运的是，你们喜欢尝试。(4) 使用多级撤消可以安全地尝试各种假设分析方案。(5) 小型企业都急于试用计算机。(6) 他擅长园艺吗? 我们可以试试他。(7) 有些科学家用动物做试验。(8) 不要用这种危险的药物做实验。

translation:
adj. 实验的; 根据实验的; 试验性的
n. 试验性的东西

分布：实验的(65%)，试验性的(20%)，实验性的(15%)


a.实验(性)的,试验(性)的The experimental farm is near the waterpower station.实验农场在水电站附近.



US [-tˌəl] adjective ■relating to tests, especially scientific ones （尤指科学方面）实验（性）的，试验（性）的，根据实验（试验）的
•The drug is still at the experimental stage (= is still being tested).这种药物仍处于试验阶段。

•The changes to the distribution system are purely experimental at the moment.目前分配体系的变革纯粹是试验性的。

•experimental psychology实验心理学




adj. 实验的；根据实验的；试验性的
 - tentative, laboratorial
examples: adj.实验的；实验性的；试验性的

(1) The technique is still at the experimental stage.(2) The experimental results bear out our supposition.(3) The result obtain differ in different experimental method.(4) This is an experimental form of teaching.(5) More studies are needed on the experimental new drug.
(1) 这项技术正处于实验阶段。(2) 实验结果证实了我们的假设。(3) 不同的试验方法所得到的结果也不同。(4) 这是一种实验性的教学形式。(5) 在试验性的新药物方面需要更多的研究。

translation:
n. 专家，能手; 权威; 行家，高手; 熟练者
adj. 专家的; （技术）熟练的; 老手; 需要专门知识（或技术）的
vt. 以专家身份研究（或检查），像专家那样研究（或检查）; 由专家审读（书籍等）
vi. 做专家工作，担任专家，成为高手（或能手）

分布：专家(94%)，能手(3%)，熟练的(2%)，内行的(1%)


→ex-, 向外。-per, 尝试，试验，词源同peril, empiricism. -t,过去分词后缀。即经历过多次的人。
n.专家,能手a.熟练的,有经验的;专门的From the experiment the experienced expert gained an unexpected expertise.有经验的专家从实验中获得一项意外技能.
【记】回忆：excerpt（n /vt 摘录）只有专家才能干的事。【反】tyro（n 新手）读：太弱



US [-spɝ:t] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a person with a high level of knowledge or skill; a specialist 专家；内行；行家
•a gardening/medical expert园艺／医学专家

•My mother is an expert at dress-making (= she does it very well).我妈妈是做裁缝的高手。

UK ['ek.spɜ:t] US [-spɝ:t] adjective [before noun]  ADVANCED  ■having or showing a lot of knowledge or skill 专家的；内行的
•The centre provides expert advice for people with financial problems.这间中心为大家提供理财方面的专业咨询。

•What's your expert opinion ?作为专家，你有甚么意见？

•an expert fisherman一个经验丰富的渔民





expert, skilled, skillful, proficient

这组词都有“熟练的”的意思，其区别是：
expert: 特指有某项专长，有某方面经验。
skilled: 通常指已掌握某行业的专业技能或手段，或已有从事某一专门工作的本领或技术。
skillful: 指在工作或操作中表现出灵巧、熟练。
proficient: 多指擅长于某事，侧重技艺或科学方面。


adj. 熟练的；内行的；老练的
 - skilled, accomplished, clever, diplomatic, practiced
n. 专家；行家；能手
 - operator, specialist
examples: n.专家；能手adj.熟练的；内行的

(1) She is a reputable expert.(2) According to expert opinions, they gave up the experiment immediately.(3) He is an expert in unarmed combat.(4) The surgeon cut away the tumour with expert skill.(5) To her expert eye, the painting was terrible.(6) Could you give me your expert advice?
(1) 她是个有声望的专家。(2) 根据专家们的意见，他们马上放弃了这项试验。(3) 他是徒手格斗的能手。(4) 外科大夫用熟练的技术把肿瘤切去。(5) 她以内行的眼光看，这幅画糟透了。(6) 你可以给我一些专业意见吗?

translation:
n. 解释; 说明; 辩解; （消除误会后）和解

分布：解释(87%)，说明(13%)


→来自explain, 解释。
n.解释,说明His explanation stands to reason.他的解释合情合理.
【参】explanatory（adj 说明的；解释性的）



noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the details or reasons that someone gives to make something clear or easy to understand 解释；说明；给出的原因
•Could you give me a quick explanation of how it works?你可以向我简要说明一下它的运作原理吗？

•What was her explanation for why she was late?她是如何解释她迟到的原因的？

•[+ that] The judge didn't believe his explanation that he had stolen the money in order to give it to charity.他解释偷钱是为了捐给慈善机构，但是法官并不相信。

•He said, by way of explanation, that he hadn't seen the traffic light change to red.他解释说他没有看到红灯亮起。





exposition, definition, description, explanation, interpretation

这组词都有“解释”的意思，其区别是：
exposition: 通常指对论点、假设、理论等的重点作详尽的阐述。
definition: 主要指对某一词、短语或专门术语的含义作解释、下定义。
description: 指对某一事物的重要方面进行详细叙述，常含教育与启迪意味。
explanation: 普通用词，指使人明白未知或不清楚的事。
interpretation: 多指对文字上较难的段落，或难于理解，令人迷惑的问题作出解释或说明。


n. 说明，解释；辩解
 - notes, interpretation, construction, legend, account
examples: (1) I made a full and frank explanation to the court.(2) What did he say in explanation of his stupid behavior?(3) There could be some psychological explanation for his bad health.(4) That's not an adequate explanation.
(1) 我对堂上直话直说,从头到尾解释了一番。(2) 他说了什么来解释他那愚蠢的行为？(3) 他的健康不佳可能有心理上的原因。(4) 这并不足以说明问题。

translation:
vi. 爆[突]发，发怒; 激增，迅速扩大
vt. （使）爆炸; 突然（发出巨响，活跃起来，迸发感情）; 推翻; 驳倒

时态：exploded, exploding, explodes
分布：爆炸(71%)，爆发(21%)，激增(3%)，使爆炸(3%)，驳倒(2%)


→ex-, 向外。-plod, 拍掌声，爆炸声，词源同implode.
爆炸(ex出+plod+e→出来大声音→爆炸)[pold=bignoise,表示"大声音"]
v.(使)爆炸,(使)爆发Bombs explode.炸弹会爆炸.



US [-'sploʊd] verb BREAK APART  破裂   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to (cause to) break up into pieces violently （使）爆炸，（使）爆破
•A bomb exploded at one of London's busiest railway stations this morning.今早一枚炸弹在伦敦最繁忙的一个火车站爆炸。

•He was driving so fast that his car tyre exploded.他的车开得太快导致爆胎。
 Compare implode
UK [ɪk'spləʊd] US [-'sploʊd] verb EMOTION  情感  intransitive ■to react suddenly with a strong expression of emotion （情感）突然迸发，爆发，突然发作
•[+ speech] "What on Earth do you think you're doing?" she exploded (= said angrily).“你究竟知不知道你在干甚么？”她大发雷霆。

•The children exploded into giggles (= suddenly started laughing uncontrollably).孩子们突然咯咯地笑起来。

UK [ɪk'spləʊd] US [-'sploʊd] verb INCREASE  增加  intransitive ■to increase very quickly 急剧扩大；激增，突增
•The population has exploded in the last ten years.在过去十年中，人口激增。

UK [ɪk'spləʊd] US [-'sploʊd] verb PROVE FALSE  证明错误  transitive ■to show something to be wrong 推翻；驳倒；破除
•This book finally explodes some of the myths about the origin of the universe.这本书最终推翻了关于宇宙起源一些毫无根据的说法。

UK [ɪk'spləʊd] US [-'sploʊd] verb   Phrasal Verbs   explode into sth ■to suddenly change into something powerful or exciting 突发；迸发
•London's parks have exploded into colour (= become very colourful because many flowers have opened) in the last week.上星期，伦敦各个公园一时之间百花怒放、姹紫嫣红。





explode, erupt, burst

这组词都有“爆炸、爆发”的意思，其区别是：
explode: 指物体爆炸而释放大量热能的一刹那。
erupt: 主要指火山的爆发，也可用作引申意义。
burst: 强调爆炸能量的突然释放和力量的突然迸发。



explode, burst, break out

explode: （炸弹）爆炸；
burst: （the ball）爆裂
break out: 爆发（战争）；


vi. 爆炸，爆发；激增
 - blow apart, burst up
vt. 使爆炸；爆炸；推翻
 - shoot, spring, blast
examples: vi.爆炸；激增；爆发vt.使爆炸；驳倒

(1) The bomb was timed to explode during the rush-hour.(2) When the boiler exploded many people were injured.(3) The firework exploded in his hand.(4) Investment in technology stocks exploded in the 1990s.(5) An active volcano may explode at any time(6) The children exploded three firecrackers.(7) Several scientific myths were exploded by Galileo's observations.
(1) 炸弹选在人最多时爆炸。(2) 因锅炉爆炸，许多人受了伤。(3) 那个爆竹在他手里响了。(4) 二十世纪九十年代的,对科技股票的投资迅速增加。(5) 活火山随时都有可能爆发。(6) 孩子们燃放了三个爆竹(7) 科学上的几种荒诞说法因伽利略的观测而被推翻。

translation:
vt. 开采; 开拓; 利用（…为自己谋利）; 剥削
n. 功绩; 功劳; 勋绩

时态：exploited, exploiting, exploits
分布：利用(52%)，开发(28%)，剥削(10%)，开拓(6%)，功绩(3%)，英勇行为(1%)


→ex-, 向外。-ploit, 卷，词源同imply, implicate. 即展开，结果，功绩。后在19世纪初由于法国空想社会主义者，尤其是圣西门用该词指剥削，压榨，使得这一词义广泛传播。
v.开拓;开发;剥削n.功绩[勋];业绩After an explosion the explorer restored the storage of the explosive in the exploiter's storehouse.爆炸过后勘探者恢复了剥削者的仓库里炸药的储量.
【记】explore（v 探险；探究）是为了exploit【参】exploitation（n 开发；剥削；宣传广告）



verb transitive /ɪkˈsplɔɪt/USE WELL  有效地用   ADVANCED  ■to use something for advantage 利用；开发；发挥
•We need to make sure that we exploit our resources as fully as possible.我们要确保尽可能充分利用资源。

verb transitive /ɪkˈsplɔɪt/USE UNFAIRLY  不正当地利用   ADVANCED  ■to use someone or something unfairly for your own advantage （出于私利）利用；剥削
•Laws exist to stop companies exploiting their employees.法律规定禁止公司剥削其员工。

noun countable usually plural /ˈek.splɔɪt/■something unusual, brave or funny that someone has done 不寻常的行为；英勇的行为；奇遇
•She was telling me about her exploits while travelling around Africa.她跟我讲述了在非洲各地旅游时的奇遇。





apply, use, avail, utilize, exploit, employ

这组词都有“使用，应用”的意思，其区别是：
apply: 指将一事物运用于另一事物之上以发挥其有效作用。
use: 普通用词，着重为达到某一目的而利用某人或某物。
avail: 通常指使用手边或就近的人或物以有利于自己。
utilize: 侧重有利可图或能达到某一实际目的。书面用词。
exploit: 强调充分利用。
employ: 指使用处于消极状态或未被用过的人或物，可以与use换用，但强调进行选择、充分利用。


vt. 开发，开拓；剥削；开采
 - develop, mine
n. 勋绩；功绩
 - merit, feat
examples: vt.剥削；利用；开发；开拓n.功绩；英勇行为

(1) The capitalists exploit the workers in order to maximize profits.(2) You must exploit all your spare time to learn English.(3) People should read the related regulations before they exploit natural resources.(4) We should look for blank parts in the market and exploit new market continuously.(5) Great men are remembered for their notable exploits.(6) The daring exploits of the soldiers were much admired.
(1) 资本家剥削工人是为了使利润最大化。(2) 你必须利用一切空闲时间来学习英语。(3) 在开发自然资源前，人们应该先了解相关的规定。(4) 我们应找准市场空白,不断开拓新市场。(5) 伟人们因其丰功伟绩而被世人铭记。(6) 战士们的英勇行为令人赞叹不已。

translation:
vi. 勘查， 探测， 勘探; [医]探查（伤处等），探索，研究
vt. 探索， 探究， 仔细查看

时态：explored, exploring, explores
分布：探究(39%)，探险(27%)，考察(21%)，探测(13%)


→ex-, 向外。-plor, 大叫，哭喊，词源同deplore. 原指猎人在打猎时通过叫声把鸟赶出山林，后词义引申为探索。
探索,钻研(ex出+plore→喊出来→探索[奥秘])[plor=cry,weep,表示"喊,哭"]
v.勘探,探测;探究,探索After an explosion the explorer restored the storage of the explosive in the exploiter's storehouse.爆炸过后勘探者恢复了剥削者的仓库里炸药的储量.
【记】ex出，plore原指为了提醒场上队员的大喊－挖出东西后的大喊－探索【参】implore（v 恳求；哀求）



US [-'splɔ:r] verb intransitive or transitive  IMPROVER  ■to search and discover (about something) 探测；勘查；探索；研究
•to explore space探索太空

•The best way to explore the countryside is on foot.在农村考察，步行是最好的方法了。

•The children have gone exploring in the woods.孩子们去树林里观察大自然了。
■to think or talk about something in order to find out more about it 仔细研究；探究，探讨
•Let's explore this issue/idea more fully.让我们进一步探讨一下这个问题／计划。





explore, track, hunt, seek

这组词都有“搜索、寻找”的意思，其区别是：
explore: 一般指对未知事物或新生事物的探索、观察与研究。
track: 侧重按一定线索追查出结果。
hunt: 一般指寻找所需的物件，或对罪犯的搜寻，特指追猎。
seek: 语义庄重，语气强，使用广。多暗示做出很大努力去寻求某人或物。


vt. 探索；探测；探险
 - detect, probe into
vi. 探索；探测；探险
 - probe into, search after
examples: (1) The experts are exploring every part of the island.(2) He had an itch to get away and explore.(3) Can you explore the market possibility for us?(4) Columbus discovered America but did not explore the new continent.(5) Let us explore the possibilities for improvement.
(1) 专家们正在勘查这个岛的各个部分。(2) 他等不及要动身去探险。(3) 您能为我们考察一下市场前景吗？(4) 哥伦布发现了美洲(5) 让我们探索改善的可能性。

translation:
n. 爆炸，炸裂; 爆发; 扩张，激增; （感情，尤指愤怒的）突然爆发

分布：爆炸(84%)，爆炸声(8%)，爆发(5%)，激增(3%)


→来自explode, 爆炸。
爆炸(explode的名词)[pold=bignoise,表示"大声音"]
n.爆炸,爆发After an explosion the explorer restored the storage of the explosive in the exploiter's storehouse.爆炸过后勘探者恢复了剥削者的仓库里炸药的储量.



US [-'sploʊ-] noun BURST  爆炸   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■when something such as a bomb explodes 爆炸；爆破；爆裂
•The fire was thought to have been caused by a gas explosion.有人认为火灾是由于煤气爆炸引起的。

•The explosion (= the intentional exploding) of nuclear devices in the Bikini Atoll was stopped in 1958.在比基尼岛进行的核爆炸试验于1958年终止。

UK [ɪk'spləʊ.ʒən] US [-'sploʊ-] noun EMOTION  情感  countable ■a sudden strong expression of emotion （情感的）突然迸发，爆发，突然发作
•There was an explosion of applause from the audience at the end of the performance.表演结束时观众席上爆发出一阵热烈的掌声。

UK [ɪk'spləʊ.ʒən] US [-'sploʊ-] noun INCREASE  增加  countable ■when the number of something increases very quickly 急剧扩大；激增，突增
•The government has had to take measures to halt the population explosion.政府不得不采取措施抑制人口激增。

UK [ɪk'spləʊ.ʒən] US [-'sploʊ-] noun FALSE IDEA  错误的观点  uncountable ■when someone or something proves that something is wrong 某事证实是错误的，推翻
•the explosion of the conspiracy theories surrounding the death of the princess公主被人施用阴谋杀害的说法被推翻了





explosion, eruption

explosion: 爆炸
eruption: 爆发，突然发作


n. [力] 爆炸；爆发；激增
 - blast, burst, detonation
examples: (1) The atomic explosion is always accompanied by huge fireball.(2) After the explosion it was some time before the town resumed its everyday routines.(3) The horse took a fright at the sound of the explosion.(4) The explosion was heard a mile away.(5) The explosion of oil prices caused an economical crisis.(6) We heard an explosion of loud laughter.
(1) 原子弹爆炸总是伴随着巨大的火球。(2) 爆炸后经过相当一段时间，这个城镇才恢复了正常的生活秩序。(3) 马听到爆炸声受了惊。(4) 那爆炸声一英里外也可以听到。(5) 石油价格的急剧上涨引起了经济危机。(6) 我们听到一阵大笑。

translation:
adj. 爆炸的; 易爆炸的; 突增的; 暴躁的
n. 爆炸物，炸药; [语言学] 爆破音

分布：炸药(98%)，引发争论的(1%)，大声的(1%)


炸药(explose爆炸)[-ive 1.表形容词2.表名词后缀,"人或物"]
a.爆炸(性)的,爆发(性)的n.爆炸物,炸药After an explosion the explorer restored the storage of the explosive in the exploiter's storehouse.爆炸过后勘探者恢复了剥削者的仓库里炸药的储量.
【参】explosion（n 爆发；爆炸（声））



US [-'sploʊ-] adjective BURST  爆炸  ■exploding or able to explode easily 易爆炸的；会爆炸的；可能引起爆炸的
•Certain gases are highly explosive.一些气体极易爆炸。

•An explosive device (= a bomb) was found at one of London's busiest stations this morning.今早在伦敦一个最繁忙的火车站发现一枚炸弹。
■very loud and sudden, like an explosion 如爆炸般的；震耳欲聋的
•There was an explosive clap of thunder overhead.突然一个轰隆声在头顶炸开。

UK [ɪk'spləʊ.sɪv] US [-'sploʊ-] adjective EMOTION  情感的  ■describes a situation or emotion in which strong feelings are loudly or violently expressed （局势）一触即发的，爆炸性的；（情感）突然迸发的
•The situation in the poorer parts of some of America's major cities has become very explosive.在美国一些主要城市的贫民区，形势已经到了一触即发的地步。

•Capital punishment is an explosive issue.死刑是个极具争议的话题。

•She has an explosive temper.她有个很火爆的个性。

UK [ɪk'spləʊ.sɪv] US [-'sploʊ-] adjective INCREASE  增加的  ■describes an increase which is very large and quick 激增的；迅速扩大的
•The last few years have seen an explosive increase in the number of homeless people on our streets.在过去几年，无家可归流落街头的人数量激增。

UK [ɪk'spləʊ.sɪv] US [-'sploʊ-] noun countable or uncountable UK [ɪkˈspləʊ.sɪv] US [-ˈsploʊ-/■a substance or piece of equipment that can cause explosions 炸药，爆炸物；引爆装置



adj. [力] 爆炸的；爆炸性的；爆发性的
 - volatile, fulminic
n. [化工] 炸药； [力] 爆炸物
 - blasting agent, detonator
examples: adj.爆炸(性)的；引发争论的；大声的n.炸药

(1) Hydrogen is highly explosive.(2) The most impressive volcanic phenomena are explosive eruptions.(3) The question of race today is an explosive one.(4) He bent double with explosive laughter.(5) We carefully moved the explosive to another place.(6) The pillbox was blown to pieces by high explosive.(7) I warn you that the explosive can kill thousands of people.
(1) 氢极易爆炸。(2) 最令人难忘的火山现象是爆炸喷发。(3) 种族问题在今天是一个会引起激烈争论的问题。(4) 他大笑得直不起腰来。(5) 我们谨慎地把炸药转移到了另一个地方。(6) 碉堡被烈性炸药炸得粉碎。(7) 我警告你,这种炸药可以杀死成千上万个人。

translation:
vt. & vi. 出口，输出
vt. 传播，输出（思想或活动）

时态：exported, exporting, exports
分布：出口(89%)，输出(9%)，输出品(1%)，输出存储器的信息(1%)


→ex-, 向外。port, 港口。
出口(ex出+port拿,引申为港口→拿出港口→出口)[Port=carry,表示"拿,运"]
v./n.输出,出口n.出口商品The airport and seaport are important to import and export of portable goods.机场和海港对于进口和出口轻便商品很重要.



US [ˈek.spɔːrt] IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to send goods to another country for sale 出口；输出
•French cheeses are exported to many different countries.法国的起司出口到很多国家。

•Our clothes sell so well in this country that we have no need to export.我们生产的服装在本国销路很好，所以没有必要出口。
 Compare import transitive ■to put something from one country into use in other countries 把…带到另一国家；传播；输出
•American culture has been exported all over the world.美国文化已经传到世界各地。
transitive ■If you export information from a computer, you copy a large amount of it either to a different part of the computer's storage space or to another form of storage such as a floppy disk , so that it can be used for a different purpose. （将电脑讯息）导出，输出，转存
noun countable or uncountable UK [ˈek.spɔːt] US [-spɔːrt] IMPROVER  ■a product that you sell in another country, or the business of sending goods to another country in order to sell them there 出口；出口商品；出口业务
•Coffee is one of Brazil's main exports.咖啡是巴西主要的出口货品之一。

•We plan to increase our exports over the next five years.我们计划在今后5年内增加出口。

•The export of ivory is now strictly controlled.现在，象牙出口受到严格控制。

•India grows tea for export.印度种植茶叶以供出口。

•We are planning to develop our export market/trade.我们正计划拓展我们的出口市场／贸易。




n. 输出， [贸易] 出口；出口商品
 - output, exit
vt. 输出， [贸易] 出口
 - output, bulk out
examples: n.输出；出口；输出品；输出存储器的信息v.输出；出口；带走，运走；从存储器输出信息

(1) Prohibition was laid on the export of coal.(2) The company's gearing up for the big export drive.(3) Consultancy, insurance and tourism are also parts of the export trade.(4) Export had suffered during the last six months.(5) Oil has supplanted coffee as our main export.(6) The blood can also export waste products from the tissues.(7) Africa is exporting beef to Europe.(8) They sell to the home market,but they don't export.
(1) 禁止煤炭输出。(2) 公司正为大规模输出作好准备。(3) 咨询,保险及旅游也是出口贸易的一部分。(4) 前6个月内，出口已蒙受损失。(5) 原油已经取代咖啡成为我们的主要出口货物。(6) 血液还能从身体组织里输出废物。(7) 非洲向欧洲出口牛肉。(8) 他们向国内市场销售,但不出口。

translation:
vt. 揭露，揭发; 使暴露; 使遭受; 使曝光

时态：exposed, exposing, exposes
分布：揭露(83%)，使曝光(7%)，使暴露(5%)，使面临(5%)


→ex-, 向外。-pos, 放置，词源同pose, component.即展开，引申义暴露。比较同源词exponent.
暴露(ex+plse放→放出去→暴露)[ex-①表示"出,出去"②表示"前面的,前任的"]
暴露;揭露(ex出+pose→放出来→暴露)[pos,posit=put表示"放"]
v.(to)使暴露,受到;使曝光Suppose you were exposed in the opposite position by your opponent, …假设你被对手暴露在相反的位置,....



US [-'spoʊz] verb transitive UNCOVER  暴露   IMPROVER  ■to remove what is covering something so that it can be seen 暴露；露出；使曝光
•The plaster on the walls has been removed to expose the original bricks underneath.墙上的灰泥已经抹去，露出了里面的墙砖。

•He damaged his leg so badly in the accident that the bone was exposed.他的脚在车祸中受了重伤，骨头都露了出来。

•This photograph was under-/over- exposed (= too little/too much light was allowed to reach the film).这张照片曝光不足／过度。
expose yourself ■If a man exposes himself, he shows his sexual organs in a public place to people he does not know. （男性由于病态心理在公共场合）裸露性器官，露阴
UK [ɪk'spəʊz] US [-'spoʊz] verb transitive MAKE PUBLIC  使公开   IMPROVER  ■to make public something bad or dishonest 揭露，揭发，揭穿坏事或不诚实之事：
•The review exposed widespread corruption in the police force.这篇评论文章揭露了警界盛行的腐败现象。

•The newspaper story exposed him as (= showed that he was) a liar.报纸上的这篇报道揭发他是个骗子。

UK [ɪk'spəʊz] US [-'spoʊz] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [usually passive] expose sb to sth ■to make it likely that someone will experience something harmful or unpleasant 使某人遭受（有害或不快的遭遇）；使（某人）暴露于（险境）
•About 800,000 children are exposed to poisons each year.每年有大约80万儿童中毒。

•It is feared that people living near the power station may have been exposed to radiation.人们担心居住在发电站附近的居民可能已经受到辐射。





reveal, expose, disclose, uncover

这组词都有“揭露、暴露”的意思，其区别是：
reveal: 多指揭露一直隐藏或隐秘的东西，或启示超乎常人领导能力的真理。
expose: 多指揭露丑闻、坏人坏事或各种阴谋。也可指某物暴露在外。
disclose: 侧重指揭露或泄露鲜为人知或保密的事。
uncover: 主要指移去遮盖物，让东西显露出来。也可指揭露阴谋、秘密等。


vt. 揭露，揭发；使曝光；显示
 - reveal, prove, make clear, disclose
examples: vt.揭露；使曝光；使面临；使暴露

(1) The reporter was killed because he tried to expose a plot.(2) I hate the paparazzi.They always expose the people's privacy.(3) We should not expose our children to horrors.(4) Keep indoors and don't expose your skin to the sun.(5) You shouldn't expose the soldiers to unnecessary risks.
(1) 这名记者因为试图揭露一个阴谋而被杀害。(2) 我讨厌狗仔队,他们老曝光别人的隐私。(3) 我们不应该让孩子看恐怖片。(4) 待在室内,不要把皮肤暴露在阳光下。(5) 你不应该让士兵们冒不必要的危险。

translation:
n. 暴露; 揭发; 公开; （商品等的）展出

分布：暴露(80%)，揭露(9%)，曝光时间(9%)，挨冻(1%)，胶片(1%)


n.暴露,揭露;方向;陈列;遗弃;照射量I have ten exposures left on this film.这卷胶卷我还有十张底片未拍.



US [-'spoʊ.ʒɚ] noun EXPERIENCE  经受  countable or uncountable ■when someone experiences something or is affected by it because they are in a particular situation or place 接触；面临；遭受
•You should always limit your exposure to the sun.无论甚么时候，都不要长时间晒太阳。

•Even a brief exposure to radiation is very dangerous.即使只是短期接受辐射也是非常危险的。

UK [ɪk'spəʊ.ʒər] US [-'spoʊ.ʒɚ] noun MADE PUBLIC  使公开  countable or uncountable ■when something bad that someone has done is made public 揭发；揭露
•The exposure of the minister's love affair forced him to resign.部长在风流韵事曝光后，被迫辞职。

UK [ɪk'spəʊ.ʒər] US [-'spoʊ.ʒɚ] noun ATTENTION  关注  uncountable ■when an event or information is often discussed in newspapers and on the television, etc （在报纸或电视上的）报导，宣传，曝光
•His last film got so much exposure in the press.他最新拍摄的电影受到了新闻媒体的极大关注。

UK [ɪk'spəʊ.ʒər] US [-'spoʊ.ʒɚ] noun ILLNESS  疾病  uncountable ■a serious medical condition that is caused by being outside in very cold weather （暴露于严寒而导致的）冻伤（病），受寒
•All the members of the expedition to the South Pole died of exposure.南极探险队的所有队员都死于冻伤。

UK [ɪk'spəʊ.ʒər] US [-'spoʊ.ʒɚ] noun PHOTOGRAPH  照片  countable ■a single photograph on a piece of film, or the amount of time a piece of film is open to the light when making a photograph （底片的）一张；曝光时间，曝光量
•There are twenty-four exposures on this film.这个胶卷有24张底片。

UK [ɪk'spəʊ.ʒər] US [-'spoʊ.ʒɚ] noun DIRECTION  方向  only singular ■the direction in which something faces 朝向；方向；位向
•Our dining room has a northern exposure (= faces north) , so it's rather cold.我们的饭厅是向北的，所以很冷。





exposure, printing, release, publication

exposure: 暴露，揭露，一般指不好的事情
printing: 印刷，出版
release: 释放，出版，一般用来指唱片，电影的发行，强调经过努力才得以发表
publication: 发表，公之于众


n. 暴露； [摄] 曝光；揭露；陈列
 - layout, reveal, showing
examples: n.暴露；揭露；胶片；曝光时间；(在电视、报纸等媒体上的)亮相；挨冻

(1) Exposure of the body to strong sunlight can be harmful.(2) Her skin was dry after exposure to the wind.(3) His election toppled down due to the exposure of his bribery.(4) How many exposures have you left?(5) I used a long exposure for this one.(6) Her new movie has had a lot of exposure in the media.(7) The girl is very pleased to take exposure on TV singing program.(8) He nearly died of exposure on the cold mountain.
(1) 身体受烈日暴晒会造成伤害。(2) 经过风吹后她的皮肤很干。(3) 他的竞选因为受贿被揭露而失败了。(4) 还剩多少底片没有照？(5) 我这张照片用的曝光时间长。(6) 她的新片媒体有很多报道。(7) 这个女孩对在电视歌唱节目上露面非常高兴。(8) 他在寒冷的高山上差一点没有冻死。

translation:
v. 表达; 表示; 显而易见; 快递邮寄
adj. 特快的; 迅速的; 用快递寄送的;  明确的
n. 特快列车; 快递服务
adv. 使用快速服务

时态：expressed, expressing, expresses
分布：表达(60%)，表示(22%)，快递(6%)，明确的(4%)，快车(4%)，专使(1%)，用快递(1%)，挤压出(1%)，直接的(1%)


→ex-, 向外。press, 压，推。即推出，表达。
表达;特快(ex把[思想]挤出来→表达)[press=press表示"挤压"]
v.表达,表示a.特快的,快速的n.快车,快运The man depressed by the pressure from the press expressed the impression on him.那个受到来自新闻界压力压抑的人表达了他的印象.



verb transitive SHOW  表露   ESSENTIAL  ■to show a feeling, opinion or fact 陈述；表达；表露
•Her eyes expressed deep sadness.她眼神中流露出深切的悲伤。

•I would like to express my thanks for your kindness.我想向你的善意表示衷心的感谢。

•Words can't express how happy I am.言语无法形容我的快乐。

•These figures are expressed as a percentage of the total.这些数字是用总数的百分比来表示的。
express yourself ■to communicate what you think or feel, by speaking or writing, or in some other way 表达自己（的想法或感受）
•I'm afraid I'm not expressing myself very clearly.我担心没有把意思表达清楚。

•Children often express themselves in painting.小朋友经常透过画画来表达内心的感受。

[ɪk'spres] verb transitive SEND FAST  快速送出  mainly US  to send something somewhere very quickly 快递邮寄
•Your order will be expressed to you within 24 hours.您订的货将在24小时内快递送到。

[ɪk'spres] adjective [before noun] FAST  快的  ■moving or being sent fast 快速的；快递的；特快的
•Please send this letter by express delivery.请用快递寄这封信。

•an express train特快列车

•The dry cleaners offer a normal or an express service.干洗店提供一般服务以及快洗服务。

[ɪk'spres] adjective [before noun] CLEAR  清楚的  ■clearly and intentionally stated 明确的；明白表示的；特别指出的
•It is my express wish that after my death, my books be given to my old college library.我明确表示，死后要把我的藏书捐给母校的图书馆。

•The lawyer argued that the accused had gone to the victim's house with the express purpose of killing her.律师辩道，被告到被害人家中时，怀有很明确的杀人动机。

[ɪk'spres] adverb ■using a service which does something faster than usual 以快递方式服务地
•Send this parcel express.用快件寄这个包裹。

[ɪk'spres] noun countable ■a train or bus that takes less time to do a journey than other trains or buses 快车
•The quickest way to get here is to take the uptown express.来这里最快捷的方法就是坐从市中心开出来的特快列车。

•the Orient Express东方快车
uncountable ■a service which does something faster than usual 快递服务
•This parcel needs to be sent by express.请用快递寄这封信。





specific, explicit, definite, express

这组词都有“明确的”的意思，其区别是：
specific: 强调内容明确，毫不抽象、笼统。
explicit: 指清楚明白，毫不含糊其辞，因而无任何理解困难。
definite: 指对所提到的事的范围及其细节毫无疑问，含有明确和确定界限的意味。
express: 语气较强，较正式，指不但清楚明确，而且含有直截了当和有力等的意思。


vt. 表达；快递
 - voice, put
adj. 明确的；迅速的；专门的
 - precise, decided, technical, rapid, specific
n. [交] 快车，快递，专使；捷运公司
 - rapido, flier
examples: n.快车；快递；专使adj.明确的；急速的；直接的adv.用快递vt.表达；表示；挤压出；快递

(1) The express is as swift as an arrow.(2) We have to change here for an express.(3) I sent the letter by express.(4) Important documents will be sent by express.(5) Is there an express checkout service?(6) It is the most direct way to approach the transcendental state and the most subtle way to express spiritual energy in audible form.(7) The parcel was sent express.(8) Many theologies express the same ideas.(9) I wish to take this opportunity to express my heartfelt gratitude to you again.(10) The writer expresses his love for his motherland in his novels.(11) As soon as I receive payment I will express the book to you.

(1) 快车似箭一般地飞驶。(2) 我们必须在这里换乘快车。(3) 我这封信寄的是快递。(4) 重要文件会以快递寄出。(5) 有没有快速退房手续的服务(6) 这是接近超自然状态最直接的方式，也是用声音来表达灵性能量最精微的方法。(7) 这包裹是用快邮寄的.(8) 许多宗教理论表达同一种思想。(9) 我借此机会再一次地向大家表示衷心的感谢。(10) 作者在小说中表达出他对祖国的爱。(11) 我一收到付款就会将书快递给你。

translation:
n. 表现，表示，表达; 表情，脸色，态度，腔调，声调; [数]式，符号; 词句，语句，措辞，说法

分布：表达(55%)，表情(26%)，表现(8%)，表示(6%)，措辞(3%)，词句(1%)，挤压(1%)


→来自express,表达，印象，-ion,名词后缀。
表达;表情(express+ion)[press=press表示"挤压"]
n.表达;表情;声调;腔调;榨出;措词;式;符号I noticed a swift change of expression in his face.我注意到他脸上的表情很快地变化.



noun SHOWING  表示   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■when you say what you think or show how you feel using words or actions 表示；表达；表露
•He wrote her a poem as an expression of his love.他写了一首诗给她以表达爱慕之情。

•We've received a lot of expressions of support for our campaign.我们收到很多来信表示支持我们的运动。

•Freedom of expression is a basic human right.言论自由是基本的人权。

•It's better to give expression to (= show) your anger, rather than hiding it.最好可以把愤怒发泄出来，而不是藏于心里。

•formal His sadness at the death of his wife found expression (= was shown) in his music.他透过音乐表达了对亡妻的哀悼之情。

•She plays the violin with great expression (= feeling).她的小提琴演奏有很好的表现力。
 ESSENTIAL  countable ■the look on someone's face, showing what they feel or think 表情；神色
•I could tell from her expression that something serious had happened.一看她的面色就知道出了很严重的事情。

•Mark always has such a miserable expression on his face.马克脸上经常带着一副苦恼的神情。

[ɪk'spreʃ.ən] noun WORDS  词语   ADVANCED  countable ■a word or group of words used in a particular situation or by particular people 词；词语；措词
•He uses a lot of unusual expressions.他总是用很多生僻的字眼。

•'A can of worms' is an expression which means 'a difficult situation'.这个俚语的意思是“棘手的局面”。

[ɪk'spreʃ.ən] noun NUMBERS  数字  countable ■in mathematics, a symbol or group of symbols which represent an amount （数学中的）式，表达式
•4xy 2 is an expression.4xy2 是一个表达式。




n. [数] 表达，表示；表情； [遗] 表现力；措辞
 - utterance, representative of
examples: n.表情；表示；表达；词句；措辞；表现；挤压

(1) He always shows a doleful expression.(2) She gave expression to her sadness.(3) The scenery was beautiful beyond expression.(4) I haven't heard that expression before.(5) The colloquial word is a word or expression often used in informal speech.(6) Art has different forms of expression.
(1) 他总是露出忧郁的表情。(2) 她流露出了悲伤之情。(3) 那风景美丽得无法形容。(4) 我以前从未听到过这个词语。(5) 俗语是在非正式讲话时常用的字或措辞。(6) 艺术有多种不同的表现形式。

translation:
vt. & vi. 延伸; 扩大; 推广
vt. 伸展; 给予; 延长; 发出（邀请、欢迎等）
vi. 伸出; 延伸; 增加

时态：extended, extending, extends
分布：延长(35%)，扩展(32%)，延伸(20%)，伸展(5%)，提供(5%)，使竭尽全力(3%)


→ex-, 向外。-tend, 延伸，词源同tend, tense.
延展,扩张(ex出+tend→伸出去→扩张)[tend,tent,tens=stretch表示"伸展"]
v.延长,延伸;扩充;给予;提供;估价The tension tends to extend to a more extensive extent.紧张倾向于向更广泛的程度扩展.
【记】ex出，tend伸－伸出－延长；扩大【参】extension（n 延长；范围）【反】abbreviate（v 缩写；缩短）



verb REACH  延伸   IMPROVER  transitive intransitive usually + adverb or preposition ■to (cause something to) reach, stretch or continue; to add to something in order to make it bigger or longer （使）延伸；（使）持续，延续；（使）扩大；（使）延长
•The Sahara Desert extends (= reaches) for miles.撒哈拉沙漠延绵几百英里。

•The path extends (= continues) beyond the end of the road.这条小路一直通到大路尽头很远的地方。

•Rain is expected to extend to (= reach) all parts of the country by this evening.预计今天傍晚之前的降雨范围会扩大到全国各个地区。

•The effects of this legislation will extend (= reach) further than the government intends.这项立法所产生的影响将比政府预期的更为深远。

•We've extended a washing line (= made it reach) between two trees in the garden.我们在花园里两棵树之间绑了一条晾衣的绳索。

•We're planning to extend our publishing of children's books (= increase it).我们正计划扩展儿童图书的出版业务。

•He extended his hand as a greeting (= held out his hand for someone to shake it).他伸出手表示欢迎。

•The government has produced a series of leaflets designed to extend (= increase) public awareness of the dangers of AIDS.政府印发了一系列传单，旨在加强大众对爱滋病危害的认识。

•We have plans to extend our house (= to make it bigger).我们计划扩建房屋。

•The pub has recently extended its opening hours (= made them longer).酒吧最近延长了营业时间。

•I need to extend my visa (= make it last longer).我的签证需要延期。

[ɪk'stend] verb OFFER  提供  transitive slightly formal ■to offer or give 提供；给予
•I should like to extend my thanks to you for your kindness.对您的好意我谨致以衷心感谢。

•The chairperson extended a warm welcome to the guest speaker.主席向特别邀请的演讲者表示热烈欢迎。

•The government is extending (= giving) aid to people who have been affected by the earthquake.政府正在为地震受灾居民提供援助。

•[+ two objects] The bank has agreed to extend us money/extend money to us (= lend us money) to buy our house.银行已经同意提供我们购屋的贷款。

[ɪk'stend] verb INCLUDE  包括  intransitive + adverb or preposition ■to include or affect someone or something 包括；影响到；适用于
•Parking restrictions do not extend to disabled people.停车限制不适用于残障人士。

•Her new-found tolerance does not extend to single mothers.她近来培养出一颗包容之心，可是对单身母亲仍然谈不上宽容。

•The invitation did not extend to family members.获邀者不能带家属赴约。

[ɪk'stend] verb USE ABILITY  发挥才干  transitive ■to cause someone to use all their ability 使发挥才干；使尽用其才；使竭尽全力
•She feels that her job doesn't extend her enough.她觉得她的工作不能充分发挥她的才干。





raise, extend, increase, expand, inflate, add

raise: 提高
extend: (程度、长度)
increase: 增加
expand: （尺码，数量，稳定性）扩大，增加，提高
inflate: 膨胀，鼓气，涨价
add: 增加，添加



enlarge, extend, stretch, prolong, inflate, expand, increase, multiply, lengthen, add, augment, amplify

enlarge: 放大（照片）
